name: "The Hideaway" Tanunda
summary: "The Hideaway" is a lovely, fully furnished and spacious unit available in the main st of central Tanunda, in the picturesque Barossa Valley. Next to the supermarket and across the road from the restaurant 1918. Everything is at your doorstep!!
space: "The Hideaway" is a lovely, spacious unit, nestled behind a unit on the main street of Tanunda, Murray Street.  Very close to everything! There is a large queen bedroom, and a small double bedroom.
description: "The Hideaway" is a lovely, fully furnished and spacious unit available in the main st of central Tanunda, in the picturesque Barossa Valley. Next to the supermarket and across the road from the restaurant 1918. Everything is at your doorstep!! "The Hideaway" is a lovely, spacious unit, nestled behind a unit on the main street of Tanunda, Murray Street.  Very close to everything! There is a large queen bedroom, and a small double bedroom. Guests have access to:  Guests have access to the entire unit, except garage.  Fully equipped kitchen (glassware, crockery, cutlery, pots and pans), with fridge, freezer, stove, oven, dishwasher and washing machine.  Coffee, tea, sugar, milk, salt and pepper.  Large bedroom with queen sized bed. Small bedroom with Double bed. (Available for 3 + guests) Dining room. Library with books and magazines. Lounge room with TV (no Channel 2, sorry) and DVD player. (There is a DVD rental place two doors down :) Bathroom and separate toilet. Towels  Iron and Iro
neighborhood_overview: Tanunda lies in the heart of the Barossa Valley, Australia's best-known wine region and South Australia's most visited tourist destination.   Tanunda is the focal point of the Barossa. With its strong European heritage, distinctive church spiers, wineries, cafés and restaurants there is plenty to see and do in the town.  "The Hideaway " is right in the centre of Tanunda. Foodland and Priceline are right next door. There are two cafes within 100m of the unit, and a hairdresser and health food shop right opposite. 1918, one of the Barossa’s finest restaurants, is also within 100m of the unit. (Website hidden by Airbnb) Tanunda is home to the Barossa Visitor Information Centre, an ideal starting point for any visit to the Barossa, located at 66-68 Murray Street (the main street) and open seven days a week (Website hidden by Airbnb) The town also boasts a number of wineries, including Peter Lehmann Wines, Langmeil, Richmond Grove, Lambert Estate and Chateau Tanunda, with its impressive bui
notes: 1) WHERE CAN I FIND OUT ABOUT WINE TOURS, WINE CELLARS ETC? The Barossa Visitors Centre is on Murray st, not very far from The Hideaway. You can either ring or visit them. Open 7 days Monday to Friday 9am-5pm Saturday 9am-4pm Sundays and Public Holidays 10am-4pm Address: 66-68 Murray St Tanunda SA 5352 2) CAN I CHECK IN EARLY AND/OR CHECK OUT LATE? CHECK-IN: 2PM  - 9PM CHECK-OUT: 10AM or anytime before. Most of the time we only have a 4 hour window in between bookings, and there's a lot of cleaning to be done. Please forgive us if we cannot accommodate requests for late check outs/early checks ins 3) IS THERE PARKING ON THE PREMISES? Please note that there is no parking available on the premises. Street parking is free and located about 30m from the unit. Please keep this in mind when travelling in the rainier months, or if you have mobility issues.  Our other property, "The Hideaway Central" does have parking available. 4) DO YOU PROVIDE BREAKFAST? Sorry, we don't offer breakfast. In
transit: You really need a car to get to the Barossa. But once you're here, if it's nice, hire a bike and take a leisurely ride along the new fabulous bike paths that have been placed all along the Barossa.  There's really not much in the way of public transport. There is a Bus to Gawler and Angaston in front of Tanunda library.
access: Guests have access to:  Guests have access to the entire unit, except garage.  Fully equipped kitchen (glassware, crockery, cutlery, pots and pans), with fridge, freezer, stove, oven, dishwasher and washing machine.  Coffee, tea, sugar, milk, salt and pepper.  Large bedroom with queen sized bed. Small bedroom with Double bed. (Available for 3 + guests) Dining room. Library with books and magazines. Lounge room with TV (no Channel 2, sorry) and DVD player. (There is a DVD rental place two doors down :) Bathroom and separate toilet. Towels  Iron and Ironing board Foodland, Pharmacy, Newsagent and a Laundromat are a short walk away, approx. 100m distance.
interaction: Entry is via Keyless entry so there is no key hand off. After we receive your booking for The Hideaway, we send you an email with information.  We can easily be reached by mobile if you need anything :) Please enjoy your stay and make yourselves at home!
house_rules: USE OF BEDROOMS We consider each bedroom (Queen and Double) to sleep two guests. If there are two of you, but you do not wish to share a bedroom, and wish to use both bedrooms, please enquire with us and we can work out the extra charges for you.  NOISE RESTRICTIONS "The Hideaway" is a unit, and hence part of a block of units and that carries with it noise restrictions. It's  quiet at night, and the people living in the block of flats are older people who don't make any noise themselves, so if any noise is made, it really carries. During the day is fine, but we ask all our quests to be please keep all noise to a minimum after 7pm. We ask that guests wanting to book The Hideaway to please note that we can't accept check ins later than 9pm in respect to the other units.  SMOKING AND PETS No smoking and no pets thank you. CHECK IN Check-in between 2pm - 9pm (Please see NOISE RESTRICTIONS above) Check-out by 10am. PARKING We ask guests to park on the street - its free and ample. The street

name: Pembury Homestead Barossa Valley
summary: Pembury Estate built in 1905 is situated on 10 acres. Your room has a comfortable queen bed, is charming & spacious with tall ceilings only 5 minutes walk into historic Angaston in the Barossa Valley.
space: We are in the heart of the Barossa Valley. Our home is in a prime location for travelers! Set on the edge of the town of Angaston we live in a 1905 blue stone homestead built for one of the Salter family  sons of Saltram wines Our 10 acre property has 1 acre of vines, we have sheep and alpacas and 2 dogs You have a lovely large room, a quiet environment, and as hosts we do our best to welcoming you and are sensitive to your privacy need Our blue stone homestead, has four bedrooms with a kitchen, lounge, combined laundry / large bathroom. It is centrally heated and we find we do not require cooling due to the stone walls, but there is a fan for summer in case we have a heat wave. We are used to sharing our home with others, as we have been providing accommodation for the last 2 years with vintage casuals working short term in wineries for vintage. You will find us to be relaxed, friendly and happy to have you stay with us. We love our house and hope you will too. We look forward to answ

Your room has a comfortable queen bed, is charming & spacious with tall ceilings only 5 minutes walk into historic Angaston in the Barossa Valley. We are in the heart of the Barossa Valley. Our home is in a prime location for travelers! Set on the edge of the town of Angaston we live in a 1905 blue stone homestead built for one of the Salter family  sons of Saltram wines Our 10 acre property has 1 acre of vines, we have sheep and alpacas and 2 dogs You have a lovely large room, a quiet environment, and as hosts we do our best to welcoming you and are sensitive to your privacy need Our blue stone homestead, has four bedrooms with a kitchen, lounge, combined laundry / large bathroom. It is centrally heated and we find we do not require cooling due to the stone walls, but there is a fan for summer in case we have a heat wave. We are used to sharing our home with others, as we have been providing accommodation for the last 2 years with
neighborhood_overview: Angaston is a quiet heritage town. A town walk is a must. We are middle of the Barossa Valley close to the famous Barossa Farmers Market that is open every Saturday morning Though we are set in a beautiful location with views up the valley overlooking vineyards and paddocks with ancient gums. We are only 5 minutes’ walk to a variety of the Barossa's top restaurants, pubs and cafes. As well as the butcher bakery, supermarket and pharmacy. We are also right next to the walking/bike track that will take you into Angaston, Nuriootpa and now all the way to Gawler.  There are a couple of cellar doors and restaurants in Angaston within walking distance as well as many cellar door options throughout the valley. Angaston is 8km from Tanunda and 7 km from Nuriootpa As there is no public transport so a car is a must. Other options are booking a personalised vineyard tour, or utilising the local taxi service.
transit: Located one hour from Adelaide, the Barossa Valley is a truly fantastic location to explore the best of the regions wines.  Angaston is just 8km from Tanunda and 7 km from Nuriootpa 5 minute walk into Angaston Bike/walking track, bike hire available at the hardware store 5 minute walk The town of Angaston offers you access to an amazing variety of cafes, bars, restaurants, cheese shop award winning Schultz butcher, bakery, supermarket, pharmacy and any time fitness gym, as well as 2 ATMs
access: YOUR PRIVATE ROOM (4 x 4.5 meter) comes with: Comfortable queen bed, fresh and clean linen and towels  (option for extra single mattress for a 3rd person)  central heating , flat screen TV, desk, full length mirror, free wifi, cupboard and ample space for suitcases  Shared large bathroom/ shower and toilet Shared kitchen facilities and cookware, dishwasher, washing machine, living room, bathroom, Milk and  tea available. Please treat the space like it's your own, we want you to have a great time. We will give you a key so you have the freedom to come and go as you please.
interaction: We will be sharing the living room, kitchen and bathroom. However we are social and busy people and tend to spend quite a lot of time out, so you will often have the house to yourself, but we may also have friends around from time to time. Enjoy a drink overlooking the garden, gum trees and neighbouring vines. We have plenty of off-street parking and are situated close to the walking/bike track that is very popular with cyclists and walkers alike. Surrounding the house is 10 acres to enjoy walking and exploring. There is also a shared large bathroom with a bath, shower and hand basin and toilet  Being local we have a wealth of local knowledge we are happy to share and help guests get the most out of their stay. We can give you local tips on going out, dining, and are up to date with what’s going on in town. We don’t mind sharing what we know, but we can also be as hands off as you want. Jonathan runs a tour business Barossa Taste Sensations and therefore has a wealth of knowledge to he
house_rules: Treat our home the same way you would treat your own. We are power and water conscious.  We appreciate most guests will respect our property, however so there are no misunderstandings please note the following  Only a few house rules...  - Respect each other's belongings/properties  - Turn off any unused electrical appliances you have switched on  - No smoking inside, Smoking outside please, Smoking is permitted on the verandah but not inside.  - We prefer guests to talk to us first before inviting other friends over  - We are happy to have a book in time that suits our guests if check-in is later than 10pm, please kindly notify us  24hrs ahead of time  - If any significant damages is made by Guest during the stay, then Guest may be liable for additional cost of repair -We're friendly if you want interaction or unobtrusively discreet if you'd prefer.

name: Barossa Old Garage BnB
summary: Step back in time to the 50s -60s. Unique luxury fully self contained 2 bedrooms & bathrooms accommodating up to 6 people. Emulates an American diner with all the mod cons. If you love playing records or pinball this is place for you! Sole occupancy.
space: Once you turn the key to this luxury Barossa accommodation, you’ll step back in time to the 50s and 60s when life was simpler and the world was black, white, red and chrome. Every room features an eclectic mix of 50s and 60s Americana to capture the unique style of the era of Rock and Roll, but you’ll still enjoy all the luxuries and conveniences you expect from this modern age

neighborhood_overview: While The Barossa Valley is regarded as one the world’s premier wine regions, there is plenty more on offer for you to enjoy while you relax and unwind at the Barossa Old Garage Bed and Breakfast, which is situated between the historic townships of Angaston and Nuriootpa.
notes: We offer wine tours and restaurant transfers for an additional cost . Let us show you around our backyard. So much to see and do. A bike trial across the road which meanders from Angaston to Gawler . Bikes can be hired and delivered to your accommodation
transit: Take a drive and enjoy the gorgeous scenery of the Barossa Ranges and vineyards, sample the region’s delicious cuisine at nearby award winning restaurants and gourmet stores, get your retail fix at local boutiques and antique shops and enjoy a tasting or two at the many world renowned wineries that are right on your doorstep.
access: Sole occupancy of the residence Under cover car parking
interaction: We live on the property and would be more than happy to offer you some local knowledge and places to visit.
house_rules: Please respect our property. Strictly no pets allowed Not suitable for children No smoking inside If you use additional beds and bathrooms you will be charged accordingly If excessive cleaning is needed you will be charged a minimum of $150. Any damage or breakages will be charged to your credit card.
host_about:
Love great food , enjoy listening to music from the 50s & 60s.
Would love to do Route 66 this is on my bucket list. Love meeting people.
My aim is to visit the 80 or so cellar doors in my own backyard The Barossa Valley.

name: Angels Place
summary: Our place is located centrally in the town of Tanunda; close to wineries and world class restaurants the Barossa Valley is renowned for. Walking distance to many, and a short drive in any direction to the rest.  An easy stroll to the main street which offers a delightful range of shops, cafe's, restaurants and pubs. We are just a 15 min walk to Peter Lehmann Winery; venue of the annual  'A Day On The Green' event. There are many excellent walking trails and cycling tracks in the area.
space: There are two spacious Queen Size Bedrooms, both with block-out curtains/blinds. A large living room with sofa seating for 4, Tea/coffee making facilities and bar fridge. Flat screen TV, CD Player with cds,  iPod dock, books and magazines. Extra Blankets, and pillows, ironing board, hanging space, luggage rack.  Fully ducted heating and cooling and ceiling fans to all rooms.    Private Bathroom with shower over a full length bath, and underfloor heating.  Private guest entrance off front decked area which has outdoor seating for 4, amidst lovely garden surrounds. Off street parking for two cars.  A lockable secure door separates the host's space from guest's space.  Please note...there is no kitchen.  You will find a detailed information folder, with maps, tour brochures, restaurant and taxi information.
description: Our place is located centrally in the town of Tanunda; close to wineries and world class restaurants the Barossa Valley is renowned for. Walking distance to many, and a short drive in any direction to the rest.  An easy stroll to the main street which offers a delightful range of shops, cafe's, restaurants and pubs. We are just a 15 min walk to Peter Lehmann Winery; venue of the annual  'A Day On The Green' event. There are many excellent walking trails and cycling tracks in the area. There are two spacious Queen Size Bedrooms, both with block-out curtains/blinds. A large living room with sofa seating for 4, Tea/coffee making facilities and bar fridge. Flat screen TV, CD Player with cds,  iPod dock, books and magazines. Extra Blankets, and pillows, ironing board, hanging space, luggage rack.  Fully ducted heating and cooling and ceiling fans to all rooms.    Private Bathroom with shower over a full length bath, and underfloor heating.  Private guest entrance off front decked area which
neighborhood_overview: Our street is quiet with a minimum of passing traffic.
notes: There is offstreet parking for two cars, one of them undercover.
transit: There is a good taxi service available.
access: You will have the private use of the two bedrooms, the sitting room and the bathroom. Also the outdoor seating area at the front of the house is for your enjoyment.
interaction: We are happy to provide advice and directions and assist where possible.  One of us will always try to be present to greet you on arrival, but may not always be there on departure. We will let you know where to leave the key when you go.
house_rules: Please note that at times when we are not hosting guests the bathroom is part of our home and therefore some of our personal effects are stored in the bathroom cupboards. We ask that you respect that these items are not for guest use.  There is a dedicated storage space in the bathroom marked just for guests, that contains extra toiletries and toilet paper. Unfortunately we are not able to cater for pets as family members have severe allergies. Smoking is permitted but ONLY outside.  Strictly NO parties and no extra guests over and above the 4 people the booking allows for.   - We do offer free WiFi, but much to our own frustration it is extremely slow!
host_about:
I am married 34 years to Steve, we are both in our mid 50's, and have three adult children. I am self employed work from home bookkeeper for Steve's Interior Decorating business. We both love going to live music venues/festivals, he loves gardening and I love gardens. We enjoy tropical holidays, beaches, cycling, drinking wine and travelling in general. We take lots of short holidays, and now hope to visit some locations outside of Australia too. 
In our two years of hosting we have met many wonderful people and it continues to be a very positive experience.

name: Naimanya Cottage Bed & Breakfast
summary: Naimanya Cottage is situated in the Barossa Ranges, ten minutes drive from Tanunda and Angaston. This 19thC attached cottage has been tastefully restored and is comfortable and homely. It is sole occupancy with own private entrance and facilities. Breathtaking views of Flaxman's Valley overlooking vineyards. The cottage has two bedrooms - one queen size brass bed and the other with two single beds. Lounge room has a TV and open fireplace. Daily breakfast provisions included.
description: Naimanya Cottage is situated in the Barossa Ranges, ten minutes drive from Tanunda and Angaston. This 19thC attached cottage has been tastefully restored and is comfortable and homely. It is sole occupancy with own private entrance and facilities. Breathtaking views of Flaxman's Valley overlooking vineyards. The cottage has two bedrooms - one queen size brass bed and the other with two single beds. Lounge room has a TV and open fireplace. Daily breakfast provisions included.
host_about: I live in Flaxman Valley in South Australia ,part of the Barossa Valley. I'm in my late 50's  and work as a Winemaker . We live on a cattle ,sheep, vineyard property. We have been running our B&B for 20 years . I enjoy meeting people from all walks of life and sharing our small part of a very beautiful area with them. I enjoy reading Australiana Books , cooking , wine, gardening and I speak fluent German.

name: Creeve Roe-Come and enjoy the view
summary: Creeve Roe has wonderful rural views, close to Tanunda and Lyndoch.  It is a great place to relax and unwind with friends with plenty of wineries, cafes and restaurants nearby.
space: Creeve Roe is a contemporary open plan home, with accommodation for 6 people, is set in the picturesque Barossa Valley, with views of rolling farmland, trees and hills from each of its panoramic windows.  Set on its own 40 acres, Creeve Roe provides privacy and relaxed living style within 10 minutes of some of the best vineyards and winemakers in Australia.  The wineries span the valley between the quaint towns of Tanunda, Lyndoch and Angaston providing easy access to their shops, galleries, restaurants and home grown produce.  Creeve Roe is also just 10 minutes from Gawler a thriving country town and a further 45 minute drive will have you in the state's capital city of Adelaide, renowned for its festivals, restaurants and twinkling city lights.  South Australian weather is most frequently fine with hot dry summers and mild winters.  The Barossa Valley is slightly cooler than the Adelaide plains and Creeve Roe's breezes, wide opens skies, sunsets and starry nights are wonderful.  The

interaction: I'll meet you on arrival and/or be available by phone to answer any enquiries or provide any assistance.
house_rules: Absolutely no smoking in the house or on the property. No pets in the house or on the property. No parties without prior agreement.
host_about: I'm semi retired in my mid 60s, with a fabulous lifelong partner, and I'm a proud Nan or Rob to 8 gorgeous grannies.  We're bush campers, world travellers, tree planters and blessed with good health and wonderful family and friends.

name: Treasured Memories Cottage offer 3 bedrooms 1 bath
summary: Treasured Memories Cottage offers 3 bedrooms, 1 bathroom walking distance to the main street of Tanunda to visit restaurants/cafes, local shops and a couple of wineries. Circa 1890's stone cottage with spa, open wood fire, all in the heart of the Barossa. We offer 3 bedrooms, 2 kings 2 singles, full kitchen facilities, laundry, enclosed backyard, also ideal for families to enjoy. Complimentary WiFi  Why not book one of our wine and sightseeing tours with our business Tour Barossa/Getaways SA.
space: There are three bedrooms, the third bedroom requires access from the second bedroom. Children are very welcome to stay at our property, and can provide cot's and highchairs, also a pram if needed (upon prior request) Tanunda has some wonderful restaurants, cafes and some great wineries to walk to, too.

neighborhood_overview: Tanunda where our property is located is a lovely community, one of the main towns in the Barossa Valley. We are located a short stroll to the main street of Tanunda, access to shopping, cafes, some wineries, restaurants and the local foodland open 7 days. The cottage is located in historic Goat Square.
transit: We are also Tour Barossa and Getaways SA so would love to offer our award winning wine tours to all the regions, can also arrange airport transfers and restaurant transfers.
access: Walk to shops, cafes and wineries and brewery, also access to our facilities of arranging our award winning tours to complete the package.  We can also arrange onsite relaxation massages.  We also have a strict no Party Policy, we are located in a neighbourhood and need to respect our community with no excessive noise levels
interaction: We also operate our own award winning tours of the Barossa, Adelaide Hills, Clare, McLaren Vale and Adelaide, so we love to help our guests organise special touring options. We can also organise wine tours, restaurant transfers and airport transfers. Also advising travellers on local restaurants, cafes and attractions.
host_about: love travel, love creating wonderful experiences, love wine, love food, love my 3 children

name: Barossa Idyll Studio
summary: Barossa Idyll  Studio is located in the centre of the Barossa in Tanunda a short walk to cafes and restaurants. A small, cosy haven; the Studio is attached to Barossa Idyll. With beautiful lawns and gardens, this is set in amongst magnificent Barossa vineyard and hills views.
space: Barossa Idyll Studio is small and cosy but beautifully appointed with a Queen bed , and quality linen. There is a  brand new bathroom with a double vanity and rain shower.  Fully air conditioned and with apple TV for movies also. Great for romantic stays. The studio is set in a lovely gardened area. Walking distance to beautiful café breakfasts! *Mid week special* discount price as listed for minimum two night booking- weekends at full price

neighborhood_overview: Barossa Idyll is located in the centre of the Barossa in the main street of Tanunda. There are  cafes , hotels and restaurants within in a few minutes walking distance . There are many wineries a short drive away. The Barossa Visitor Centre is also located in Tanunda.
notes: As this is a Studio there are no breakfast provisions or cooking facilities, however tea and coffee making facilities are provided with a small bar fridge. There are also several cafes open early within a few minutes walk for fantastic breakfasts. We ask that you park in the driveway and not the lawns please.
access: Barossa Idyll Studio is attached to but private from Barossa Idyll. There is a private entrance with a No. 3 beside the door and a designated car park at the front of the Studio. To the side of the Barossa Idyll Studio is a private garden area with deck chairs for lounging and a small table and chairs  to enjoy a meal or a coffee .
interaction: I am contactable by phone for any queries during your stay.
house_rules: We ask that you respect the privacy of any other guests at the time of your stay. This is a no smoking Studio and it is not suitable for pets. Please respect Barossa Idyll as your own home , damage to our property will be charged for as will any excessive cleaning. Check out is by 11am on the day of departure unless other arrangements have been made with us.
host_about: Our family has had many wonderful experiences travelling in other countries and I would love to share the experience of our regions with you. Living between the vineyards and the coast we are able to share the lifestyle of both with our guests.

name: Sharay's Barossa Retreat
summary: Luxury, self contained accommodation, located in Tanunda. With up to to 4 bedrooms available, comfortably accomodating up to 9 people, this house is perfect for couples, families or groups of friends. The house is situated in Langmeil Estate, 5 minutes walking distance of Peter Lehmann Wines and Langmeil Winery, making it the perfect location for A Day on the Green events.
space: Luxurious 4 bedroom house in Tanunda with open plan kitchen, dining and family area with views of the pool and access to both alfresco and Bali hut areas. Formal lounge with combustion heater, which can be closed off to other areas. Master bedroom with King bed, WIR and ensuite, with 2 person spa. Remaining 2 bedrooms with built in robes and 1xQueen 1x King beds. 4th bedroom with tri-bunk bed. Ducted reverse cycle air-conditioning and ceiling fans. Paved alfresco area with downlights and ceiling fan overlooking solar heated and salt chlorinated lagoon-style pool, with glass-style fencing. 8 guests is Adults. Children allowed on top of 5 Adults. Extra mattresses available, on request.  Porta-cot and high chair can be provided on request also. Guests will have full use of the house, outdoor areas and pool, no other guests or hosts, however, the rate is per couple and assumes use of the Master Bedroom. Each additional person will incur a $80/person/night fee.
description: Luxury, self contained accommodation, located in Tanunda. With up to to 4 bedrooms available, comfortably accomodating up to 9 people, this house is perfect for couples, families or groups of friends. The house is situated in Langmeil Estate, 5 minutes walking distance of Peter Lehmann Wines and Langmeil Winery, making it the perfect location for A Day on the Green events. neighborhood_overview: The house is located in Tanunda, 15 minutes walk from the Main Street. Tanunda is the tourist heart of the Barossa, boasting excellent cafes, restaurants, boutique shops, wineries and much more. The house is 5 minutes walk from Peter Lehmann Wines, which makes it the perfect location for A Day on the Green.
notes: Complimentary wine and local produce platter will be provided on arrival for stays of 2 nights or more. Continental breakfast provisions provided for first morning. Also included: Linen and towels Complimentary Wifi  TV/DVD/Netflix  Laundry facilities
transit: Tanunda is situated approx 70 minutes by car from the city of Adelaide. There is regional public transport services available, however, please note these are not as regular as in the city. Car hire is available from the airport and there is also a shuttle bus service that can be booked to do pick up from the airport. Bus services run twice daily to the city and there is a taxi service available in the Barossa also. The Barossa Tourism Centre, located in the Main Street, can help arrange tours around the Barossa.  The house has parking available for up to 4 cars and is 15 minutes walk to the Main Street.
access: Host will meet you at the house with keys for your stay.  We can be contacted via email or phone between 7am and 8pm. Guests will have full access to the house, outdoor areas and pool during their stay. Rooms not in use will be locked.
interaction: We live nearby so are able to accommodate your needs, as required. We can have minimal contact after arrival or are free to help with anything during your stay.
house_rules: Strictly no parties to be held at the house; responsible entertaining permitted. The house is in located in a residential area and the council has very strict noise restrictions.  Smoking is allowed but strictly outside only.

name: Edmunds Cottage-Must Love Cats
summary: This little cottage was built by my Great Great grandfather in 1870.  Restored  5 years ago, the original Cornish miners cottage remains but we have included a lovely spacious living room, modern bathroom with luxury spa, deck & modern kitchen.   Our 2 "fur babies" will frequent the house during your stay so if you don't like cats unfortunately this is not the place for you.
space: We are located on the outskirts of the quaint little village of Lyndoch. Surrounded by old (Hidden by Airbnb) s, our cottage includes a large deck for relaxing and a large garden with fruit trees...please help yourself.  You will also have access to discounted dining at our cafe, the Table Cafe, located just 1 km away in the heart of Lyndoch.

neighborhood_overview: Lyndoch is the gateway to the Barossa Valley.  From here you can access any of the 75 wineries within a 35 minute car journey with the closest one being only 1km away.  The town is small with a post office, general store, pub and a great cafe and wine bar (the Table Cafe), the only place to get your coffee, glass of wine, great local beers and fantastic food (Website hidden by Airbnb)
notes: The Tour Down Under on 19th January will go along Jollytown road 4 times so its an ideal location for the cycling enthusiast!
transit: Public transport is limited but trains go from Gawler which is 15 min away and we do have a local bus service.  Mini buses or taxis can help you get around to the wineries if you don't want to drive.
access: You will have full access to the house excluding the 2nd bedroom and a couple of cupboard spaces.
interaction: We will be in Lyndoch most of the time at our cafe but if we happen to be out of town we will leave instructions with my folks who live just around the corner.
house_rules: We are in the country however we have neighbours  We want you to have a great time and utilise the alfresco dining and lounge area but be mindful of the neighbours.  Our cats Hunter and Dora are lovely and friendly.  They appreciate a good scratch if you are a pet lover.
host_about: We live and have a cafe in Lyndoch.  I am totally in love with the Barossa.  I am a 5 generation Lyndochian and the cottage was one of the first built in the Barossa by my forefathers.  My partner, James and I met in Balmain Sydney where I also had a cafe....very long story but it leads us to this little cottage.  We are the proud parents of Mollee who turns 5 in January.

name: Walnut Cottage
summary: Exclusively yours. Walnut Cottage is a (circa 1857) lovingly restored settler’s cottage located in a quiet residential street within the historic Barossa township of Angaston and caters for 2–4 guests. Your comfort is assured
space: Your comfort is assured – Walnut Cottage has quality facilities including antique furnishings, a large heritage style bathroom with a claw foot bath, fully equipped self-catering kitchen, laundry amenities, heating and cooling.  Within easy walking distance to numerous restaurants, cafe's,  shops and close proximity to wineries. Relax with a good red by the open fire in winter or enjoy sitting under the majestic old walnut tree with a crisp, fruity white wine in summer. Surrounded by cottage gardens discover life with out stress at Walnut Cottage. A perfect relaxing escape  Plunger coffee, a selection of teas to enjoy with home made slice, fresh milk. Free Wifi connection Firewood and kindling supplied during winter season (May to October) Linen Supplied

name: Cornucopia Homestay, Greenock, Barossa Valley.
summary: Large bedroom with own private breakfast lounge/hall/porch area - in the centre of the sleepy village of Greenock. Walking distance to wineries, brewery, tavern, PO, a breakfast/ brunch cafe, general store, two bathrooms/toilets. Close driving distance to numerous winery and eating destinations in the Barossa.
space: The house was originally a police station in 1882 and a small winery in 1916. The two rooms and hallway are comfortable and simple as shown in the photographs with a fridge, microwave, jugs, crockery and cutlery provided.
description: Large bedroom with own private breakfast lounge/hall/porch area - in the centre of the sleepy village of Greenock. Walking distance to wineries, brewery, tavern, PO, a breakfast/ brunch cafe, general store, two bathrooms/toilets. Close driving distance to numerous winery and eating destinations in the Barossa. The house was originally a police station in 1882 and a small winery in 1916. The two rooms and hallway are comfortable and simple as shown in the photographs with a fridge, microwave, jugs, crockery and cutlery provided. You will have access to your room, the front porch, your own eating/dining room adjacent your bedroom and a bathroom which is access through another room. There is a door shutting your area off from the shared areas for privacy. Vicki and John are happy to advise on where to go and what to do.  John is particularly knowledgable in regards to wine/winemaking and things to do here in the Barossa. As its name suggests, Greenock is delightful unassuming village in t
neighborhood_overview: As its name suggests, Greenock is delightful unassuming village in the Barossa with a largely untouched 19th century streetscape. The township is located on the Mawson Bike Trail and the Heysen Bushwalking Trail.  You can walk to Murray Street Vineyards, Kalleske Wines and small winery Ballycroft Winery. Barossa Brewing Company is also in easy walking distance and is open for tastings on weekends.  The local tavern, 50 metres away, has local beer on tap and great pub meals 7 days a week. El Estanco, is a popular little cafe serving from a breakfast/brunch style menu 8am to 6pm (except Tues.) and great coffee. Watch out  for when they fire up the wood oven for pizza and paella! We have a PO and general store. The Food Luddite cooking school is just down the road.  Greenock is also in close driving proximity to Seppeltsfield Winery and the Jam Factory (think art not jam) and some excellent dining.  (Hentley Farm, Appellation, Fino's)
notes: A fold up bed is available for a third guest if required. It can be set up in your private lounge/breakfast area.
transit: It's best to have a car in the Barossa.  Organise car rentals in Adelaide.
access: You will have access to your room, the front porch, your own eating/dining room adjacent your bedroom and a bathroom which is access through another room. There is a door shutting your area off from the shared areas for privacy.
interaction: Vicki and John are happy to advise on where to go and what to do.  John is particularly knowledgable in regards to wine/winemaking and things to do here in the Barossa.
house_rules: Please no smoking inside.  No visitors. We are a mature couple that value respect, honesty and kindness.
host_about: I have travelled extensively over the years mostly preferring to spend my travelling money on experienced and meeting locals rather than luxurious accommodation.  I think this is reflected our style of hosting. It's comfortable and clean and right in the heart of a village life experience.   An ex-teacher, I now pursue my interests and passions.  I make fermented vegetables (sauerkraut, kimchi etc) for the local Farmers' Markets. I make art in various mediums including encaustic wax.  I also make Eco Wax Foodwraps.  We have chooks and 2 hives on the large residential block.  Our bees are friendly and you would have to go looking for them to find them.  John, my partner,  left the wine industry to pursue his passion for olives and olive oil full time about 8 years ago.  He is well versed on the making of wine and knows the local wine industry very well.  We understand that sometimes you want to chat and connect - and sometimes it is nice to have your own space and privacy.  Our home is unusual because both rooms can be closed off from the main shared spaces.

name: Bliss
summary: A lovely old, bluestone cottage which sits at the top end of the beautiful, leafy main street of Angaston, in the Barossa.  Originally the Blacksmith's residence, it is now a two bedroom B&B, right in the heart of the Barossa.
space: The cottage is over 100 years old and was originally the home of the town blacksmith.  His forge is still next door and gets fired up every weekend by a merry band of local volunteers.  Living heritage. Inside Bliss, there are two bedrooms, each with a queen sized bed.  In the green room, off the lounge room is an extremely comfy French iron bed and in the front blue room is a big four poster, with a sofa, a writing nook and a big chandelier for company.  The kitchen is light filled, spacious and well stocked.  In the lounge room, there is an eclectic mix of armchairs and sofas, perfect for curling up with a book and something good to drink.  The smart TV is decently sized for a cosy night in.  Fancy a carpet picnic?  The local pizza joint, Roaring 40's, is very good and only a two minute walk down the street).  The bathroom at Bliss is generously sized and includes a rather large raised spa bath.  Happy days :) The Barossa is famous for its food as well as its wine and part of staying
description: A lovely old, bluestone cottage which sits at the top end of the beautiful, leafy main street of Angaston, in the Barossa.  Originally the Blacksmith's residence, it is now a two bedroom B&B, right in the heart of the Barossa. The cottage is over 100 years old and was originally the home of the town blacksmith.  His forge is still next door and gets fired up every weekend by a merry band of local volunteers.  Living heritage. Inside Bliss, there are two bedrooms, each with a queen sized bed.  In the green room, off the lounge room is an extremely comfy French iron bed and in the front blue room is a big four poster, with a sofa, a writing nook and a big chandelier for company.  The kitchen is light filled, spacious and well stocked.  In the lounge room, there is an eclectic mix of armchairs and sofas, perfect for curling up with a book and something good to drink.  The smart TV is decently sized for a cosy night in.  Fancy a carpet picnic?  The local pizza joint, Roaring 40's, is very
neighborhood_overview: Angaston is absolutely the prettiest of the Barossa towns, set slightly up in the hills that border the East of The Barossa.  Green, leafy and with a main street that is full of interesting shops and some beautiful parks.  There are plenty of coffee spots, (including ours!) and eateries in Angaston.  As previously mentioned, the little Italian cooking school and restaurant Casa Carboni is a stand out, as is The Barossa Valley Cheese Company.  Yalumba Winery is a two minute drive away and Saturday morning Barossa Farmers Market is about 3km down the road.
transit: It's all walking distance to so much and just a short drive to everything else.  It couldn't be easier or more convenient.
access: The B&B includes a private courtyard, shaded by an ancient currant vine (planted in 1912) and decked out with a red gum picnic table and a barbeque.   Next to the courtyard is a covered car port for guests to park and access to the B&B is via a door within the courtyard.
interaction: We will always be available for our guests.  While they are staying with us, they are honoured members of our family and we are here to look after them and make sure that their time in the Barossa is a wonderful experience.
house_rules: Mainly it's the smoking thing- by all means, smoking is permitted, but only outside.  Apart from this, we simply expect our guests to respect and love the cottage as much as we do, (which is lots!)
host_about:
I live on a beautiful, little, old farm in the hills of the Barossa Valley.  My love of animals has seen me work as a veterinary surgeon for many years and that is reflected by the menagerie that lives with me, including three Icelandic horses, the dogs- Audrey, Lynch, Finn and Percy and the meet and greet goats, Nancy Drew and Inspector Frost.  My beautiful flock of geese can also be found, wandering around the property, looking very stately.
As well as working as a vet, I also run a small restaurant out of a local cellar door, Edenmae Estate, on the weekends; fresh, innovative local food is a great passion of mine, as are the amazing wines that my beautiful Barossa produces.
I have been lucky enough to travel to many places in the world and have made friends and memories to last me a lifetime.  Now it is time to show the world how amazing my patch is!

name: Carob Cottage
summary: A stay at Carob Cottage places you in a relaxed & private vineyard setting, close to all major towns and wineries in the Barossa. It has 3 bedrooms with 1 Queen, 1 Double & 1 Single bed. Fully equipped kitchen & laundry and an outdoor BBQ.
space: The  3 bedroom cottage is located just off the main tourist route in a vineyard setting and can accommodate up to 5 people. It has 1 queen, 1 double and 1 single bedroom. Two separate lounge areas with flat screen TV in main lounge. Reverse cycle air conditioning in main lounge with fans/heaters in other rooms. Bathroom with bath and separate shower. Toilet is separate from the bathroom. Fully equipped kitchen and laundry. All linen and towels provided. Light breakfast provisions for your first morning for stays of 2 or more nights.  Out door setting with BBQ. A 2 night minimum stay is required Friday and Saturday and 3 nights over the Easter break. The cottage is not appropriate for children, people with limited mobility and wheelchairs.

name: Greenock's Old Telegraph Station
summary: Escape, Relax, Unwind, Explore..... Experience all that the Barossa Valley has to offer from your home away from home in this restored heritage cottage located in a quiet village setting close to award winning wineries.
space: The cottage is for your exclusive use when you stay. It offers accommodation for up to four guests. There are two bedrooms (one containing a queen bed and the other a double bed, both with electric blankets). The separate lounge room has comfy couches, with a television and a selection of DVDs to watch. In the fully equipped kitchen you will find a cooktop, microwave, fridge, table and chairs, coffee and tea making facilities, utensils etc; everything you need for self catering. The large bathroom contains a 2 person spa with shower over, hand basin and toilet. There is also a washing machine. We provide quality bath towels and bath robes for your use. Heating and cooling is provided by reverse cycle air conditioning and a combustion heater. There is a selection of books, magazines, games and puzzles to keep yourself entertained. Outdoors, in the fully enclosed rear garden (pets welcome by negotiation) is a gas barbecue with hood, undercover table and seating.

neighborhood_overview: Within easy walking distance of the cottage are two award winning wineries and a boutique brewery as well as the local pub which serves generous sized meals. Within close driving distance are many more well known wineries and restaurants and the main shopping/tourist precincts of the Barossa Valley.
notes: Included in your stay are generous continental and cooked breakfast provisions, including cereal, bacon, eggs, tomatoes, bread, selection of spreads, butter, milk, juice, tea and coffee. We also provide a bottle of complimentary Barossa wine (your choice of red or white) for stays of two or more nights. There is free wireless internet access. A baby cot and high chair are available free on request.
access: Guests have exclusive access to the entire property. There is onsite parking and free on street parking.
interaction: The cottage has a keyless entry lock so guests are welcome to check in at their convenience. I am available for assistance with any concerns if needed.
house_rules: The cottage is strictly a non-smoking premise. If evidence of smoking is detected, a cleaning fee will be charged to the guest. We realise accidents happen, but any wilful damage, including any damage by pets, will be charged to the guest. The cottage is for the use of the booked guests only.

name: Boongarrie
summary: Charming self-contained semi detached guest suite  in our country farmhouse. Located in the Barossa Valley, close to wineries on a beautiful parcel of land. Watch the sunset and listen to the kookaburras laughing while enjoying a  glass of wine.  Continental breakfast provided of home baked bread, spreads, coffee,tea and cereal.  A perfect place for couples to explore the valley.  On the same property we also have a unique luxury tent stay "Boongarrie Luxury Tent" also on airbnb. .
space: Your suite is an air conditioned semi detached section of our house. It has its own  entrance, deck and little courtyard area. It has a kitchenette/laundry area with all necessary utensils. A fridge, microwave, electric frypan,toaster , kettle and a private BBQ in the courtyard. There is a neat bathroom and charming bedroom with a 4 poster bed. Ceiling fan and air-conditioning make this a very comfortable area at all times of the year. Plenty of parking and a sealed road access to our property.   Relax and enjoy the  property, views and birds.
description: Charming self-contained semi detached guest suite  in our country farmhouse. Located in the Barossa Valley, close to wineries on a beautiful parcel of land. Watch the sunset and listen to the kookaburras laughing while enjoying a  glass of wine.  Continental breakfast provided of home baked bread, spreads, coffee,tea and cereal.  A perfect place for couples to explore the valley.  On the same property we also have a unique luxury tent stay "Boongarrie Luxury Tent" also on airbnb. . Your suite is an air conditioned semi detached section of our house. It has its own  entrance, deck and little courtyard area. It has a kitchenette/laundry area with all necessary utensils. A fridge, microwave, electric frypan,toaster , kettle and a private BBQ in the courtyard. There is a neat bathroom and charming bedroom with a 4 poster bed. Ceiling fan and air-conditioning make this a very comfortable area at all times of the year. Plenty of parking and a sealed road access to our property.   Relax and e
neighborhood_overview: You will have trouble seeing our neighbours, but occasionally one may drop in. It is a friendly area surrounded by sheep, cattle properties and wineries.
notes: Our property is 10 km out of Angaston and this means you will need your own vehicle. There  is sealed road access and many wineries and tourist destinations  are situated close by. The property has a pond and a dam so is not suitable for young children.
transit: Your own private car is a necessity as there is no public transport closeby. Cars are available for rent from the Adelaide airport. Tour operators will pick up from the property.
access: Our property is a gorgeous place to explore. Go for a walk down to the creek area in Spring or Autumn and check out the frogs, birds or say hello to my beautiful horses, give Annie the pet sheep a pat and check out any little black head dorper lambs. If you are a cyclist. You will notice that lots of your cycling friends cycle up our road, aptly named Seven Steps Road because of the climb.  Why not bring your bikes along. You have 2 of your own outdoor deck areas to sit and relax or you are welcome to share our huge  outdoor room.  You are welcome  to use any quiet spots in the garden or the creek area for a picnic, relax or just to sit and read a book. The large outdoor entertaining area is a beautiful place to sit and enjoy the great views. If you go for a walk through the paddocks just remember to shut the gates.
interaction: When ever we are around we are happy to spend time with guests and offer any assistance we can regarding tourist venues, winery visits, tours and pick ups. We are social people who love travelling ourselves and enjoy meeting people and hearing about their part of the world. We also understand that sometimes people just want privacy and  time alone. So please let us know what type of stay you want and we can accommodate for your needs.
house_rules: Please enjoy yourselves and take the time to see a truly beautiful part of Australia. We only ask that you love and respect the property, look after my beautiful animals by shutting gates and have some fun.
host_about:
My partner Garrry and I have lived in the beautiful Barossa for over 20 years. We enjoy all the fine foods and wines that are at our doorstep and love meeting new people. We enjoy travelling both overseas and in Australia, and love getting away from it all under the stars and living it up in luxury.
We love fishing and retreating when possible, to one of our beach houses on the Yorke Peninsula. 
We understand from our own travelling that guests may want total privacy and independence or wish to have some assistance and interaction.

name: The Stables
space: Situated in Rowland Flat on a three-acre property, the stone cottage was the original tack and feed rooms for Mr Rowland's stables. Separated by a courtyard the stables are now the home of the host. The cottage is comprised of a truly delightful bedroom with an antique double bed with stunning garden views; comfortable lounge room with TV/DVD, CD/radio, books and games; light and open equipped kitchenette with bar fridge, microwave, large electric frying pan and breakfast bar overlooking gardens through french windows (provisions for continental breakfast); the bathroom has both separate shower and claw foot slipper bath, toilet and vanity. R/c air-conditioning/heating and ceiling fans throughout. Access from the cottage to your own verandah with garden spilling over…serenity…the perfect spot for breakfast, coffee or bottle of local wine. Enjoy walks through our vineyard and paddocks and come across surprises such as our free-range chooks, wood fire pizza oven, an array of interesting
description: Situated in Rowland Flat on a three-acre property, the stone cottage was the original tack and feed rooms for Mr Rowland's stables. Separated by a courtyard the stables are now the home of the host. The cottage is comprised of a truly delightful bedroom with an antique double bed with stunning garden views; comfortable lounge room with TV/DVD, CD/radio, books and games; light and open equipped kitchenette with bar fridge, microwave, large electric frying pan and breakfast bar overlooking gardens through french windows (provisions for continental breakfast); the bathroom has both separate shower and claw foot slipper bath, toilet and vanity. R/c air-conditioning/heating and ceiling fans throughout. Access from the cottage to your own verandah with garden spilling over…serenity…the perfect spot for breakfast, coffee or bottle of local wine. Enjoy walks through our vineyard and paddocks and come across surprises such as our free-range chooks, wood fire pizza oven, an array of interesting
neighborhood_overview: There’s plenty to do, only minutes away: Tanunda Pines Golf course, the bike/walking path (from Angaston to Gawler) runs past the top of our property, hot air ballooning, helicopter scenic flights, wineries, restaurants, art galleries, cafes and day spa (at the Novotel). What more could you want?
notes: Bicycle hire available (price available on request).
transit: We are only six minutes from Tanunda in one direction and Lyndoch in the other. The best way to get around is by car (public transport is very limited). The excellent tourist office is in Tanunda and they are a wealth of information regarding local tours and more.
interaction: Up to you…if you want solitude - it’s yours, or we are more than happy to help you in any way we can.
house_rules: No smoking inside. Please leave gates as you find them (open or shut), we have animals.
host_about:
A Barossa girl, I started my nursing at Angaston Hospital, played netball for Sandy Creek and Lyndoch clubs, was a tour guide for Orlando and, the then, Kaiser Stuhl wineries and also a wine rep for Tolleys; so I do appreciate Barossa wines and just love this area.

After many years living both interstate and overseas the magic of the Barossa Valley always draws you back!

Gardening, animals, people, fine wine and food are a few of my passions.

name: The Lodge Angaston
summary: Welcome to Angaston, Crown of the world renown Barossa wine region. Experience one of SA's most unique & grand designed buildings framed by 100 yo Moreton Bay fig trees. The Lodge towers prominently above Murray St and oh so conveniently located within minutes to award winning local cafes, shops & restaurants. The lodge is well situated to access walking - cycling paths while road/mountain bike riders will delight in the local routes.
space: The State of South Australia has listed the privately owned property on the State Heritage listing together with the two centuries old Moreton Bay Fig Trees encapsulate and frame the front festarde.  From the moment you open the door you'll step back through time. You'll be amazed and impressed by the height of the ceilings and the generous private space. The delightful collection of complementary period furniture and collectables will excite dreamy wonderment while the plush rugs are a tactile delight. We are surrounded by beautiful public gardens and walking trails. Enjoy your complimentary wine and cheese platter under the vines or on a picnic rug over looking the historic gardens, meandering creek and vineyards in the background.
description: Welcome to Angaston, Crown of the world renown Barossa wine region. Experience one of SA's most unique & grand designed buildings framed by 100 yo Moreton Bay fig trees. The Lodge towers prominently above Murray St and oh so conveniently located within minutes to award winning local cafes, shops & restaurants. The lodge is well situated to access walking - cycling paths while road/mountain bike riders will delight in the local routes. The State of South Australia has listed the privately owned property on the State Heritage listing together with the two centuries old Moreton Bay Fig Trees encapsulate and frame the front festarde.  From the moment you open the door you'll step back through time. You'll be amazed and impressed by the height of the ceilings and the generous private space. The delightful collection of complementary period furniture and collectables will excite dreamy wonderment while the plush rugs are a tactile delight. We are surrounded by beautiful public gardens and wa
neighborhood_overview: Angaston, 'the Crown of the Barossa' is nestled in the Barossa Ranges. You will need to set aside a couple of days to walk and taste and experience all the Main Street and historic surrounds have to offer.  Welcome to country hospitality.
notes: Free wifi per supplied tokens. We have recently installed a washer & drier.  We are surrounded by beautiful grounds and continually strive to improve your guest experience with value adding ammenities. You'll have access to a BBQ area or we can provide you with a picnic rug and basket.  We are currently planning our road/mountain bikers lockable storage and workshop area. Together with the outdoor spa and secondary BBQ area with fresh seasonal produce ready to be picked from the garden. Direct bookings are available, please provide a Visa or MasterCard credit card will be required prior to accessing the accommodation. The bond security amount is equivalent to 1 nights stay. If you don't have a credit card, no problem, we can accept cash or pay pal.
transit: We are 90 minutes drive from the heart of the city of Adelaide. Please let us know if you need assistance with your chauffeur, self drive hire car, uber driver, regional taxi, twice daily bus service or helicopter.  Once here, our scooters are a great fun economical way to explore and start creating some new memories and lasting friendships.
access: As our guests you will be greeted as life long friends. You will have complete access to the entire first floor entry is via the grand front entrance depicted on the photo's. Once inside, settle in, explore over a complimentary wine or sparkling paired with cheese tasting platter exclusively chosen for you.  Winter is simply wonderful when shared with great company, a wine or two some oversized sheepskins a large slate hearth prominently displayin your very private combustion wood heater while your selection of music plays in the background. Maybe now you've spotted that large pool table and consider its time for a friendly game of snooker, your music plays from the karaoke style CD player while accessing the free wifi to display the words prominently on the wall mounted large interactive tv. Perhaps even split the screen to check on those sport scores.
interaction: We will interact with you as much or as little as you wish. Our aim is for you to unwind, relax and enjoy the Angaston hospitality. Let us know if you require any assistance when planning and exploring the Barossa.  We have recently launched our scooter hire business, Scoot'n'Toot Barossa. It's a fun way to get around and explore, all things Barossa. Go Pros are also available to capture your fun and excitement. We will download your captured experience to a usb stick for later self editing.
house_rules: Please, no smoking inside the premises. Please deposit cigarette butts in the pot outside the main front door entrance.  Sorry, no pets. We ask that any young children are strictly monitored to reduce accidental property damage. Any such damage will be charged to your nominated credit card.
host_about:
My partner Andrew and myself look forward to meeting you. The kids have almost all flown the coupe, yeh to some couple time. Well, until they return or drop off of the grandchildren. 
We have commenced a couple of new ventures and look forward to the trials and trivellations ahead. We both share a passion for living life to the max. Whether it's water skiing, wake boarding or attempting a new water based activity we will endeavour to give it a go.  We may not walk for a few days after, but that's another story. We love open air concerts, festivals, camping, gardening, building/construction/renovation. I love reading adventure novels and studying factual information to assist in new ventures, where as Andrew prefers me to provide him with the condensed version. 
We both firmly believe in ageing disgracefully.

name: Possum Cottage in Barossa Valley
summary: This accommodation combine's a Barossan element of class.  Outside your front door is the cycling track that winds amongst the picturesque vineyards. By car, enjoy a self-guided driving tour visiting all the family friendly wineries.   For your dining experience, you are minutes away from restaurants and pubs . Enjoy the outdoor secluded decking area. Make your own fire in the outdoor chiminea as you unwind. Full privacy is assured as you slip into your outdoor tranquil Jacuzzi.
space: In Possum Cottage there are two bedrooms with a maximum of 3 beds.  . We can accommodate up to 4 Adults for the 2 x king beds, we can accommodate up to two children for the day bed and trundle. BEDROOM 1- has a King bed so it can accommodate up to 2 people. BEDROOM 2- Is available and has a King Bed and also comprises of a Day and the roll out trundle bed if needed. Come and enjoy the many attractions and take in the fresh Barossa Valley air.  By Day, Lovely cooked breakfast minutes up the road on those relaxing mornings or simply cook your own in the self-contained Bistro Style kitchen .Walk outside your front door and take the 14 km cycling track along the north Para River and take in the picturesque vineyards. By car enjoy a self-guided driving tour visiting all the family friendly wineries. Across the road is the Barossa Brewery. Enjoy hand crafted beer and local produce or take away is an option if you are looking for a quiet movie night or romantic weekend. Straight opposite the

By car, enjoy a self-guided driving tour visiting all the family friendly wineries.   For your dining experience, you are minutes away from restaurants and pubs . Come and enjoy the many attractions and take in the fresh Barossa Valley air.  By Day, Lovely cooked breakfast minutes up the road on those relaxin
neighborhood_overview: The Barossa Valley is situated 70 km Northeast of Adelaide.  The Cottage is situated in the iconic tourist township of Tanunda and has many attractions which are only a hop skip and jump from the Cottage’s front door. Tanunda is home to some beautiful wineries and is a five minute drive to the famous Jacobs Creek Winery.
notes: THE COTTAGE OFFERS: *King Room (1 x King Bed) *King Room (1 x King Bed & Day Bed with a trundle ) *Linen/Bedding/ Towels *Pillows/Blankets *1 x Shower/Toilet room  *Shower Mat/Hair Dryer/Toilet paper *Full equipped self-catering Kitchen *Lounge Room *Lounge/TV/DVD-Video  *Laundry Room  *Washing Machine/ Iron & Board *Large decking area with BBQ facilities *Outdoor Table/ Electric BBQ *Wood is Supplied for winter bookings only *Slow combustion fireplace & Split system *Board Games/Cards/Movies
transit: Depending on what type of experience you are looking for there is lots of Transport ideas *If you have your own car there is parking at the Cottage for one vehicle. *There is bike hire from the local businesses to enjoy the bike track which is located outside your front door. This track meanders through the vines and you will be able to experience the Barossa's Premium food and wine. *You are in walking distance to the information centre which has transport around to different wineries and attractions for your convenience. *Transport from Adelaide Airport can depend on your budget there are shuttle buses/Taxis or you can catch trains and buses to Tanunda. *If you would like to see the Barossa from up above a Hot Air Balloon or Helicopter that is an option in the region.
access: The day before your arrival i will issue you the code for the door. Please- Check in time is anytime after 2pm. Depending on flight details or your situation you can have the ease of arriving at your own leisure to Possum Cottage. Just pin in the code and enjoy your stay. ( no keys )
interaction: The hosts haves no interaction with guests except via Air Bnb messenger. There is lots of information for a beautiful stay in the Barossa Valley at your fingertips located in the cottage. The Mystery is up to you.
house_rules: -Check in 2pm -Late check out 10am Please note:  -No pets Allowed -No Parties -No smoking in the cottage -Please do your own dishes -Enjoy your stay -Respect our lovely cottage On arrival please read the guest information booklet. This has all the house rules and information you will need to know about the cottage, to make your stay more comfortable.
host_about:
Hi our name is Brett and Renee we have the pleasure of being your Hosts.

We have lived in the Cottage for 10 years and over the past 3 years we have opened it up to Backpackers from all over the world who have enjoyed their stay.
We now are offering Airbnb users the unique opportunity to come and stay in our 1856 Cottage and experience what the Barossa Valley has to offer it's visitors.

Brett and I like to travel to Fiji and have formed many local friendships over the last few years. This is our little paradise.

We work hard and like socializing on our days off, we also look forward to working around our home and garden to design tranquil spaces. We now have the opportunity to share it with others.


Your Hosts

Brett and Renee

name: "The Hideaway Central"
summary: "The Hideaway Central" is a lovely, fully furnished and spacious unit available in the main st of central Tanunda, in the picturesque Barossa Valley. We also have another place called "The Hideaway" on the same block. Both units are available for both short and longer terms stays. Staying at one of The Hideaways means everything is at your doorstep!!
description: "The Hideaway Central" is a lovely, fully furnished and spacious unit available in the main st of central Tanunda, in the picturesque Barossa Valley. We also have another place called "The Hideaway" on the same block. Both units are available for both short and longer terms stays. Staying at one of The Hideaways means everything is at your doorstep!! Guests have access to:  Guests have access to the entire unit, and courtyard with a BBQ. The garage is not available.  Fully equipped kitchen (glassware, crockery, cutlery, pots and pans), with fridge, freezer, stove, oven, dishwasher and washing machine.  Coffee, tea, sugar, salt and pepper.  Large bedroom with queen sized bed and ceiling fan. Small bedroom with Queen sized bed. (Available for 3 + guests) Dining room. Airconditioned lounge room with TV and DVD player. (There is a DVD rental place two doors down :) Bathroom and separate toilet. Towels and linen provided Foodland, Pharmacy, Newsagent and a Laundromat are a short walk away,
neighborhood_overview: Tanunda lies in the heart of the Barossa Valley, Australia's best-known wine region and South Australia's most visited tourist destination.   Tanunda is the focal point of the Barossa. With its strong European heritage, distinctive church spiers, wineries, cafés and restaurants there is plenty to see and do in the town.  "The Hideaway" is right in the centre of Tanunda. Foodland and Priceline are right next door. There are two cafes within 100m of the unit, and a hairdresser and health food shop right opposite. 1918, one of the Barossa’s finest restaurants, is also within 100m of the unit. (Website hidden by Airbnb) Tanunda is home to the Barossa Visitor Information Centre, an ideal starting point for any visit to the Barossa, located at 66-68 Murray Street (the main street) and open seven days a week (Website hidden by Airbnb) The town also boasts a number of wineries, including Peter Lehmann Wines, Langmeil, Richmond Grove, Lambert Estate and Chateau Tanunda, with its impressive buil
notes: 1) WHERE CAN I FIND OUT ABOUT WINE TOURS, WINE CELLARS ETC? The Barossa Visitors Centre is on Murray st, not very far from The Hideaway Central. You can either ring or visit them.  Monday to Friday 9am-5pm Saturday 9am-4pm Sundays and Public Holidays 10am-4pm Address: 66-68 Murray St Tanunda SA 5352 2) CAN I CHECK IN EARLY AND/OR CHECK OUT LATE? CHECK-IN: Anytime from 3pm CHECK-OUT: 11AM or anytime before. Most of the time we only have a 4 hour window in between bookings, and there's a lot of cleaning to be done. Please forgive us if we cannot accommodate requests for late check outs/early checks ins 4) DO YOU PROVIDE BREAKFAST? Sorry, we don't offer breakfast. In the kitchen you will find instant coffee, sugar, tea bags, condiments, salt and pepper. Foodland is conveniently located right next door to cater for all your food requirements :) 5) DO YOU HAVE FOXTEL/CABLE? We don't have Foxtel or cable TV, just the free-to-air digital channels. 6) DO YOU HAVE AIRCONDITIONING? There is an a
transit: You really need a car to get to the Barossa. But once you're here, if it's nice, hire a bike and take a leisurely ride along the new fabulous bike paths that have been placed all along the Barossa.  There's really not much in the way of public transport. There is a Bus to Gawler and Angaston in front of Tanunda library.
access: Guests have access to:  Guests have access to the entire unit, and courtyard with a BBQ. The garage is not available.  Fully equipped kitchen (glassware, crockery, cutlery, pots and pans), with fridge, freezer, stove, oven, dishwasher and washing machine.  Coffee, tea, sugar, salt and pepper.  Large bedroom with queen sized bed and ceiling fan. Small bedroom with Queen sized bed. (Available for 3 + guests) Dining room. Airconditioned lounge room with TV and DVD player. (There is a DVD rental place two doors down :) Bathroom and separate toilet. Towels and linen provided Foodland, Pharmacy, Newsagent and a Laundromat are a short walk away, approx. 100m distance.
interaction: Entry is via Keyless entry so there is no key hand off. After we receive your booking for The Hideaway Central, we send you an email with information about how to check in and plenty of other details.  I can easily be reached by mobile if you need anything :) Please enjoy your stay and make yourselves at home!
house_rules: USE OF BEDROOMS We consider each bedroom (Main and Small) to sleep two guests. If there are two of you, but you do not wish to share a bedroom, and wish to use both bedrooms,  please enquire with us and we can work out the extra charges for you.  CLEANING We don't charge a cleaning fee, so we do expect all our guests to keep the place tidy, and take care of all dirty dishes (washing and putting away) and take care of kufany spills that might occur. CHILDREN The Hideaway Central accepts guests ages 5+ years and up. SMOKING AND PETS No smoking and no pets thank you. CHECK IN  The Hideaway Central has a 24h Check-in (from 3pm), with a keyless entry. ADDITIONAL GUESTS No additional guests to be on the premises without prior arrangement. Having nearby neighbours means we are always informed of the number of guests at the unit :)

name: Angaston Masonic Lodge SAs Heritage
summary: Hello & welcome to Angaston (Crown of the Barossa) & home to one of South Australia's most prized architectural listing. The 147yo lodge is located within walking distance to everything Angaston. Local cafes, restaurants, award winning produce, wineries, bikeways/walkways, historical points of interest & surrounded by beautiful scenery. Affordable luxury.
space: Architectural brilliance at its best. The overwhelmingly large space with impossibly high ceilings offer overwhelming spaciousness while the half metre thick stone walls are a great natural insulator. Nature sometimes needs a little help. The air-conditioning will keep you cool in summer while the oversized combustion heater & individual space heaters will keep you warm in winter. Natural light streams through the well appointed windows and offers glimpses of the historic walk and surrounding trees outside. Naturally beautiful & well appointed collectable furniture complements all the modern amenities, including a full size pool table, large wall mounted smart tv, karaoke style DVD player and chess table set. The marble hearth is set at just the perfect height to sit by the fire with your wine while contemplating how fluffy are those sheep skin mats?  Your bedrooms are separated by the oversized grande entrance hallway preceding through the generous sized double doors and onto the form
description: Hello & welcome to Angaston (Crown of the Barossa) & home to one of South Australia's most prized architectural listing. The 147yo lodge is located within walking distance to everything Angaston. Local cafes, restaurants, award winning produce, wineries, bikeways/walkways, historical points of interest & surrounded by beautiful scenery. Affordable luxury. Architectural brilliance at its best. The overwhelmingly large space with impossibly high ceilings offer overwhelming spaciousness while the half metre thick stone walls are a great natural insulator. Nature sometimes needs a little help. The air-conditioning will keep you cool in summer while the oversized combustion heater & individual space heaters will keep you warm in winter. Natural light streams through the well appointed windows and offers glimpses of the historic walk and surrounding trees outside. Naturally beautiful & well appointed collectable furniture complements all the modern amenities, including a full size pool table
neighborhood_overview: Put simply, friendly country hospitality.  We look forward to meeting you and welcoming you to our township and world class Barossa region. You will love the culture, history and regional diversity. Our community is safe, walking the streets isn't a worry, please consider, not all roads are well lit. we can provide you with a torch or download a torch to your mobile phone.
notes: We live on site, please let us know if this will impact on your stay. With the 990 millimetre tapered stone walls, noise and temperature is well regulated.  Blue tooth your favourite music to the karaoke style CD player and "crank out some tunes". Or maybe you prefer to settle back into the textured chesterfield lounges and download a movie to enjoy with wine and cheese, or weather permitting, we will set you up outside under the winter creek lined tree canopy. Sufficient wood for the combustion heater will be provided during your stay, please let us know if you need assistance to fill the fire. We'll provide you with some education if you have never filled a fire before.  General maintence to clear ash from the fire will be required during longer stays. Please nominate a suitable time of day for this routine procedure to occur, together with restocking of the wood supply for your use. Please enquire about our laundry facilities and additionally for longer stays, linen changes and hous
transit: Will are situated approximately 80 minutes by car from the city of Adelaide. Regional public transport services are available. Linksa runs twice daily services from the city direct to the Barossa. Train services are available from the city and end Gawler. Linksa regional bus services connect with specified runs. Taxi services are also available. ScootnToot provide scooter hire. If you can ride a push bike and your have a valid car licence, you are eligible to hire a scooter for your self guided tour or for some fun, add a guru. That's definitely, an experience.  There are ample push bike and walking/jogging trails.  And of course we can provide you with one of our local tour operators.
access: You will be in awe of this State Heritage listed space. You will have exclusive acces to level 1 (7 steps from street level) with approximately 180 square metres and 5 1/2 metre height ceilings devoted entirely for your comfort.  The property has been listed by the State of South Australia for its grand design and unique prominence above the Murray Street, Angaston. Travellers and locals alike, often seek a photo opportunity on the steps with the bluestone and slate building in the backdrop, while the 145 year old State Heritage listed Moreton by fig trees create a frame for the building in the foreground. You will have exclusive access to two diverse areas, the formal dine with 145yo piano, Chesterfield daytime reading area and smaller smart television. This area adjoins the separate kitchen and leads onto the entertainment room. We encourage book exchanges.  The kitchenette is complete with all modern basic amenities, dishwasher, bar fridge, full size electric stove, convection micro
interaction: Your experience is of paramount importance. Please let us know how much interaction you would prefer. Some guests and honeymooners prefer to self check in, we can provide you with the access code. Other guests prefer to interact more with a local Barossian. We will be only to delighted to assist you with your local holiday must do's around our beautiful town of Angaston and extend into the Barossa Valley region.
house_rules: Please, no smoking inside. Please consider the environment by placing your butts in the tray provided. Sorry. No pets. We ask that you leave the premises in the same condition. Please note, additional cleaning fees may apply.  We respect our environment and ask that you give consideration as well. We can provide a carton for recycling of wine and drink bottles.  There are no restrictions on noise levels. Our local council however does not permit the consumption of alcohol in the parks next door after 10pm. Street parking during Monday to Friday, is a 2 hour limit. If you choose to park beneath the Moreton bay fig trees, please consider we are unable to prevent debris falling from the trees onto your property. The same risks will apply to the off street parking on the premises.
host_about:
My partner Andrew and myself look forward to meeting you. The kids have almost all flown the coupe, yeh to some couple time. Well, until they return or drop off of the grandchildren. 
We have commenced a couple of new ventures and look forward to the trials and trivellations ahead. We both share a passion for living life to the max. Whether it's water skiing, wake boarding or attempting a new water based activity we will endeavour to give it a go.  We may not walk for a few days after, but that's another story. We love open air concerts, festivals, camping, gardening, building/construction/renovation. I love reading adventure novels and studying factual information to assist in new ventures, where as Andrew prefers me to provide him with the condensed version. 
We both firmly believe in ageing disgracefully.

name: The Cottage at Riverside Farm
summary: A beautiful, secluded, self contained cottage in the Barossa Valley overlooking the North Para River. There are many places to walk, picnic or simply enjoy the view. All modern amenities included and sleeps up to 4 people. A couple of minutes away from Chateau Yaldara, the Lyndoch Hill Restaurant and the Lyndoch main street. Only a few minutes more to Tanunda and the other wineries and restaurants in the Barossa Valley.
space: Unique views and park like surrounds make this a truly relaxing getaway. With virtually no surrounding noise or light sources the days are peaceful and the night sky truly stunning. Find us at www/riversidefarm/net/au or search for 'Riverside Farm Barossa Valley' on the web.

It welcomes with polished floorboards, natural light, original paintings by local artists and comfy slightly vintage furniture. Ducted air-con for temperature control, a claw foot bath to languish in & cosy quilts.
space: It's a hospitable space to relax in or enjoy with friends
