host_about:
Hi there, 
I'm an artist and business owner living  in the Barossa Valley. I love characterful houses, homes and hospitality and I have  three accommodations available in South Australia.
I have a weakness for beautiful stone homes typical to South Australia, that have a European feel. I appreciate natural light, wooden floorboards, enhancing architectural features and preserving what works from the past whilst adding charm and modern comforts. I like my guests to feel they have a stylish home away from home.

I travel a lot myself so I appreciate what it is to arrive to a place that feels like you can kick your shoes off, pour a wine and relax.

name: A Barn in the Barossa
summary: A Barn in the Barossa is a beautiful 2 storey picture book stone home architecturally renovated to celebrate natural materials of wood & stone. It was previously home to artist Jacqueline Coates and has been featured by Qantas and national magazines

host_about:
Hi there, 
I'm an artist and business owner living  in the Barossa Valley. I love characterful houses, homes and hospitality and I have  three accommodations available in South Australia.
I have a weakness for beautiful stone homes typical to South Australia, that have a European feel. I appreciate natural light, wooden floorboards, enhancing architectural features and preserving what works from the past whilst adding charm and modern comforts. I like my guests to feel they have a stylish home away from home. 
My renovations style is comfy French provincial with a touch of vintage and original artworks on the walls for a restful and inspiring stay.
I travel a lot myself so I appreciate what it is to arrive to a place that feels like you can kick your shoes off, pour a wine and relax.

name: Acorn Cottage
summary: Acorn Cottage is Heritage C1900 restored cottage in the small township of Angaston in the beautiful Barossa Valley. Quality self-catering accommodation for 2-6 quests. Close to restaurants & wineries.  We offer a quality heritage experience in the heart of the Barossa.
space: Your comfort is assured. Acorn Cottage has outstanding facilities including genuine quality antique furnishings, bathroom with dual showers and a large claw foot bath, fully equipped kitchen including dishwasher, ducted reverse cycle air conditioning, open fire in winter and laundry amenities including a dryer. We now have free Wifi connection for all your internet needs. Firewood and kindling provided. (May to October) Includes home made slice to enjoy with a cup of tea or plunger coffee,  fresh milk,  on arrival. Free Wi-Fi and all local touring information is provided. name: Barossa Blue - Three Bedroom Apartment.
summary: Your space is private. No shared spaces. The owner lives on the property - often not home. Your space is the front section...three bedrooms, large living area/TV room, bathroom has a shower and full sized bath. There is a double bed in bedroom  one, a queen bed in bedroom two and two single beds in bedroom three. You can cook simple meals in the living area. Outside BBQ for your use. There is a small oven, hotplates, sandwich maker and drip filter coffee.
space: There is not a full kitchen. The front part of the home is for your exclusive use. There is also a large bathroom with bath and separate shower recess. There is an outdoor setting under a shade sail in the front garden with a BBQ. The double garage has been insulated and converted to a living space with TV, four seater dining table, three seater lounge, recliner chair, sofa bed and reverse cycle air conditioning. If you can’t deal with the garage, best to book something smaller for twice the price elsewhere.

neighborhood_overview: A very quiet modern street with very little traffic. Close to many wineries and The Farm Eatery and Experience Centre ( Maggie Beer’s place).
notes: Free Wifi.  Network is Beam (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) Password is llation8 Angaston.  Vintners Bar and Grill - Modern Australian.  Barossa Farmers Market each Saturday from 7.30 to (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) Beautiful local produce...I have a Patisserie stall there. Coffee from Bean Addiction and great breakfast.  Angaston has the Barossa Brauhaus, Cassa Carboni, Barossa Cheese Shop and D & M’s Bakery.  Nuriootpa.  Nuriootpa is the commercial centre of the Barossa. Coop Shopping mall has a Foodland and an Aldi.  The Vine Inn has both formal dining and Bistro Style.  Best coffee in the Barossa at Fleur Social.  The Angas Park Hotel is more old fashioned and  cozy.  Tanunda.  Tanunda Foodland open 7am to 8pm every day of the year.  Best coffee is at Darlings...near the Visitors Centre.  Other coffee places are Red Door, Keils and Nosh.  Take away Malaysian at Kampung Kitchen.  The Clubhouse - family meals.  Amanti Pizza.  Barossa Cucina - modern Italian at the Weintal. (Phone
transit: There is no public transport in the Valley. Best to have your own vehicle. You can call a cab, ride a bike or walk to the Main Street (20 minutes).
access: Free Wi-Fi. I supply coffee/tea making facilities, basic breakfast and a fridge/freezer. There is a microwave, toaster, oven, hot plate, sandwich press and electric kettle. Also shampoo, conditioner, body wash and hairdryer.
interaction: Up to you.
house_rules: No smoking inside please. If any of the rooms, including the converted garage, are found to be affected by smoke, there will be a $150 charge for cleaning and deodorising.  Be considerate of my neighbours.  I charge a small cleaning fee so please wash dishes and try to leave the space as you find it.
host_about: I'm a Home Economics teacher at Nuriootpa High School. I have a stall at the Angaston Farmers Market every Saturday selling French Patisserie. I am also a professional orchestral trumpet player.

name: Angaston by the Winter Creek
summary: Two storey log cabin style home nestled amongst a cottage garden and well established privacy trees. Imagine sitting on the front porch with a cuppa watching the birds and listening to the meandering winter creek. A perfect backdrop for your wedding or commitment ceremony.
space: This property is within a short walking distance to everything Angaston while assuring peace, tranquility and privacy. We offer versatility, whether catering for families, small groups of friends or even holding your own small private garden function.  You have sufficient space for two families. Please let us know if you require bedding alterations. We are more than happy to substitute a queen bed for two additional single beds.  We have a queen bedroom upstairs with your own private balcony. Downstairs, you have views over the garden and grounds from the dine.  The setting goes well with your complimentary full breakfast. Cook this up in the full size kitchen or outdoors on the entertainment deck BBQ. We are even equipped with a juicer and coffee machine. The lounge room sets the scene for a quiet night in. Perhaps enjoy a movie from the DVD selection. Maybe we have your old favourite to watch while lounging in front of the combustion heater in addition to heating and cooling. If movi

Cook this up in the full size kitchen or outdoors on the entertainment deck BBQ. We are even eq
neighborhood_overview: Angaston is defined as the Crown of the Barossa nestled amongst the foothills. Country hospitality, beautiful scenery, culture, ample free open public spaces, walking tracks and push bike tracks coupled with the necessities, cafes, cheese shop, award winning butcher/small goods, restaurants, wine bars and of course, the world famous Barossa cellar doors. Why not consider hiring a scooter and capture you entire days experience on the go pro. We can load your day's captured experience onto the usb stick. Check us out on the (EMAIL HIDDEN)
notes: We do have some friendly semi free range chooks on the property who are responsible for laying your breakfast eggs. Our seasonal fruit is pesticide free and available for you. Additionally you will have access to any seasonal vegetables and spices.
transit: Public transport to the Barossa region departs from the city bus centre or you can jump off the train at Gawler and jump on a Linksa bus from there. Please let us know if you need assistance with public transport information. Additionally, there are chaeffeur driven hire cars, taxis, helicopters, push bikes and scooter hire.
access: You will have access to the entire property, secure partially enclosed outdoor entertainment area with 8 person spa, BBQ facilities, bar fridge and wall mounted television. The grounds are a key feature of the property, providing ample opportunity to watch the native birds going about their daily routines or engage in a game of backyard cricket.  During the winter months you can enjoy toasting some marshmallows over the bonfire drum. A good bonfire evokes relaxation and conversation.
interaction: Your privacy and guest experience is of paramount importance to us. We will interact with you as much or as little as you desire. We will link you with our preferred catering partners, party equipment hire and assist you to plan your event or we can suggest some must do's while visiting the Barossa. We can even suggest some family friendly activities.
house_rules: - The cabin is located within the historic town of Angaston and amongst our former neighbours. We ask that you enjoy yourselves while respecting the needs of our neighbours and our community.  - Smoking is permitted outside the house. Please place your cigarette butts in the entertainment deck trays. - Our grounds are not fenced, please ensure your children's safety.  Additionally, we ask that the spa covers are removed by two adults. The outdoor area and spa is fenced, however the winter creek draws its supply from neighbouring public space. We ask that you monitor your children's safety at all times. There is undercover parking for 2 cars and additional off street parking for a further 4 cars. The property is provided to you in good faith. Unfortunately our water, electricity, waste treatment, gas, rubbish collection, grounds maintenance, spa draining/refilling, firewood, clean and pressed linen together with free wifi and consumables are all provided for your convenience. In order t
host_about:
My partner Andrew and myself look forward to meeting you. The kids have almost all flown the coupe, yeh to some couple time. Well, until they return or drop off of the grandchildren. 
We have commenced a couple of new ventures and look forward to the trials and trivellations ahead. We both share a passion for living life to the max. Whether it's water skiing, wake boarding or attempting a new water based activity we will endeavour to give it a go.  We may not walk for a few days after, but that's another story. We love open air concerts, festivals, camping, gardening, building/construction/renovation. I love reading adventure novels and studying factual information to assist in new ventures, where as Andrew prefers me to provide him with the condensed version. 
We both firmly believe in ageing disgracefully.

name: Retro Barossa Style
summary: A lovely fully renovated 1950's house in the heart of Angaston. Experience the Barossa like a local. A short walk to the main in street, or if you feel like exploring everything is close. Drop into a winery for a glass of wine, enjoy a balloon ride across the Barossa or just kick back enjoy the pace of life. Please note a booking for two guests will allow access to one bedroom in the house. If you require both bedrooms you must book for a minimum of three guests.
space: This is an original 1950's house located in the heart of Angaston.  Ample space in the living area to relax and a fully equipped kitchen if you wish to take advantage of the tasty local produce. There is a large garden with seating and a BBQ, so in the warmer months you can delight in the outdoors. In winter heating through the house keeps you toasty warm creating a lovely space to just hang out.  The house is exclusively yours and we leave a welcome bottle of wine as well as some breakfast provisions. Brand new queen size beds in both rooms with quality linens means after your day of exploring you will be sure to get a good night's rest. The house has been lovingly renovated. The bathroom has a spacious shower with a rainfall shower head. Soaps, shampoo, conditioner and towels are all provided. Polished 50's baltic pine floors throughout as well as double brick meaning cool in the summer and warm in the winter.   If you just feel like chilling out there is a new 42 inch Smart TV with

neighborhood_overview: A beautiful town in the heart of the Barossa, Angaston is nestled in the rolling hills away from the hustle and bustle of the city. A great place to unwind and just enjoy the local places to dine or take a walk around the streets soaking up the feel of the Barossa.
notes: Please note a booking for two guests will allow access to one bedroom in the house. If you require both bedrooms you must book for a minimum of three guests.
transit: To travel around the Barossa you will need a car. There is very little public transport in the area.
access: You will have access to the whole house. There is also off street carparking and a spacious garden.
interaction: Happy to help out in any way we can. Contactable by phone.
house_rules: - This is a quiet neighbourhood, so no noise after 10pm please.  - We would appreciate it if you took your shoes off when inside just to help keep floors scratch free.  - There will be an additional cleaning fee if any smoking has occured in the house. - Please note a booking for two guests will allow access to one bedroom in the house. If you require both bedrooms you must book for a minimum of three guests.
host_about: I am a winemaker who has spent many years travelling and living overseas. I love the idea of living like a local when I travel and hope that my experience of being a traveller and a regular user of Airbnb as a guest will help create a wonderful experience for others:)

name: 51 Bevan St Barossa Valley Your home away
summary: Only a short stroll to the local Tavern and 5 cellar doors, boutique brewery, cafe and a short drive to award winning restaurants - Appellations, Hentley Farm, Fino, FermentAsian, Vitners Bar & Grill.  Maggie Beer's Farm Shop and numerous cellar doors are within a 20km radius. The Barossa Farmers Market (Saturday mornings) are held in the sheds behind Vitners B&G.  The property is near the village Lutheran church and cemetery so you can expect a quiet peaceful stay. Historic villages nearby.
space: 2 living areas, a toy room, 2 bathrooms and 2 undercover entertaining areas (plus a hugh fully secure back yard) gives everyone room to relax.

neighborhood_overview: Greenock is a small quiet friendly village in the Barossa and only an hours drive from Adelaide Airport. You'll find the locals very engaging and happy to help with any queries you may have. When visiting cellar doors please mention that you are staying in the Village.
transit: You can leave the car parked in the garage and book a winery tour package on one the various mini tour buses. Some of our guests have booked hot air balloon flights (to enjoy the stunning views from above) and hired bikes to explore the 40 km of cycling and walking paths joining the Northern & Southern Barossa.

name: Tanunda Cottages
summary: 4 cottages priced on Airbnb for a minimum of 8 people, can host up to 17 at an additional cost per person.   Set on beautiful grounds and conveniently located walking distance to popular restaurants and shops in Tanunda, quality self-contained accommodation, perfect for couples or group stays. 3 Cottages have 2 bedrooms, living and kitchenette. The 4th Cottage has 3 bedrooms, full kitchen, laundry, formal dining + lounge.  All Cottages have a cosy gas real flame fire and heating/cooling.
space: We have a lovely shaded private lawn area, perfect for picnics or even a marquee can be erected (at guests expense). Perfect for family gatherings. Private parking.

name: Barossa Vista, your home away from home
summary: Barossa Vista is a 3 bedroom, 2 bathroom home located at the start of the main street in Tanunda.  You will be able to walk to cafés, wine tasting and restaurants. You will enjoy views of the Barossa Ranges and the Barossa Valley vineyards.  The 1915 Bungalow as been renovated to include all the conveniences of a modern home with a full kitchen. The backyard has been re developed to include a stunning decking for alfresco dining and BBQ area.
space: The home is exclusively yours, regardless of the number of guests in your party.  Each booking will have full access to the kitchen, dining room, lounge room, decking and facilities.  Bedrooms are opened according to the number of bedrooms you require. Please note we charge by the room, not the person.  for example if you require 2 bedrooms please select 4 people (even if you are only 2 or 3 people) or if you need 3 bedrooms please select 6 guests (even if you are only 3, 4 or 5 people)  For one person/couple you will be sleeping in the King bedroom with an en-suite for $330 per night, (select 2 people).  For a second person/couple the second bedroom has a Queen bed with access to the common bathroom with laundry facilities for a total of $495 per night, (select 4 people). For a third person/couple the third bedroom has a Queen bed and will share the common bathroom for a total of $660 per night, (select 6 people).

The backyard has been re developed to include a stunning decking for alfresco dining and BBQ area. The home is exclusively yours, regardless of the number of guests in your party. notes: The keys are available via the Key Safe located above the BBQ by the back door.  We will sms you the keys safe code the day before arrival.
transit: We have space for 4 cars to park in our drive way.
access: You will be able to relax on the leather sofa in front of the open fire place whilst entertaining yourself by watching a DVD’s on the flat screen TV; choose from one of the 100 books available; connect your phone or MP3 to the speakers or even log onto the wireless broadband (NOTE:  Max 2GB per stay) to keep in touch with friends.    If you fancy cooking a gourmet meal using gourmet Barossa produce will be able to take advantage of the full cooking facilities, or enjoy the expansive decking whilst cooking a traditional Aussie BBQ.
interaction: The house is exclusively yours with no onsite manager, however we are only a phone call away should you need any assistance.
house_rules: 1 bedroom (King bed, max 2 people) - $300 per night 2 bedrooms (King + Queen bed, max 4 people) - $450 per night 3 bedrooms (King + 2 Queen beds, max 6 people) - $600 per night Minimum 3 night booking for Public Holiday long weekends. Minimum 3 room booking for Public Holiday weekends and Events. Children requiring a bed are deemed as 1 person, infants or toddlers in a cot may use the onsite cot with their own bedding free of charge.

name: Grand Cru Estate Homestead
summary: This Homestead is a rural splendour surrounded by a 5 ha garden with its own lake & vineyard. The Homestead has been set up to be a luxury experience with its own unique and personal touches inc. a library full of books.  A complete experience with peace and tranquillity. The Homestead is ideal for couples or works exceptionally well for a group travelling together.
space: If one couple books the Homestead then no other bookings can be taken. In other words there is no sharing with strangers even though only 1 or the 3 bedrooms have been booked! If two individuals wish to book then two bedrooms need to be paid for. If three individuals book then three bedrooms need to be booked.
description: This Homestead is a rural splendour surrounded by a 5 ha garden with its own lake & vineyard. The Homestead has been set up to be a luxury experience with its own unique and personal touches inc. a library full of books.  A complete experience with peace and tranquillity. The Homestead is ideal for couples or works exceptionally well for a group travelling together. If one couple books the Homestead then no other bookings can be taken. In other words there is no sharing with strangers even though only 1 or the 3 bedrooms have been booked! If two individuals wish to book then two bedrooms need to be paid for. If three individuals book then three bedrooms need to be booked. The Homestead is large and roomy. It works wonderfully for 2 and 3 couples sharing as a group travelling together. A beautiful quiet country location surrounded by peace and tranquility. Your own vehicle or tours drivers are required. Long term stays are welcome and pricing is based on 1 couple. Pricing is negotiable
neighborhood_overview: A beautiful quiet country location surrounded by peace and tranquility.
notes: Long term stays are welcome and pricing is based on 1 couple. Pricing is negotiable upon individual requests and number of guests staying. Gourmet provisions and wine are not included with this special pricing. Breakfast provisions provided for the first 2 days.
transit: Your own vehicle or tours drivers are required.
access: The Homestead is large and roomy. It works wonderfully for 2 and 3 couples sharing as a group travelling together.
house_rules: The homestead is an extremely suitable accommodation for a group of friends or family members staying together as a getaway.  Extra guests are strictly not allowed and no "camping" is allowed on the floor or on furniture. Guests may only stay in beds provided as this is a luxury accommodation with excellent standards and facilities offered. Please respect the hosts standards and house rules to save embarrassment. Thank you
host_about: I have a love of country life with all that nature offers. I am a huge garden buff and have created an extensive garden for all to enjoy. I have many hobbies, breeding Golden Retrievers, bee keeping, candle maker, horse lover to name a few. I really enjoy hosting guests from all facets of life. I love a good bonfire during the cooler months and rugging up to enjoy the dormancy of winter! I am a perfectionist and enjoy creating new outdoor spaces. I enjoy traveling Europe and have English blood in the veins! I look forward to meeting you as do our three beautiful Golden Retrieves Malt, Maddie and Maisie.

name: The Winemakers - Tanunda, Barossa Valley
summary: Greetings! Our place is gorgeous for couples, business travellers, and families just wanting to explore vineyards, wineries, totally relax in lovely surrounds and have fun in the beautiful Barossa! A country home with a little style & super convenient to everything. We know you'll love it!! CHECKOUT OUR OTHER PROPERTY LISTINGS!
space: Polished timber floors, art, Persian rugs and a few antiques from its owners world travels. Central and peaceful. A perfect getaway for couples & families. Two bathrooms. 3 bedrooms with gorgeous white linen & huge spa towels. Open plan living areas with plenty of comfy lounges. Bright sunny living areas and bedrooms with garden & courtyard views from every window....comfortable space for 2 to 6 persons.
description: Greetings! Our place is gorgeous for couples, business travellers, and families just wanting to explore vineyards, wineries, totally relax in lovely surrounds and have fun in the beautiful Barossa! It's your getaway so relax

notes: We'll give you the best personal recommendations for an amazing stay in the valley!! Recommendation for dining, wineries, tours, everything! Just ask!  Please note - We do not allow non House guests to be or stay on our properties. They are reserved especially for booked guests only. Thank you for your understanding.
transit: Easy with hire car. Join a tour of the valley or let us arrange a private tour tailored to your requirements.  Just an hour from the Adelaide airport.

host_about: Travelling, Cooking, Winemaking & spending quality time with my beautiful wife & children are some of my greatest passions in life.

name: Bluebird Cottage is a relaxing 100year old cottage
summary: My place is good for couples and business travellers.  Bluebird Cottage is a unique and historic Bed & Breakfast nestled in the heart of South Australia's famous Barossa Valley region in Angaston. Your stay at Bluebird Cottage is all about winding down and relaxing to enjoy the atmosphere created by the charm in the cottage. Capture the Barossa Experience with a day of wine tasting at many world class wineries and we are in walking distance to first class restaurants, cafes and pubs.
space: You can take the direct route from Adelaide via Port Wakefield Road, Northern Expressway up to Nuriootpa then across to Angaston (80 km). You may prefer to take the route through the Adelaide hills to Birdwood, Mt Pleasant which is a more scenic drive. Our guests are pleasantly surprised at the size and space our cottage provides which is ideal for one or two couples to enjoy comfortably.

Bluebird Cottage is a charming early settlers cottage which acquires its name from the feature hand-painted lead light
neighborhood_overview: Angaton has got a relaxing village feel,our guests like to just walk and have coffe at some of nice cafes .Restaurants are in walking distance and wineries are just a very short drive ,as is the farmers market which is open on Saturday
notes: If you like walking or bike riding there are walking trails and a bike hire shop in the town.   you can also hire a motor scooter which is a great way of seeing the Barossa Valley We offer our guests bikes and helmets to explore the Barossa
access: Bluebird Cottage is a charming early settlers cottage which acquires its name from the feature hand-painted lead light windows in each bedroom. The cottage is furnished with period furniture, comfortable beds, lounge chairs, luxury dining and modern kitchen/bathroom facilities (with second shower, toilet and laundry) and an outdoor entertaining courtyard under the 100 year old vines and barbecue.
interaction: We are always available to help our guests with local knowledge of the beautiful Barossa Valley and if required we can suggest a tour which could save time.We also offer a complimenary 2 hour guided tour,with a map of suggested wineries and places of interest

name: Barossa Welcome
summary: Tanunda is a great central point with its quaint cafes, pubs, shops and wineries from which to explore the Barossa Valley. Numerous seasonal events including wine tours, weddings, concerts and food fairs occur.  Your comfort and enjoyment are assured with a home away from experience. Our home there sleeps up to three couples, with two full bathrooms, both including separate shower and spa bath.  It has a well appointed eat in kitchen and large family room with all amenities.

name: Barossa Vineyard Cottages
summary: Situated in Bethany, our fully self-contained stone cottages are located in the heart of the Barossa Valley.  Bordered by vineyards and a stunning outlook to the Barossa Ranges, the area is steeped in history and boasts of great walks as well as being surrounded by award winning wineries and restaurants. With modern comforts behind classic settler style and grace, our cottages remain comfortable in every season.

name: Barossa Glen - Henri's Cottage - Bed and Breakfast
summary: The perfect getaway. A uniquely secluded, air conditioned, bed and breakfast cottage in a romantic setting, exclusively for two. Vistas over looking rolling hills and vineyards from the paved terrace. A country charmed garden, a self cook full breakfast and a two person therapeutic spa.
space: Enjoy the peacefulness and exclusivity of the Barossa Valley countryside. Stunning paranoramic views of glorious green rolling hills and vineyards as far as the eye can see. Evening visits by the local birds kangaroos and koalas . The flora and fauna will keep you encapsulated to the region.
description: The perfect getaway. A uniquely secluded, air conditioned, bed and breakfast cottage in a romantic setting, exclusively for two. Vistas over looking rolling hills and vineyards from the paved terrace. A country charmed garden, a self cook full breakfast and a two person therapeutic spa. Enjoy the peacefulness and exclusivity of the Barossa Valley countryside. Stunning paranoramic views of glorious green rolling hills and vineyards as far as the eye can see. Evening visits by the local birds kangaroos and koalas . The flora and fauna will keep you encapsulated to the region. You'll have full exclusive access to a fully equipped kitchen, BBQ, two person spa, TV with fetch TV and Netflix. Breakfast provision including eggs, bacon, continental breakfast and many teas and coffees along with samples of local chocolate and port. I will endevour to greet you upon arrival and give you a regional outline and some suggested attractions, restaurants and other activities.   If this is not possible
neighborhood_overview: Secluded country cottage. Shops and restaurants are within a  comfortable driving distance. This is a great location to launch your self drive tour of the Barossa.  If you are traveling here for the first time or would like some new ideas - We are more than happy to help with additional information and suggestions on restaurants, wineries, places of interest, walking trails and more.
notes: -A two night minimum applies -Wi-fi is available 24-7 -Netflix is available with access  to thousands of movies and TV series.
transit: Own vehicle is recommended, for winery, restaurant and other attraction visitations.  There are numerous tours and tour operators in the area if you're more inclined to get into the spirit and wine.  There is a bike track 2.2 km ride away.  It will take you through the Barossa but keep in mind the Barossa by bike is a rather large undertaking with 40 km of quality sealed bike track.
access: You'll have full exclusive access to a fully equipped kitchen, BBQ, two person spa, TV with fetch TV and Netflix. Breakfast provision including eggs, bacon, continental breakfast and many teas and coffees along with samples of local chocolate and port.
interaction: I will endevour to greet you upon arrival and give you a regional outline and some suggested attractions, restaurants and other activities.   If this is not possible I will be able to make a key accessible and have a large number of brochures available to you. I am more than happy to accommodate dietry requirements and special requests  eg pre-purchasing that specific wine you like or having a taxi booked and confirmed for that special event you're going to.
house_rules: I expect you to respect Barossa Glen as they would your own home. Keep tidy, yet please relax and enjoy. If there are any amenities or facilities not working as they should please let me know, this way i can help make yours and others stays as carefree as possible.  No smoking indoors. I am also open to hosting small garden weddings ( its a lovely spot) but please recognise that there will be an additional charge. I am more than willing to help with additional resources such as chairs and trestle tables to help make it a special day. Advance notice is appropriate so i can deliver the best outcomes . I also have friends who can help with a couple of wedding cars (fj holden and hd holden) for a fee. The barossa is beautiful at any time of year. Please use the bins provided. And if you do smoke please keep cigarette butts in the ashtrays provided outside. They are there for convenience and to maintain a healthy environment for all.
host_about: We enjoy travel and enjoy knowing what you love about travel too. We love getting to see something more of each local region. We have unlimited understanding and knowledge of our local region to help make your stay a little bit better. By meeting locals and travellers we enjoy sharing stories, finding and creating something special together.

name: Halletts Valley Hideaway
summary: Halletts Valley Hideaway is tucked away on the outskirts of Tanunda, in the heart of the beautiful Barossa Valley. (Just 2 mins drive from the Tanunda main street.) Our cottage completed in January 2017, has been rebuilt from the ground up. It features high quality fittings, furnishings, appliances and lighting, while recycling the original timber beams and local stone. Enjoy a fabulous getaway experience in a unique, private, secluded, self-contained cottage, at a very affordable price.
space: A rare opportunity to enjoy fresh, new, high quality accommodation, while experiencing one of the most outstanding Barossa vistas. A unique blend of rustic and contemporary themes in a brilliantly secluded location right in the heart of the Barossa.  The cottage features a magnificent DOUBLE SHOWER featuring high quality Methven shower heads. In the winter months, enjoy the fabulous Nectre slow combustion heater. Kindling and fire-wood supplied.  Note that it is our policy NOT to use the wood heater during the Light Regional Council Fire ban season which usually runs from the 1st of November to the 30th of April each year.  A generous selection of locally sourced Barossa food, drinks and nibbles supplied with our compliments for you to enjoy!

neighborhood_overview: You will not find anything else like this in the Barossa!
notes: Enjoy the many local wineries - St Hallett - across the valley. Pindarie - featuring great wines and more quality stone work.

name: Wroxton Grange
summary: Our place is close to restaurants and dining. You’ll love our place because of the outdoors space and the light. Our place is good for couples, solo adventurers, business travellers, and families (with kids).
space: We are a married couple who live in a spacious bluestone homestead, circa 1870, & enjoy sharing our family heritage with others.  You are welcome to walk our beautiful 500 acre property with its birdlife, drystone walls, vineyards, sheep & cattle.
description: Our place is close to restaurants and dining. You’ll love our place because of the outdoors space and the light. Our place is good for couples, solo adventurers, business travellers, and families (with kids). We are a married couple who live in a spacious bluestone homestead, circa 1870, & enjoy sharing our family heritage with others.  You are welcome to walk our beautiful 500 acre property with its birdlife, drystone walls, vineyards, sheep & cattle. The spacious guest suite is private & self contained with all amenities & has its own private entrance from the front verandah which is ideal for outdoor breakfasts. As we live under the same roof as our guests, we  need to respect each others' space.  However, we are usually on hand & happy to help with our local knowledge & any problems you may encounter. We are situated close to a conservation park with its Aussie wildlife or take a short 5km drive to the nearest town of Angaston, which has an English heritage & is known as the foodie
neighborhood_overview: We are situated close to a conservation park with its Aussie wildlife or take a short 5km drive to the nearest town of Angaston, which has an English heritage & is known as the foodie capital of the Barossa.  It has a Saturday morning Farmers Market, cheese shop, coffee shops, wine tasting room, parks & a pleasant village atmosphere.
transit: It is best to arrive here with a car as public transport is very limited. From here you can easily visit the small wine producers of the Eden Valley wine region but if this is your first trip to the Barossa you may prefer to drive yourselves to explore the various attractions of the area which interest you most. There are also local wine tours on offer which we can assist with.
access: The spacious guest suite is private & self contained with all amenities & has its own private entrance from the front verandah which is ideal for outdoor breakfasts.
interaction: As we live under the same roof as our guests, we  need to respect each others' space.  However, we are usually on hand & happy to help with our local knowledge & any problems you may encounter.
house_rules: Guest accommodation, while private, is under main roof of homestead so we need to respect each others' space. Use of bedrooms - we consider each bedroom (queen & twin) to sleep two guests. If there are two of you but you do not wish to share a bedroom & wish to use both bedrooms, please enquire with us & we can work out the extra charges for you.
host_about: My husband, Ian & I are third generation vignerons on our family vineyard property in the Eden Valley region of the beautiful Barossa, renowned for its fine food & wine.  Ian is the vigneron & I work at the library as local history officer.  We have travelled widely, to North & South America, Europe, Africa, Asia & New Zealand and a favourite destination is England.  We now enjoy driving with our caravan to all parts of this wide brown land of Australia.  We have hosted B&B guests in a self contained queen suite in our spacious Victorian homestead  for many years & have always enjoyed sharing our corner of the world with others.  We would now like to welcome you to this special place with its peace amid immense rural beauty, yet close to all the attractions of the Barossa, such as the nearby Conservation Park, Saturday Farmers Market, wineries, restaurants & more!

summary: You’ll love the house because of Just 3 minutes’ drive from the heart of the Barossa Valley wine region (Angaston). It is 9 minutes’ drive from the Barossa Farmers Market and 20 minutes’ drive from The Barossa Valley Golf Club Located in the Lambert Estate Winery, the house looks down the beautiful vineyard. Enjoy your day relaxing in the yard and having the kangaroos as your traveling companions  The entire house is good for couples, business travellers, families (with kids), and big groups
description: You’ll love the house because of Just 3 minutes’ drive from the heart of the Barossa Valley wine region (Angaston). host_about: The Barossa Valley is renowned wine-producing region northeast of Adelaide. If you are a wine lover, this is the destination you must visit. However, the Barossa has much more to offer than wine, please come and experience it.  Lambert estate retreat is part of Lambert Estate and it has been welcoming guests since 2013. We try our best to offer you the home-feeling accommodation.

name: Lemke Cottage,Moculta, Barossa Valley
summary: Our place is ideal for couples and business travellers. It has been our home away from home for 26 years.  We have furnished it with locally made antique furniture.  Jan has the largest collection of wire ware in Australia and guests will see these items displayed in the kitchen and throughout the cottage. The cottage is fully equipped with TV and free Wi Fi. Guests are provided with a light breakfast with a selection of cereals, bread for toast, a selection of condiments and tea or coffee.
space: Lemke Cottage is located in the small hamlet of Moculta, 8kms from Angaston.  The cottage has two bedrooms, one in the loft and the second on the ground floor.  The cottage was built in the 1860's and at various times it was a school, store and for a time licensed to sell alcohol.  Daniel Lemke, after whom the cottage is named, moved into the cottage initially teaching the local children but later turned his hand to organ building.  He built a number of small organs for the local churches one of which remains at the nearby Gruenberg Church.  He later travelled and sold organs to churches in other states.
description: Our place is ideal for couples and business travellers. It has been our home away from home for 26 years.  We have furnished it with locally made antique furniture.  Jan has the largest collection of wire ware in Australia and guests will see these items displayed in the kitchen and throughout the cottage. The cottage is fully equipped with TV and free Wi Fi. Guests are provided with a light breakfast with a selection of cereals, bread for toast, a selection of condiments and tea or coffee. Lemke Cottage is located in the small hamlet of Moculta, 8kms from Angaston.  The cottage has two bedrooms, one in the loft and the second on the ground floor.  The cottage was built in the 1860's and at various times it was a school, store and for a time licensed to sell alcohol.  Daniel Lemke, after whom the cottage is named, moved into the cottage initially teaching the local children but later turned his hand to organ building.  He built a number of small organs for the local churches one of whi
neighborhood_overview: Moculta is a quiet little hamlet of about 280 residents. It is served by two Lutheran churches, Gruenberg and Gnadenberg.  Both are historic and worth visiting.  A visit to the Barossa wouldn't be complete without a visit to the Barossa Valley Cheese Company to purchase some locally made cheese and crackers to go with your favourite wine.There are a number of wineries a short drive away, with Henschke Hill of Grace Winery and vineyard the closest. There is an information book with our selection of favourite  take away and restaurants for the information of guests.
notes: The antique meat safe has a range of items for guests to use.  We ask that should you use any of them please let us know via the comments book so that we can replenish them for future guests. Please note that other buildings on the property are out of bounds to guests.
transit: There is parking for two cars on the property.  Angaston is 8kms away with shops, a number of hotels and restaurants.  A winery directory is located in the information folder.
access: Access to the cottage is via a key held in a key box located near the back door.  Access to the cottage is only through the back door. Note that there is a movement activated security camera at the back door.
interaction: Entry to the cottage is by the rear door.  I am available for contact by phone if needed.  I have however, provided a comprehensive information folder outlining how to use the appliances and equipment in the cottage for your information.
house_rules: Guests are asked to leave the cottage as found and to treat our property and furniture as you would your own please?  Note that if 2 guests use both beds we ask that a one off $10 surcharge  be payed when booking please?
host_about: John and Jan Shepherd have owned Lemke Cottage for 26 years.  Both have lead professional lives and have used the cottage as a weekend escape during this time. They have travelled extensively and stayed in B and B's rather than hotels and motels.  They decided to share their unique cottage with others and offer it as an Air BnB. They both enjoy overseas travel but also have travelled extensively throughout Australia.  John now runs a consultancy helping businesses grow, and Jan keeps busy with volunteering as a Justice of the Peace, Folk Dancing and Tai Chi.  They both enjoy music and regularly attend Adelaide Symphony Orchestra Concerts. They have 9 grandchildren and enjoy time with their family.

A 2nd Queen bedroom is available.The Queen room cannot be booked by itself as it shares the bathroom/toilet in the  King.

neighborhood_overview: We are a 1 min walk to the main street of Angaston which is not called the Jewel of the Barossa for nothing. It's a beautiful village surrounded by vineyards,great restaurants and stunning scenery.
notes: Maddie,our gorgeous Jack Russell, lives in our part of the house. She is very people friendly. A picnic basket & rug is available to borrow.
transit: It's best to have a car to get around the Barossa to visit the wineries & restaurants. There are taxis and tour companies but no Uber.
access: Your modern apartment style accommodation is totally private, quiet and separate from our area. You will have your own bedroom/s, private lounge,  Continental Breakfast,expresso coffee machine, microwave, fridge, plates, cutlery and shared pool access.However, the other end of the house where we live,including our lounge/kitchen  are not accessible to guests.
interaction: We are available at  the other end of  the house if needed.Happy to give advice on local wineries and restaurants and the Barossa generally.
house_rules: - Free wifi.   - We provide a 42 " flat screen TV with unlimited Netflix.  - You are welcome to use our pool on the strict condition that you are solely responsible for yourself and your children. No glass at  the pool please, plastic glasses provided.  Pool towels provided. - Check in 2 pm - Check out 11 am
host_about: I was a New York jewellery designer and spent 5 years traveling the world selling my original work on six star cruise ships.Came to this  beautiful country 4 years ago,first to the northern beaches of Sydney,now recently settled in the beautiful wine growing region of  the Barossa Valley,Australia and here I am staying.I am a houseproud homebody who enjoys the simplicities of life and meeting like minded souls from around the world.

name: Barossa Valley Dreams Home for up to 17 people
summary: My place is walking distance to Wineries, Brewery, restaurants and cafes, shops. Barossa Dreams offers up to 6 bedrooms, 4 bathrooms, 2 kitchens, Complimentary Wi-Fi and access to swimming pool. Great flexibility with bedding configurations. We are also Tour Barossa so would love to help with all your touring needs as well. Base price quoted is based on up to 10 people house can accommodate up to 17 people with 4 people utilising 2 sofa beds. Additional charges apply for numbers over 10.
space: Barossa Dreams offers great flexibility for groups. The standard bedding is 5 queen beds, 3 single beds and 2 double sofa bed. (4 of the queen beds can also be split into single beds at an additional charge)  We also operate our own touring business, so we can tailor make wine tours for your group, restaurant transfers and airport transfers. Our property is perfectly located to walk to restaurants and wineries in Tanunda.

name: Bridgets House
summary: Bridgets House is within 2 minutes walk of the main street of the Tanunda located in the heart of Australia's most famous wine region, the Barossa Valley. It's an easy walk to our favourite restaurants, beautiful retail stores, pubs and main town facilities such as pharmacy, supermarket and a great wine store. Everything you need is at the end of the street and the price includes up to 4 guests! No chintz or friezes, just a much loved sunny home (and best of all, no cabs required).
space: Bridgets House is a 1950's brick home on the outside, with lashings of love and contemporary styling on the inside. It's a great space to spend some time either sitting around the old butchers block over a cup of tea in the kitchen or relaxing on the deck which looks over a dwarf organic fruit orchard (which you're welcome to help yourself to).  A main bedroom at the front of the house is available as well as a smaller double bedroom off the living space.  The bathroom isn't display-home beautiful but its completely functional.
description: Bridgets House is within 2 minutes walk of the main street of the Tanunda located in the heart of Australia's most famous wine region, the Barossa Valley. It's an easy walk to our favourite restaurants, beautiful retail stores, pubs and main town facilities such as pharmacy, supermarket and a great wine store. Everything you need is at the end of the street and the price includes up to 4 guests! No chintz or friezes, just a much loved sunny home (and best of all, no cabs required). Bridgets House is a 1950's brick home on the outside, with lashings of love and contemporary styling on the inside. It's a great space to spend some time either sitting around the old butchers block over a cup of tea in the kitchen or relaxing on the deck which looks over a dwarf organic fruit orchard (which you're welcome to help yourself to).  A main bedroom at the front of the house is available as well as a smaller double bedroom off the living space.  The bathroom isn't display-home beautiful but its co
neighborhood_overview: Tanunda is the heart of the Barossa Valley and home to the best retail experiences and some great restaurants and coffee shops. It's literally all at the end of the street. The Barossa is famous for its wine, delicious regional produce, evocative dining experiences and beautiful scenery. You can choose to go out during the day to visit wineries and places of interest and during the evening everything is at your fingertips.
notes: There is a folder outlining my favourite things to do in the Barossa to help you have the best experience possible.  I'm a Barossa native, so we are all friends around here and we love making sure that visitors have a really positive experience. Also note there is no microwave in the house so please be aware of that when booking.  All other cooking facilities are provided. I provide eggs, bread, milk, butter, tea and coffee as breakfast provisions to get you through your first breakfast or two.
transit: You really need car to visit the Barossa, but it's worth it!
access: In true Airbnb style, this is my home but I'm living elsewhere currently, so you have the whole house and garden block to yourself.  Consequently I am not here to meet you but I am always available by phone and not always so far away. There is a undercover carport and the back of the house is completely private.
interaction: I'm so sorry that I can't meet you personally but I message you a couple of days before your stay to make arrangements for keys etc. I'll be able to talk to you at any stage during your stay but I have a friend Bianca who is my cohost and lives locally so can help with anything if I'm not available, which is unlikely.
house_rules: - Four people maximum - no extra charge over 2 people - please love my house like I do, it's my home - please use heating and cooling with respect to the environment and the low cost of this accommodation, ie. turn off overnight or while you are out

name: Marble Lodge B&B - The Camellia Room
summary: Marble Lodge is centrally located in the very heart of Angaston in the beautiful Barossa Valley, and just a short 5 minute walk to restaurants and wine bars. Our expansive private estate grounds ensure a quiet location for romantic weekend stays, or longer business visits.  We do not offer stays longer than 4-5 nights.
space: The Camellia Room of the Bed & Breakfast Lodge, which is situated partially behind the Heritage-Listed Homestead, 150m back from street frontage.  Large private estate grounds and gardens;  shared but private spa bath; formal dining room in the main homestead is where breakfasts are served by the Owner, by candlelight.  Marble Lodge offers Hosted Accommodation.  We have no facilities for children.  We can only accommodate couples.

notes: Day or Half-day Tours of the Barossa Wineries, can be made, with pick-up from your door of the B&B Lodge.

name: The Marble Room - Barossa
summary: The Marble Room is actually a suite of rooms situated in a lovely turn of the century marble fronted Villa in the centre of the Barossa Valley ; Tanunda.  With large rooms , high ceilings and classic stained glass feature windows, this suite is spacious and quiet. The Marble Room suite has a beautifully light filled bedroom luxuriously appointed, a cosy lounge with a comfortable sofa bed , a dining area and a stunning bathroom .    A beautiful place from which to enjoy the Barossa Valley.
space: The Marble Room is situated in a turn of the century marble fronted Villa. Set in a central position; walking distance to cafes, restaurants and shops and close to Barossa Wineries. The Marble room is a suite of rooms with a  beautifully appointed large bedroom for couples or singles. There is also another sofa bed situated in the lounge , so that two couples can be accommodated . A luxurious bathroom with deep bath and a separate dining area complete the suite. This suite of rooms has some shared access but privacy is guaranteed.  There is a large screen TV with dvd player and Netflix available in the lounge, FREE WIFI. *Price listed is for two people (and use of one bedroom) only and includes a continental breakfast for each day.  Preference is for two night bookings on weekends.
description: The Marble Room is actually a suite of rooms situated in a lovely turn of the century marble fronted Villa in the centre of the Barossa Valley ; Tanunda.  With large rooms , high ceilings and classic stained glass feature windows, this suite is spacious and quiet. The Marble Room suite has a beautifully light filled bedroom luxuriously appointed, a cosy lounge with a comfortable sofa bed , a dining area and a stunning bathroom .    A beautiful place from which to enjoy the Barossa Valley. The Marble Room is situated in a turn of the century marble fronted Villa. Set in a central position; walking distance to cafes, restaurants and shops and close to Barossa Wineries. The Marble room is a suite of rooms with a  beautifully appointed large bedroom for couples or singles. There is also another sofa bed situated in the lounge , so that two couples can be accommodated . A luxurious bathroom with deep bath and a separate dining area complete the suite. This suite of rooms has some shared acc
access: The Marble Room  suite of rooms , consisting of a Queen size bedroom , a dining room and a lounge with a  luxury bathroom and separate toilet . The sofa bed in the lounge is very comfortable with an innerspring mattress. The suite is part of our home and does therefore has some common access areas  with another family bedroom located nearby however we give guests as much privacy as possible . Being an old house , it is very quiet. Guests have a separate private entrance.
interaction: We like to give guests as much privacy as possible but are always available if guests require anything.
house_rules: - The Marble Room is part of our home and has shared space areas with another bedroom nearby, however we respect privacy and keep any family use of these to a minimum. Bathroom is for guests only. We can give total privacy if requested by guests. Please respect our beautiful old wooden floors by not wearing high heels inside.
host_about: Our family has had many wonderful experiences travelling in other countries and I would love to share the experience of our regions with you. Living between the vineyards and the coast we are able to share the lifestyle of both with our guests.

name: Marble Lodge - The Magnolia Executive Suite
summary: Marble Lodge is centrally located in the very heart of Angaston in the beautiful Barossa Valley, and just a short 5 minute walk to restaurants and wine bars. Our expansive private estate grounds ensure a quiet location for romantic weekend stays, or longer business visits. The Magnolia Executive Suite is perfect for romantic getaways, and offers large living areas, private spa, large plasma TV open fire and is fully air-conditioned.
space: Marble Lodge is located on an extensive private estate, well away from noisy streets and offer private accommodation surrounded by large private grounds and gardens. Located at the very heart of Angaston in the Barossa Valley, Marble Lodge is central to everything the Barossa Valley has to offer

name: Retro Barossa
summary: My Retro Barossa home is a short walk to the main street, the Barossa Regional Art Gallery, The Tanunda Clubhouse, Chateau Tanunda Winery and numerous restaurants/cafes. You’ll love my place because of the location, the retro meets modern interior, as well as the spaciousness of the living area. Your private air-conditioned bedroom is located upstairs with your own private bathroom. My place is ideal for couples, solo adventurers, and business travellers.

name: Casa Rossa - Barossa Valley
summary: A hidden paradise in the heart of the Barossa, with everything you need for a peaceful family-friendly getaway. It is the perfect home base for exploring the Barossa Valley and making the most of your stay, whether you're an outdoors type, a wine connoisseur or just simply here to unwind. Then spend your evenings looking out onto its private vineyard and drinking in the sights and smells of nature at your doorstep, or cozy up by the log fire with a glass of wine and the vinyls spinning...
space: Picture a rustic-style farmhouse, complete with solid red bricks, wide windows and wooden fixtures throughout - but with a newly refurbished contemporary bathroom and full air-conditioning for a touch of modern luxury. Upon arrival you may enter through the laundry, or take the scenic route via the garden, vineyard and terrace courtyard to enter into the kitchen area, which is equipped with a dishwasher and brand-new induction stovetop, and soaks up the sun all day long through its French doors and windows.  The kitchen leads into the dining and living room, laundry, hallway and secondary lounge room. The laundry is equipped with a brand new washer, and a second shower and toilet. A clothesline is provided in the courtyard, which can be accessed via the door across from the laundry.  The open-plan dining room and living area is fitted out with top of the range furnishings, beautiful, locally hand-painted artwork, a Smart TV and a log fire for your enjoyment in winter. This room has a s

neighborhood_overview: Casa Rossa is located in Lyndoch, South Australia, Australia. Lyndoch is a small but thriving town in the heart of the Barossa Valley, and is growing and improving constantly. From the property, it is about a twenty minute scenic walk into town, or a speedy five minute drive.  You should be able to stock up on most things in Lyndoch, especially if you are in need of a quick fix. There is an IGA and convenience store, hairdresser and beautician, pub, and a number of great restaurants and cafes. Make sure you get to the Lord Lyndoch bistro for dinner!  For bigger shops, head to Gawler, about a ten minute drive from the property, which has a shopping mall and main street strip with Coles, Foodland, Big W, Target etc, as well as a number of boutiques and specialty stores.  Local attractions and venues include cellar doors and art Galleries. Hot air-ballooning  Helicopter Scenic flights Lord Lyndoch Restaurant  Lavender farm Plan your days by first visiting the Excellent Tourist office loca
notes: If you are able to hire a car, we recommend you do so! It is the best way to access the magic of the Barossa, especially from Casa Rossa, which is less than a twenty minute drive from some of the Valley's most fantastic towns - and some of South Australia's most exquisite restaurants!
transit: As mentioned earlier, the best way to get around Lyndoch and the Barossa is by hiring a car. However, there is also a newly built scenic bicycle path running from Angaston to Gawler via Tanunda which is worth experiencing.
access: Full access to all areas of home, apart from garage and supply storeroom.
interaction: Should you need any assistance do not hesitate to contact Maria, Jess or Andy.

name: Bilyara House - in the heart of Tanunda
summary: LUXURY SELF CONTAINED ACCOMMODATION CENTRALLY LOCATED IN THE HEART OF TANUNDA Bilyara House offers a perfectly central location to explore the region, located adjacent to Tanunda Main Street. Our décor is modern and comfortable with tasteful reflections of the house’s 1940s' and 50’s romance and Art Deco Style. It has an Open Wood Fireplace.
space: It is designed to accommodate up to 8 guests comfortably with 3 bedrooms and 2 Bathrooms. Breakfast provisions are supplied for cooked breakfast made up of the best local produce on first night. The Butcher, Baker & Supermarket are also within short walking distance, allowing you to make your own home cooked fine dining experience as our accommodation offers fully equipped modern kitchen facilities with inside and outside dining areas comfortably seating 8 people. HISTORY Built in 1947, Bilyara House was the home of one of the Wallent Sons. The Wallents were well known identities about the town. F.C.G. Wallent & Sons was a fine Tanunda Haberdashery Store (now "Living by Design") with the adjoining Wallant Family Home now housing 1918 Restaurant. Maurice Wallent was the Tanunda Mayor for a time. /  Natalie & Andy
description: LUXURY SELF CONTAINED ACCOMMODATION CENTRALLY LOCATED IN THE HEART OF TANUNDA Bilyara House offers a perfectly central location to explore the region, located adjacent to Tanunda Main Street. neighborhood_overview: Bilyara House offers you a perfect location in the centre of the Tanunda Township to begin you exploration of the Barossa Valley, it wineries, restaurants and fine food experiences. You will be able to walk to the local supermarket, butcher and baker if you want to self cater. All of these stock the fine local provisions the region is known for. Alternatively you may like to visit the local Barossa Farmers Markets located within 10 mins drive on Saturday Morning. Here the local store holders provide everything from fresh fruit and seasonal veg, baked goods, condiments, curries, ice creams and the list goes on. But there is no need to cook! Bilyara house is located across the road from 2 of the Barossa’s fine dining experiences – Ferment Asian and 1918.
transit: There is close walking access to 4 fine dining experiences, family friendly pubs, the Tanunda Club, as well as no less than 12 coffee shops. The Butcher, Baker & Supermarket are also within short walking distance.
access: Natalie and Andy invite you to enjoy Bilyara House. We have endeavoured to provide a comfortable space suitable to accommodate up to 8 people. You will have all the comforts and conveniences of home. A fully equipped kitchen, comfortable bedrooms, 2 bathrooms and living areas that accommodate todays modern entertainment needs.
interaction: Andy and Natalie live locally and should any need arise they can assist upon request.

Barossa Valley, South Australia
Musician

name: The Art Box home gallery stay
summary: The Art Box is  a unique home and gallery. It is close to the town centre, including wine & cheese tasting, restaurants, supermarket and parks.. You’ll love it here because of  the fabulous views, your private spaces, walking distance to services and a gallery of my eclectic range of art .. The Art Box is great for couples, solo adventurers, and business travellers.
space: The Art box offers you a private bedroom, private lounge, own bathroom and toilet, outdoor area and private access. Our house is open plan and has levels. Your space is on the higher level and each room has a door. Robes are provided for you as you move from your living space to your bathroom. The only steps (5) on this level are to your bathroom.   There is ducted air conditioning for the warmer months , the house is fueled by a wood fire which is  in our living area but can warm your quarters also.  Additional heaters are provided  in each your bedroom and lounge, and an electric blanket on your bed for the chillier Barossa conditions It is a unique home and I am confident you will love it as I do.

neighborhood_overview: We are situated in a residential area where hills and trees are the backdrop. a beautiful spot. As we are situated toward the rear of the block it is very quiet and private.
notes: The Art Box is hidden from the road by our garden and a steepish driveway. The views are beautiful. There are some stairs so it is not recommended if you cannot cope with them.
transit: It is just 500 metres to the town centre.
access: Your living area is part of my home  and all on the upper level. You are welcome to visit with us when we are home and view the artworks OR you can choose to remain in your private quarters. My studio spaces are off limits unless I am home or you choose to do a little creative workshop with me.
interaction: I am generally available as I work from home in my studio. Our small dog Merri will be very pleased to socialise but understands 'No'! Merlin and Phineas the felines are a little more choosy and live indoors.
host_about:
I am a contemporary artist and my home is my studio and gallery. I share the space with Stefan and our fur kids; Merri, Cub, Merlin and Phineas.
The environment is my inspiration and gives me peace and joy.
If you choose to stay with us you will gain access to my gallery and perhaps a sneaky art class.

Sit back and enjoy the views!

name: Lavender Cabin
summary: The Lavender Cabin has a queen size bed suitable for up to two people. The main room has a bed, leather couch, small table, and is air conditioned. Unfortunately there is no television in the cabin, so you may want to bring a book. There is an adjoining bathroom to the bedroom with a shower, toilet, sink, bar-fridge, washing machine and clothes dryer. Basic breakfast provisions such as cereal, toast, tea and coffee will also be provided.
description: The Lavender Cabin has a queen size bed suitable for up to two people. The main room has a bed, leather couch, small table, and is air conditioned. Unfortunately there is no television in the cabin, so you may want to bring a book. There is an adjoining bathroom to the bedroom with a shower, toilet, sink, bar-fridge, washing machine and clothes dryer. Basic breakfast provisions such as cereal, toast, tea and coffee will also be provided. Guests will have access to the bedroom and bathroom. I live on the property with my family and someone is usually available to greet you and if need anything. The Lavender Cabin is situated near the Whispering Wall as well as the Barossa Goldfields walking trails. There is no public transport in the area and you will be required to arrange your own transportation. There is no wifi available or cooking facilities besides a kettle, bar-fridge and toaster.

house_rules: Check in and Check out Please notify me of your estimated arrival time at least one day before arrival.  Check in/check out will be as stated unless prior arrangements have been made prior to arrival.  Your other responsibilities  Guests are responsible for damage, breakages, theft and loss of the property and any part of it during your stay. You must notify me of this immediately and you may be charged repair or replacement costs.  Only guests nominated and agreed upon in the booking may stay at the property overnight. If any other guests stay extra charges may apply or the agreement may be terminated without refund.  Excessive noise or disturbance to the residences of the property will not be tolerated and may result in termination of your booking.  Before departure all rubbish must be put in bins provided and the cottage should be left in a tidy condition.  The washing machine and dryer may be used by guests.  Smoking is not permitted on the property.  Problems or complaints  In the

summary: Getaway from your hectic life and enjoy the Great Barossa Valley.  Ideal for couples, solo adventurers and business travelers and wine lovers. Walk to wineries, restaurant and shopping. Short drive to  towns, cellar doors and tourism attractions. Cabins are self contained duplex with Spa bath, wood fire, kitchenette, wifi and all have lovely views. 2 Couples spa cabins    2 Deluxe spa Couples cabins     4 Family spa cabins    Great for groups to catch up.
space: The couple Spa cabin is self contained with all linen and cooking equipment and condiments. Barbecue and Weber are in the community area.There is wood supplied on arrival for the fireplace.

name: Old Mill Cottage
summary: Old Mill Cottage is ideal for a quiet getaway with its picturesque garden to relax in or suitable for families or small groups wanting to catch up.  It is close to Dutton Park Recreation area including the Golf Course and Trotting Track.  Walking distance to the main street with great eateries and up to date information centre.  The Historic Mine site and the Mawson, Heysen and Kidman walking trails are on the doorstep.  Kapunda is nestled between the famous Barossa and Clare wine regions.

name: Barossa Family Holiday Home BONUS wine & Breakfast
summary: Our relaxing family home is spacious & beautiful. There is plenty to do here, or the perfect place to relax after enjoying all the Barossa has to offer. Perfect for a large family or friendly couples to enjoy. TVs in most room. We have a mini gym, table tennis, Foxtel, outdoor entertaining and plenty of activities to keep kids/families entertained. Fresh comfy linen supplied.Pets negotiable.
space: Our space is unique as it has the luxury of most other accommodations however it is also family friendly. It will be just as great for 3-4 couples to stay (please request extra double beds if this is the case) as it would be for a large family or even 2 family's to enjoy. With this in mind sharing the cost makes or beautiful home great value. Baby needs are also accommodated with a high chair and portacot supplied. Guests would be able to stay home for a rest day and still have as much to do, as if they had gone out! Us having 4 kids makes our home great for people to stay with their children as our house is child proof. It also accomodates the very loved family pet (upon negotiations) Entrance gates are able to be locked for children safety. We know what it is like to travel with children so rest assured our home is a place parents can relax and let their children enjoy all our house has to offer. We have also added a five person spa with waterfall and lights to our beautiful home. We

neighborhood_overview: Lyndoch is a beautiful base for exploring the Barossa. In Lyndoch we have online grocery shopping and pizza delivery available yet we also have amazing local dining in this quiet aesthetic town. From fine dining at the lord Lyndoch to the best cafe meal around at Kies winery Monkey nut cafe (lunch only) Lyndoch is surrounded by the beautiful Barossa ranges (of which you can see from our kitchen) and vineyards on every edge of town. The local people are friendly and always happy to help, and if you want to venture further into the Barossa we are a short 10minute drive to Tanunda!  If you are looking for accommodation for an event such as "day on the green" or a wedding, we are happy to provide transport to and from the event for a small fee so you won't even have to wait for a taxi (and much cheaper to)
notes: At our property we have  All Foxtel channels Unlimited wifi  TV/DVD player in all rooms except master bedroom Mini gym, including treadmill, exercise bike, cross trainer and row machine with a tv to watch while you workout.  Table tennis table Many board and card games.
transit: There is a bus link available (information will be provided) how ever that is the extent of public transport. Many tours of winery's are available as are taxi companies. As I have already mentioned, we are available at all times to provide transport to and from an event, and even airport transfers for a fee.
access: Guests have complete access to our home. We want you to feel like you are at a home away from home. For long stays we are able to provide a cleaner (for a small fee) so you can enjoy your holiday without the everyday medial tasks. We love our home, and our aim is for our guests to Love and enjoy their stay. If you have any requests or special needs please feel free to ask upon booking and every effort will be made to accommodate these. Baby supplies also available. Please advise prior to arrival and we will have a high chair, portacot and any other requests available.
interaction: We are available 24/7 for our guests. My husband and I work as a team so that there is always someone available to answer questions or solve any problems/issues that may arise. We love and take pride in our family home, we want our guests to enjoy their time and make themselves at home.
house_rules: Smoking to be outside please. The Garage is set up as the gym and "kids Zone" If you are wishing to park in the garage we need to be advised at least 2 days prior to arrival. Please ensure cars are parked in the driveway or on the barked area next to the driveway. No Cars to be parked in the street at anytime. Noise curfew of 9pm weeknights and 10pm weekends. Absolutely no events or parties. Noise complaints from neighbours will be given one warning and further complaints will result in immediate eviction and loss of security deposit.
host_about: I'm a registered nurse turned b&b owner. I have four beautiful children, a wonderful husband and the best dad & sister a girl could ask for. Plus an amazing Mother in law who enjoys this b&b experience with me. We are Loving the Barossa life :)

name: Go Go's, Eden Valley the Garden of Grapes and Gums
summary: Nestled into a tranquil acre block in the main street of Eden Valley township, Go Go's enjoys the peaceful serenity of country South Australia but with easy access to highlights of the Barossa and Adelaide Hills.  With 2 large bedrooms including a cot for the littlies, Go Go's is perfect for couples, families, and wandering nomads who need to park up and power up. A fully equipped self catering kitchen and BBQ allow you the option of creating your own gourmet delights from your local purchases.
space: In 2016 the Meadley family set up Go Go’s as a comfortable place for family and friends to enjoy when visiting from interstate and overseas. “Go Go” is the Swahili name for Grandma, and became Grandma Meadley’s nickname during her and Grandpa Meadley’s travels over seas. This seemed the perfect name for their home away from home when visiting family in Eden Valley. The Barossa and Adelaide Hills are renowned for their quality wines, and Eden Valley offers a taste unique to its cooler climate. However a visit to the area doesn’t have to be just about gourmet food and wine. There are activities for all the family including the whispering wall, the big rocking horse, Kaeserstuhl Conservation Park; local arts and crafts such as the Eden Valley Gallery; walking trails; or perhaps you are a group of avid cyclists who want to test yourselves on parts of the Tour Down Under routes; or wandering nomads who feel you want a place to rest from the road, park up with plenty of space and access to p
description: Nestled into a tranquil acre block in the main street of Eden Valley township, Go Go's enjoys the peaceful serenity of country South Australia but with easy access to highlights of the Barossa and Adelaide Hills.  With 2 large bedrooms including a cot for the littlies, Go Go's is perfect for couples, families, and wandering nomads who need to park up and power up. A fully equipped self catering kitchen and BBQ allow you the option of creating your own gourmet delights from your local purchases. In 2016 the Meadley family set up Go Go’s as a comfortable place for family and friends to enjoy when visiting from interstate and overseas. “Go Go” is the Swahili name for Grandma, and became Grandma Meadley’s nickname during her and Grandpa Meadley’s travels over seas. This seemed the perfect name for their home away from home when visiting family in Eden Valley. The Barossa and Adelaide Hills are renowned for their quality wines, and Eden Valley offers a taste unique to its cooler climate. Ho
neighborhood_overview: The Barossa and Adelaide Hills are renowned for their wines. Many people visit the  region for the quality and varietals of wine they have to offer to suit every pallet. The cooler climate of the Eden Valley creates zesty Rieslings, the Barossa Valley offers bold Shiraz, and the Adelaide Hill's crisp clean whites are only a short drive away too. Local wineries include Henschke and Yalumba, plus numerous boutique cellar doors such as Fernfield Wines just 3km away and Edenmae 10km away in Springton.  South Australia and the Barossa Region are proud of more than just their quality grapes, but other gourmet foods galore.  There are lots of opportunities to "Eat Local" in the main towns, or purchase delicious produce from the Mount Pleasant or Angaston Farmers Markets if visiting on a Saturday morning, which you can relax and enjoy at home in the comfort of Go Go's. Alternatively wander 100m down the street to the friendly Eden Valley Hotel where they can provide a quality value for money f
notes: If there is no availability on the calendar please still get in touch as we may still be able to help.
transit: There is a limited bus service through Eden Valley, however enjoying the flexibility of 4 wheels (or 2 if you are particularly fit and adventurous) allows you the opportunity to explore off the beaten track. Of course if you are inclined to visit the wineries there are details on tour options that will happily pick you up from Go Go's door.
access: Go Go's is set on a 1 acre block that is exclusively yours to enjoy, so there is plenty of space to park, to stretch your legs or just rest up.  We charge a flat nightly rate with no additional charges for extra adults, so you and your family and friends can enjoy the space at a great value. End your day of exploring, by sipping a glass of local wine on the swinging chair under the cool shade of the vines out the back, or soak up the warmth of the final rays of sun on the front veranda enjoying the native flora and fauna of Go Go’s garden.
interaction: Both Karine and Michael are available by mobile throughout the day, and live locally.
house_rules: Go Go's is the home away from home for our visiting friends and family, so please enjoy the added comforts and treat it with the respect you would of your own home. We ask that you help us to tread lightly on this world - respect water usage and use the environmentally friendly products we provide. Young families are welcome at Go Go's, please keep an eye on the littlies as they explore the acre block, particularly around the veranda, and the old barn.

name: Barossa Valley Farm Cottage - Buckbury End Farm
summary: BUCKBURY END FARM - Est. 1895 Peace and quiet in a private freshly renovated stone cottage, Come and enjoy the pure serenity it has to offer. Buckbury End Farm is located on the fringe of the Barossa Valley and is minutes to some fabulous wineries. It is a perfect base for your wine adventure. The North Para river meanders it's way through and creates a spectacular backdrop continually changing with each season. Other local attractions include the Whispering Wall, Lavender Farm &Jacobs Creek.
space: FARM COTTAGE - Private, freshly renovated stone cottage set on a 100 acre farm. The farm cottage consists of stone walls,  freshly renovated inside with a nice touch of modern yet trying to retain the old country feel.  Enjoy the peace and quiet, Stroll down to and along the North para river. Kangaroos often graze on the green river grass or sleep under the shady river red gum trees.  Sit by the river and enjoy the sounds of nature. Rich in history, the main homestead was built in 1895.  The cottage is ideal for an away from it all holiday in a country setting or equally suited to an overnight stay. Cooked breakfast  provisions are in the fridge or a continental breakfast are supplied.
