neighborhood_overview: Enjoy the pure peace and quiet that Buckbury End Farm has to offer. I have one friendly neighbour over the road only.
notes: Buckbury End Farm is a working farm. There will be be various machinery movements from time to time depending on the season.  Livestock (sheep and cattle) are present.  Possums are native to our area and can often be found via torchlight in the trees outside.
transit: Private parking area next to cottage for 2 cars.
access: Farm Cottage and walking trails down to the river area (table and chairs are available for use by the river).
interaction: I am contactable 24/7 via mobile phone. Guests will be left to enjoy their private stay. However I am more than happy to socialise with guests and offer advice if you would like.
house_rules: Please look after the cottage as if it was your own.  - I am happy to unload the dishwasher after you have left. The small cleaning fee charged is to cover the washing of all towels, linen and a basic clean of the cottage.  Your cooperation is greatly appreciated and will keep the price affordable for future guests.

name: Eden Valley Wines Building
summary: Originally built by Penfolds, the heritage winery building nestled on 3 acres, offers visitors a unique experience. It's on the doorstep of the famous Barossa Valley and all of its wineries. The expansive accommodation space with its high ceilings and comfortable bed, overlook a beautiful courtyard.
space: This room has over 3 MT high ceilings, it has a total uniqueness of it's own. It's not in a house or cottage, it is 100 year old winery building. Before that one of the first steam driven flour mills in south Australia, you will actually be on the ground floor of the oldest part of the building.
description: Originally built by Penfolds, the heritage winery building nestled on 3 acres, offers visitors a unique experience. It's on the doorstep of the famous Barossa Valley and all of its wineries. The expansive accommodation space with its high ceilings and comfortable bed, overlook a beautiful courtyard. This room has over 3 MT high ceilings, it has a total uniqueness of it's own. It's not in a house or cottage, it is 100 year old winery building. Before that one of the first steam driven flour mills in south Australia, you will actually be on the ground floor of the oldest part of the building. My guest have their own space, However, if I'm home they are welcome to sit in my sunken lounge room, which was originally the engine room that drove the flour mill and later the winery. I love socialising with my guests and giving them an exclusive tour of my building and the historic history of the property. Living in Eden Valley is close to the Barossa Valley region By car is the easiest Just 1hr

notes: Just 1hr 15 minutes from CBD of Adelaide and 1hr 30min from the Airport.  It's in the heartland of Riesling growing area of the Barossa Valley. Also a 15min drive from Henschke's.

name: Mount Pleasant - Namgarina Vineyard
summary: Our property is 12 Ha with a 2 Ha vineyard comprising Shiraz & Riesling. It is approximately  1.25 hours from Adelaide airport and within 45mins to 2 hrs  from 6 of the major wine areas of South Australia, & many popular tourist destinations. Mount Pleasant (4.5Km)  has 2 hotels, 2 bakeries, chemist, medical centre, hospital, butcher, fuel, convenience store, golf course & bowling club.
space: We provide a comfortable, clean and bright double room and are happy to share the kitchen living and outdoor spaces. If needed we have a cot for a small child and, could squeeze in an extra young child or two on spare mattresses if requested and organised ahead of time.
description: Our property is 12 Ha with a 2 Ha vineyard comprising Shiraz & Riesling. It is approximately  1.25 hours from Adelaide airport and within 45mins to 2 hrs  from 6 of the major wine areas of South Australia, & many popular tourist destinations. Mount Pleasant (4.5Km)  has 2 hotels, 2 bakeries, chemist, medical centre, hospital, butcher, fuel, convenience store, golf course & bowling club. We provide a comfortable, clean and bright double room and are happy to share the kitchen living and outdoor spaces. If needed we have a cot for a small child and, could squeeze in an extra young child or two on spare mattresses if requested and organised ahead of time. Guests are welcome to explore the garden and property, bearing in mind that we do not have control over native fauna. Guests need to be aware that they will be in the country and that there are snakes, kangaroos and sometimes koalas which can be disruptive and noisy. Guests are advised never to approach the wildlife,especially kangaroos,
notes: Our household relies totally on harvested rainwater.
transit: There is a regular bus service from Mount Pleasant to Tea Tree Plaza, in Modbury. This links with the Obahn to Adelaide city. If connections are made, this trip would take just over an hour. For other wine areas and tourists destinations a car is necessary.
access: Guests are welcome to explore the garden and property, bearing in mind that we do not have control over native fauna. Guests need to be aware that they will be in the country and that there are snakes, kangaroos and sometimes koalas which can be disruptive and noisy. Guests are advised never to approach the wildlife,especially kangaroos, however cute, as all can inflict wounds. They are wild creatures and are not domesticated.
interaction: I am happy to provide as much information and social interaction as my guests require. I am mindful that some people would prefer to have a quiet space and I would respect this.
house_rules: - Clean kitchen after use
host_about:
My family has lived in the Southern  Barossa area of the Adelaide Hills in South Australia for fifteen years. We have have a small working vineyard on a picturesque property.
My husband and I have travelled to other countries where we valued personal contact and hospitality. We enjoy hosting visitors, especially from other countries and we would like to share this idyllic environment with others.

name: The Old Manse Shed, Barossa Valley
summary: The Old Manse Shed is adjacent to main home here in Light Pass. Freshly painted, there is a comfy Queen bed, reverse cycle air con, heated blanket for wintry evenings. Self contained bathroom. TV, fridge, Nespresso maker, homemade Granola, milk, toaster + fresh sourdough, freshly home baked goods, bottle of wine upon arrival.  Table and chairs, room opens into garden. Church and vineyards at rear of property. Angaston, Tanunda and Nuri are all within 10 minute drive, 70 Cellar Doors in Barossa.
description: The Old Manse Shed is adjacent to main home here in Light Pass. Freshly painted, there is a comfy Queen bed, reverse cycle air con, heated blanket for wintry evenings. Self contained bathroom. TV, fridge, Nespresso maker, homemade Granola, milk, toaster + fresh sourdough, freshly home baked goods, bottle of wine upon arrival.  Table and chairs, room opens into garden. Church and vineyards at rear of property. Angaston, Tanunda and Nuri are all within 10 minute drive, 70 Cellar Doors in Barossa.
house_rules: - Check-out by 10am
host_about: I am an English girl living the dream here in the stunning Barossa Valley.  I am married with two children, two soppy Labradors and a cat. I am crazy about baking, cooking, wine, family and friends. We live in what is the former Rectory / Manse in this tiny Hamlet of Light Pass, just a few minutes drive from all the gems of the Barossa, namely Angaston, Tanunda and Nuriootpa.  We look forward to welcoming you into our much loved home and hearing your stories.  I am fortunate to work in Australia's oldest family owned winery and so meeting people is literally part of my job and just love it.

name: Seppeltsfield Vineyard Cottage. Luxury & privacy.
summary: You will love your time at the cottage because of the vineyard location & gardens, the luxury facilities and amenities and the peace, quiet and privacy. Perfect for couples, the cottage is surrounded by Barossa cellar doors and Fino, Hentley Farm and Appellation restaurants. Relax in the cottage gardens or enjoy invigorating walks amidst vineyards.  We live nearby on the property if you would like help with touring recommendations for your stay.
space: Perfect for celebrating any special occasion or just for a holiday, the cottage is a wonderful place to relax as well as the perfect base for exploring the Barossa. Many international guests comment it is a welcome "home away from home" if they are travelling for an extended period.  The cottage is self-contained and the tariff includes cooked and continental breakfast provisions, a bottle of estate wine, gourmet platter produce, free WiFi and complimentary restaurant transfers to Appellation, Hentley Farm or Fino restaurants are offered on one night of your stay.  The carpeted lounge is cosy with quality soft furnishings, Bose sound systems, recent magazines and LED TV with a selection of CDs and DVDs.  The bedroom offers a king bed with white linens and the adjoining large ensuite bathroom offers underfloor heating and heated towels in winter, a double shower and deep rainwater claw foot bath.  Indoor and outdoor kitchenettes with Scanpan cookware, Global and Wusthof knives and all c
description: You will love your time at the cottage because of the vineyard location & gardens, the luxury facilities and amenities and the peace, quiet and privacy. Perfect for couples, the cottage is surrounded by Barossa cellar doors and Fino, Hentley Farm and Appellation restaurants. Relax in the cottage gardens or enjoy invigorating walks amidst vineyards.  We live nearby on the property if you would like help with touring recommendations for your stay. Perfect for celebrating any special occasion or just for a holiday, the cottage is a wonderful place to relax as well as the perfect base for exploring the Barossa. Many international guests comment it is a welcome "home away from home" if they are travelling for an extended period.  The cottage is self-contained and the tariff includes cooked and continental breakfast provisions, a bottle of estate wine, gourmet platter produce, free WiFi and complimentary restaurant transfers to Appellation, Hentley Farm or Fino restaurants are offered on one
neighborhood_overview: We are uniquely positioned with the amazing neighbours we have. The Barossa is known for its food, wine, music, heritage and hospitality and along Seppeltsfield Road we offer this in spades!! Apart from our visually beautiful location with vineyards and rolling hills, we are surrounded by boutique cellars doors, three of the Barossa's best restaurants and the iconic winery Seppeltsfield Estate. Here they offer not only bespoke wine tours including tasting a 100 year old Tawny and a heritage winery tour, but also the Jam Factory studio with artisans in residence. These include a knifemaker, milliner, shoe maker and potter. You can even book to make your own knife (but plan and book well ahead!) Other wineries include Hentley Farm, Barossa Valley Estate, Two Hands, Greenock Creek Wines, Kalleske, Whistler, Tscharke, Seiber and Torbreck, to name just a few! Seppeltsfield is the perfect place for walking. The undulating hills and palm lined road with many historic and beautiful landmarks a
notes: Very occasionally and depending on the season there may be work required to be done in the vineyard. This is always worked around a guest's stay where possible and rarely impacts on our guests because we usually have control over this.  Having said that, guests are often intrigued and interested in what needs to be done in the vineyard and enjoy speaking to us about what it's like to have a vineyard and grow grapes.
transit: Being in a rural region, you will ideally need your own car. If coming from the airport we are an easy one hour drive on a mostly dual lane highway to within 4 kilometres of the cottage. Otherwise there are many excellent tour operators who offer private or group tours. We have an excellent taxi service in the Barossa. Some guests use a taxi or private tour operator for airport transfers and for touring if they really do not want to drive. As previously mentioned, we also offer guests complimentary restaurant transfers to Appellation, Hentley Farm or Fino restaurants on one night of their stay. There are also several cellar doors within walking distance (500 metres to 3 kilometres). We use the services of an excellent bike hire company who will deliver your bikes to the cottage, or you can drive to their business and ride designated Barossa bike trails from there.
access: Guests have exclusive use of the cottage and their own private gardens surrounding it.  They are also welcome to explore the vineyard and the 25 acre property, helping themselves to any fruits and vegetables in season (including figs, pomegranites, cherries, plums etc). Guests can walk through the neighbouring vineyards to Fino retaurant (10 minutes) and Hentley Farm restaurant (5 minutes).
interaction: We are always contactable. We are either on the property or guests have our private mobile phone details and we check our emails very regularly. We enjoy socialising with guests if this is something they wish to do, but are very aware of offering privacy for those who desire this. We offer a wine tasting of our Seize the Day Shiraz to guests who have an interest in wine.
house_rules: Permission from the owners  is required before people other than paying guests are allowed on the property. Thank you.
host_about:
In a past life I was a Registered Nurse/Midwife and enjoy meeting people and sharing my passion for the Barossa. Helping guests discover and enjoy the best of the Barossa makes life interesting and fulfilling.

Peter and I spent two years restoring our 1850s early German settler's cottage from a ruin into premium Barossa accommodation and are very proud to have helped preserve some precious Barossa history. Now, with nearby Seppeltsfield Estate undergoing a renaissance, we find ourselves in one of the Barossa's "go to" destinations, Seppeltsfield.

I love my family and grandchildren, gardening, food and wine (of course!) We have lots of great friends here in the Barossa. It's a fabulous place to live with lots of festivals and music and wine events. 

I enjoy anticipating, meeting and exceeding our guest's expectations!

name: Indulge and Relax Tanunda
summary: Comfortable, modern cottage within 5-10 minute walk of the centre of Tanunda.  Perfect base for touring wineries, easy walk from FermentAsian Restaurant, 1918 bistro, as well as cafes, bakeries and supermarket of central Tanunda.   Full modern kitchen and bathroom, peaceful garden with several relaxing areas to sip a glass of wine, chat or read.
space: Suitable for one or two couples or small family.  Grassed areas (great for bocce and cartwheels!), bunk beds (cot and highchair available), pool table, dart board and two mountain bikes for guest use (please email us your heights to check with available sizes). Washing machine and dryer, high speed NBN WiFi equipped office area and Netflix access through Apple TV included. Gas BBQ and heated patio area for outdoor dining year round.

Free use of unlimited WiFi, Netflix, 7 foot pool table, table tenn
neighborhood_overview: Most cellar doors in the Barossa Valley are open 7 days for free wine tastings, mostly 10am or 11am until 4pm or 5pm (no booking required).  Eating at local restaurants, especially FermentAsian and 1918 (both walking distance from the house) may require a booking in advance and are thoroughly recommended Tanunda Foodland Supermarket 5-10 minute walk or easy drive away.
notes: Quiet street and peaceful garden areas are a feature, while location is in the heart of Tanunda.
transit: Short walk into Tanunda and to a couple of cellar doors, while a car is required to visit most of the 60 wineries within a 20 minute drive! Plenty of free parking available at the house and throughout the Barossa Region.  Or why not use our two complimentary mountain bikes to cycle the many km of trails around the Barossa?
access: Quality Riedel Glassware. Coffee pod machine and coffee plunger  both available in full kitchen including oven, hotplates, microwave and dishwasher. Free use of unlimited WiFi, Netflix, 7 foot pool table, table tennis table and two mountain bikes.  Bed linen and towels provided.
interaction: Guests will have private use of all areas, with hosts just a phone call or message away!
house_rules: Smoking indoors is prohibited at this property.  If there is evidence of smoking indoors an additional $500 cleaning fee will be charged.

name: Somerton House
summary: Somerton House is the perfect place for 1 or 2 couples to relax and enjoy the beautiful Barossa Valley after a hard day wine tasting and sampling regional produce. The outside entertaining area is equipped with a dining table and full size sofa, perfectly positioned in front of the outside television. Or relax in our solar heated pool if the weather is fine. Guests must be over 18 as the house is not suited to children or infants.
space: Somerton House was built in 1925 but has had some more recent modern additions. It is a wonderful mix of charm with all of the modern comforts. The house has ducted evaporative cooling for the summer months and has central heating to keep you cosy in the winter.

notes: Over 18’s only

name: The Stables at 1860 Wine Country Cottages
summary: This old stone building has been in use since the 1860s, including as crop storage,  machinery shed and stables.   Now it’s been reimagined into a secluded hideaway for two with the perfect ingredients for pure luxury. There’s more of everything in The Stables – set on its own 500m2 block away from the other cottages, it includes a large living space, a spacious entertaining deck, private garden, high ceilings, cathedral skylights, extra large spa bath and log fire to cuddle up next to.
space: Recharge your senses and enjoy a restful escape in the heart of boutique wine country at 1860 Wine Country Cottages, only an hour’s drive from Adelaide.  Here you’ll find all the ingredients for a relaxing break away from the everyday:  •Explore new tastes. Work your way through our three unique Boutique Wine and Food Trails, designed to give you a taste of the very best Eden Valley and the Adelaide Hills has to offer. •Take a stroll on the wild side. Take your time and explore our neighbourhood set amongst vineyards, rolling hills, farms and wildlife.  •Experience the quiet of the countryside.  Breathe in the fresh country air while you soak up the sun in your private outdoor area. Listen to the birds’ call and watch them wheel around the sky. Hear the wind whisper through stately red gums. Feel yourself unwind! •Rejuvenate yourself. Rest up in your secluded luxury stone cottage – they’re the perfect mix of picturesque and contemporary style.   The perfect base to explore Eden Valley

name: Dawn Cottage at 1860 Wine Country Cottages
summary: The studio style Dawn Cottage is a retreat for couples who want that intimate stay with a dose of luxury and privacy.  Enjoy a large private timber deck and paved BBQ entertaining area with elevated views of the original 1860 Homestead, original stone outbuildings, paddocks, dam, surrounding hills, our own vines and livestock.  The cottage’s spacious open plan design features an exquisite mix of antique and new furniture.  Cook up a lavish breakfast in the kitchen or have a BBQ on the deck.

name: Sunset Cottage at 1860 Wine Country Cottages
summary: Created from the old 1860 stone dairy, the two-bedroom Sunset Cottage features open plan living, dining and kitchen areas with French doors that open out into a paved outdoor entertaining area with tranquil country views.  With warm timber floors, antique and contemporary furniture, modern amenities and a full kitchen, it’s designed for your absolute comfort and privacy. The bedrooms are at opposite ends of the cottage – each opening out via French doors to private landscaped gardens.

name: "LiebenGott" - Luxury 4 bedroom
summary: Luxury 2 storey home in the heart of the Barossa Valley with pool table and antique baby grand piano. 3 bedrooms have queen beds and the 4th with a double with bunk and an extra bed, suitable for a fourth couple or children. A small  park borders the home on 2 sides with room to play cricket, football or soccer! Prepare your own meals in the fully equipped kitchen or take short stroll to the Weintal for breakfast, lunch or dinner, or dine out at anyone of the famous Barossa restaurants.
space: Guests have use of the whole home regardless of whether it is 1, @ or 10 guests in your party.

name: Lindsay House Home 5 bedrooms 3 bathrooms
summary: Lindsay House is ideally located on the edge of Angaston, with fantastic views, on 5 acres, great for a group of friends or family to have a get together. You can also walk to the main street for shopping, dining and enjoy local wine. Offering 5 bedrooms 3 bathrooms, 1 large kitchen, laundry facilities and balcony to really enjoy the views. Free WIFI inc. We can also organise your own wine tours with our multi award winning touring business.
space: We also own our own multi award winning touring business, so can assist with airport transfers, restaurant transfers and wine tours not only in the Barossa, but Adelaide Hills, Clare Valley, McLaren Vale and Adelaide.

name: Your own studio in an old winery
host_about: I'm a person who loves meeting and getting to know people, from all over the world.  I love my home and enjoy explaining the heritage of it, and the region of Eden valley, home of white wine in the Barossa valley area.

name: The Writer's Studio, Barossa
summary: Perfect for one or two people, The Writer's Studio is fully self-contained. It has a really comfortable and firm inflatable queen bed.  Away from the main house, it opens out onto a small orchard. This is a quiet oasis you can enjoy in between exploring all the Barossa has to offer. It has dining and sitting areas as well as a reading nook in the loft. It has a sofa which can open out for a child if necessary.  Or we can set up another inflatable bed in the loft, accessed by a loft ladder.
space: The Writer's Studio is great for singles or couples.  I originally called it, The Shed, as it was once a hay shed with three walls and a grass floor.  It morphed into The Writer's Studio after various friends asked to use it as their retreat to spend time quietly catching up on writing projects. Wineries abound, as do eating opportunities,   ranging from the award winning Appellation at The Louise and fermentAsian (consistently names in the Top 100), to Vintners, Harvest Kitchen, 1918, St Hugo’s and Maggie Beer's Farm.  There is also a huge selection of light meal options offered by most of the wineries.

neighborhood_overview: There is a vineyard and winery cellar door directly the house.  It is a short, two block walk to the main street, supermarket, bakery, coffee shops, restaurants, Information Centre and bicycle hire.
notes: The Writer's Studio is literally at the bottom of the garden of the main house and there is plenty of street and pavement parking at the front.
transit: You will need a car, although there is a limited taxi service and there are bikes for hire.  If you don't have a car, we can arrange to pick you up from the Gawler Central railway station 25 minutes away.  There are also some good walks and walking tracks.
access: You are free to sit in the garden or the orchard. The kitchenette has a small oven, hot plate, microwave, fridge, toaster, kettle, crockery and cutlery.  If you are cooking and need specific utensils or pots, just let us know and you are welcome to borrow them from the house kitchen. Bed linen and towels are provided.
interaction: I will usually be there to welcome you, show you around and answer any questions. On the odd occasion when I can't be there, my assistant or a close friend will do the honours.  If you have questions during your stay, you can tap on the door or send a text and we will respond quickly.
host_about:
I am a full time business coach helping business owners create businesses that work for not because of them.  My clients are mainly in Australia, New Zealand and the US, and as long as time zones are compatible I can work with them from anywhere. Thanks to (Hidden by Airbnb) I have conducted my client meetings from Jaipur (India), New York, Perth, Sydney, South Australia and San Diego.
Clearly - one of the  things I can't live without is travel.
And I can't live without my Kindle - which has lightened my travel load enormously. No more books to carry and leave as I pick up more.
I love great food and wine - I live in a wine region where the two go together.
I am a great guest. Quiet, fun, a reader and a walker.
My life motto is Stride Into Life.

name: Martinsell Cottage
summary: A self contained private 3 bedroom cottage, set amongst 77 acres of ancient old red gums, nearby vineyards and historic barn / stables. The cottage is set on the estate 500m from one of SA's most significant Georgian manors, 'Martinsell', built in (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) This is also available for accomodation of up to four guests please log in to Martinsell Manor for further details.https://airbnb.com/rooms/22636387
space: There is a lovely large lounge with cosy wood heater and split system reverse cycle air conditioner and a fully equipped kitchen. The cottage is in a very peaceful country location with the closest neighbour being a kilometre away. Shower or bath in our soft  rainwater provided to the cottage, whilst  the outside taps are  supplied with spring water. Horses are welcome with secure yards and plenty of parking for horse floats. Daily permits are available nearby for horse riding in the neighbouring forests. Car enthusiasts are also extremely welcome with safe and secure space for cars and trailers. Mountain bikers or road cyclists are well catered for with plenty of secure space for bikes, and great roads - the famous Menglers Hill is just over an hour's ride away with a choice of sealed or gravel roads. Mountain bike trails abound in Mt Crawford Forest, right at our doorstep.

neighborhood_overview: The Pewsey Vale area was settled by English, Scottish and German settlers. Pewsey Vale is a part of the world-famous Barossa Valley food and wine region, famous for bold red wines, delicate Pewsey Vale Rieslings, and the finest boutique foods. The Barossa and its surroundings offer a wide variety of activities from hot air ballooning to trekking, cycling, horse riding, fishing, kayaking, wine tasting and more. Closest large stores: Gawler (25min drive / 20km nth west) has a many large town facilities and services including; •Supermarket open until 9pm mon-sat •24 hr petrol station The local town of Williamstown (10min drive / 10km west) has a small general store with limited supplies and a bottle shop. We are close to the National Motor Museum in Birdwood 18km, the famous Collingrove hillclimb circuit, and some of the best driving roads in Australia,  through the Adelaide Hills and Barossa Ranges. A Barossa Valley information guide & maps are provided for your information and convenien
notes: For longer stays cleaning and linen service is available. Extra service charges apply. ***IMPORTANT*** If this listing is unavailable, you could also check one of our other properties, "Martinsell Manor". Here's a link: https://airbnb.com/rooms/22636387
transit: Martinsell is approximately one hour drive from Adelaide, bordering on the edge of the Adelaide Hills, Southern Barossa, making a unique scenic driving experience. As we are approximately 10km from Williamstown and 24km from Tanunda, you will need to come by motor vehicle, bicycle, on horseback, or in good hiking boots! Unfortunately there are no buses nearby but a taxi service is available.  There are stunning views over the rolling hills which are surrounded by forests, with walking, cycling and horse trails. Adjacent to the property is the famous Heysen Trail, and the Kidman and Mawson Trails are not far away.
access: Guests have free access over the property, but we ask that guests respect our privacy as we respect theirs. We are usually happy to arrange visits through the private gardens and to look closer at the manor house on request. As we often have friendly roaming livestock we ask that gates be closed on entry or exit.
interaction: We reside in the main residence on the property, so we are always available for our guests. We can be contacted in person or by phone/text.
house_rules: Respectfully enjoy being in gorgeous Pewsey Vale (Barossa valley) by looking after our cottage as well as enjoying it!  Strictly no smoking inside. Please feel free to contact us with requests or questions concernig the Barossa Valley, the nearby Historic 1901 Manor and or anything else. :)
host_about: We are a  retired couple who really enjoy living in the countryside, renovating historical buildings, gardening and hobby farming. Having hosted bed and breakfasts for many years, we enjoy meeting guests from all over the world and providing information on the Barossa area and beyond.
street: Pewsey Vale, Barrossa Valley , SA, Australia

name: Collingrove Homestead
summary: Collingrove (c1856) was conceived as a little piece of England by the pioneers of the Barossa Valley, the Angas Family.   Collingrove is perfect for those who like a step back in time.  Come and experience life in an authentic Barossa mansion.
space: Collingrove is suited to a romantic getaway or a family/friends get together. Each guest room is individually styled.  All rooms are furnished with French Provincial hand-carved beds, crisp white linen and French Toile quilts.  The beds are of a high quality ensuring a good night sleep. We have five guest rooms in total, three have ensuite bathrooms which are decorated in black and white English tile. There are two more bedrooms which are the Maids Quarters - Wisteria and Jasmine.  The Wisteria room can be a private room with sole use of the bathroom or both (Wisteria & Jasmine) can be used as a two bedroom suite with shared use of the bathroom.     Guest amenities include a large Hydrotherapy spa located in the old Carriage House.  The Guest Lounge is a great space to socialise, relax on the leather lounges and stoke up the open fire.  The Lounge has wine glasses, tea, coffee facilities and a full size fridge for guests use. Collingrove is set on 14 acres, with manicured gardens and a

neighborhood_overview: Collingrove is located 5kms out of Angaston in a peaceful and serene country setting.  The Homestead is surrounded by century old English trees and are home to many species of native birds. We have many world class wineries within easy reach of Collingrove.  We are more than happy to assist you with planning your itinerary or arrange a local tour operator to take you around the Barossa Valley. We are a short drive from the world renowned Kaiserstuhl Conservation Park which is perfect for bushwalkers. There are two walking trails passing through a variety of landscapes including creeks, rocky outcrops, areas of low forest, scrub and open grassland. The park has panoramic views across the ranges to the Barossa Valley.   The Wallowa Hike offers a comprehensive look at the park's main features, including rock formations and a scenic lookout, while the Stringybark Loop provides a brief look at the park's diverse flora and fauna.   Dusk and early mornings are the best time to observe the par
transit: We recommend you hire a car.  We can advise you on Taxi's and winery tours.
access: Access to guest lounge and Hot tub is available at your convenience.
interaction: We are happy to meet you at a convenient time to check-in you in to your rooms, show you around the property and explain the facilities.  We are also happy to give you some local recommendations if you would like us to :) We are contactable 24hr by mobile or text as well.
house_rules: - We are happy to accommodate most check-in times  All check-in's must be prearranged  SMS on (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) or call (Phone number hidden by Airbnb)

name: Hanisch Haus Bed & Breakfast Guest House
summary: Premium self-contained Bed & Breakfast accommodation with a fantastic central location & lovely vineyard views. This recently renovated, historic home is full of character. Guests have full access to an entire home, owned and operated by renowned Barossa winemaker, Rolf Binder.  An ideal retreat option for those wanting to relax and enjoy the beautiful scenery and tranquility on the 60 acre property, with superb access to local wineries, restaurants and shopping.
space: What's special about our place? 1. The Location - nestled on the very edge of Tanunda township, guests enjoy a rural feeling while still having the advantage of being centrally located & conveniently close to wineries, restaurants & shopping. 2. Space - A lovely spacious home ideal for longer stays and especially those who like to cook and feel 'at home' when travelling. 3. Nature - take a stroll around the 27 hectare property & enjoy the wildlife  / birdlife. Keep and eye out for kangaroos on the top of the hill around sunset! 4. Great breakfast provisions and a nice bottle of Rolf Binder wine included.

neighborhood_overview: What's not to love about being in the Barossa?! Beautiful scenery, amazing local food & wine, wonderfully friendly people. It's our little slice of paradise!
notes: Staying at Hanisch Haus means great access to: - Wineries - Langmeil Winery & Peter Lehmann Wines are within walking distance. Our winery (Rolf Binder) is just 1.6km north at 185 Stelzer Road.  - Tanunda shopping, cafes & restaurants - 2.3km - Bike trails (rental bike drop off is available) - Seppeltsfield Road Scenic Drive - 2km - Maggie Beer's Farm Shop - 2.5km If particularly interested in wine, we love to also show guests around our winery during their stay. Guests also receive 15% off any wine purchase of 6+ bottles during a stay at Hanisch Haus.
transit: Unfortunately there isn't great access to public transport so most drive to the Barossa Valley. There is a train from Adelaide to Gawler & then bus to Tanunda. Guests can hire bikes from the Visitor Information Centre or Barossa Bike Hire in Nuriootpa or use local taxis to get around.
access: Guests have access to the entire house as well as outside terrace, verandah and garden.
interaction: We leave interaction up to guests! We live close by & would love to share a coffee or a glass of wine over a chat but certainly don't want to intrude on any guest's privacy.
house_rules: - Hanisch Haus is located in close proximity to Veritas Cottage B&B so we ask that guests respect the privacy & peaceful environment of this location.
host_about:
We love food, wine and travel and really enjoy meeting guests from all over the world that stay on our property. It's also fun to be able to see guests at our cellar door nearby, where we offer wine tastings and tours of the winery.
Rolf Binder winery was established in 1955 and we produce a wide range of white, red and fortified wines, selling into 18 countries around the globe. Our guests can enjoy a special bottle with any 2 night stay! Full breakfast provisions highlighting local Barossa produce are also included.
We stay on top of communication with guests to ensure they have an enjoyable stay and also provide lots of useful local knowledge to help plan time in the region.  Our goal is to make guests feel like they have a sense for what it's like to actually live in the Barossa. Stay with us for a unique visit to our beautiful region! 
Cheers, Cynthia & Rolf

name: Jandas Lake View
summary: This fully self-contained three bedroom home (with included breakfast provisions) is situated on the water's edge, surrounded by large gum trees and located in the Barossa Foothills near Eden Valley. Relax under the wide verandah, in the heated outdoor spa, aboard the pedal boats or on the lake's pontoon. This 30-acre property is exclusively yours and only minutes away from wineries and other Barossa Valley attractions.
space: -privacy and seclusion relaxing under a wide verandah or in a hot tub spa watching wild ducks swim on the lake. - exclusive use of pedal boats if you wish to experience the lake closer. - just 10-15mins drive to Angaston or Tanunda to explore more of the Barossa Valley.
description: This fully self-contained three bedroom home (with included breakfast provisions) is situated on the water's edge, surrounded by large gum trees and located in the Barossa Foothills near Eden Valley. Full breakfast provisio
notes: Full breakfast provisions are provided including local bacon, free range eggs, tomatoes, bread, cereal, fresh fruit, butter and a selection of jams, milk, juice, plunger coffee, selection of gourmet teas, regular tea and coffee, a bottle of local wine, chocolates and port from the port keg!
access: - check in is from 3pm and check out is by 11am. Within your stay, you are welcome to explore the 30 acre gum studded property at your leisure. - the home at Jandas Lake View is not visible from the road, and neighbouring homes are not visible from the home ensuring total privacy.
house_rules: - Pets outside only, with guests bringing everything their pet will need (ie food, bedding) and clean up after them. - Smoking allowed outside only. (Butt bins provided.) - Several lifejackets provided, guests to use as they deem necessary with pedal boats. - Children to be supervised around lake (particularly as it is so close to the house.)

name: Hill House Angaston
summary: Hill House is bed and breakfast accommodation in the Barossa Valley, South Australia's world renowned wine region, overlooking the picturesque township of Angaston. Stay in 1851 the original 2-room cottage part of this outstanding historic country mansion. Ideal for couples, 1851 is a beautifully appointed suite with private access. Take advantage of the many wineries, cellar doors and award winning restaurants nearby.

name: Macdonnell House
summary: Located in the centre of Tanunda in the heart of the Barossa Valley,  our house is light and airy perfect for families, friends or couples.  It's just a couple minutes easy walk to the Main Street where you will find great restaurants, boutique shops, cafes, pubs and other facilities such as the supermarket, pharmacy and visitors centre.
space: THE SPACE 2 cosy bedrooms - the master has a king size bed and the second is a double. Both bedrooms have overhead fans and linen is provided. There is a shared bathroom with a seperate toilet and full bath and shower.  There is a fully equipped kitchen and an open living dining with direct access to a north facing courtyard garden. The living areas have an overhead fan and split system for heating and cooling. Total floor area is approximately 80 sqm. Parking is undercover and the backyard is private.

Drive down a gravel driveway to an undercover car park. GUEST ACCESS/INTERACTION  We can meet you at the house with keys for your stay or supply the cod
notes: As the house is situated in a residential area noise is to be kept to a minimum after 10 pm. The house is strictly non smoking. Access is down a driveway off the street. The house is NOT set up to host infants and children under the age of 12. There are no locks on cupboard doors, power points are exposed, the backyard is not fully enclosed and cleaning products are accessible. The house is smoke and pet free.
transit: GETTING AROUND  Tanunda is situated approximately one hour by car from Adelaide. There is a twice daily bus service to and from the city and a taxi service in the Valley. To fully experience the Barossa though a car is recommended.
access: Drive down a gravel driveway to an undercover car park.
interaction: GUEST ACCESS/INTERACTION  We can meet you at the house with keys for your stay or supply the code for a lock box on the property, and as we live nearby we will be available if needed, otherwise the house and the Valley are yours to enjoy.

name: MAGNIFICENT COUNTRY VILLA - SPACIOUS & UNIQUE.
summary: Looking for the perfect place to stay in the Barossa Valley with your friends and family?  The "Coffee Palace" is an historic property with 7 bedrooms, 5 living rooms, 3.5 bathrooms and all the amenities to be self-contained.  Your elegant and spacious home in the Barossa to relax in, enjoy and share. Conveniently located in the heart of beautiful Lyndoch village, walk to restaurants, wineries, shops and galleries.
space: The Coffee Palace provides 7 bedrooms in total, over 3 floors.   Bedroom 1 – A beautiful and spacious bedroom on the ground floor, with elegant ensuite, claw foot bathtub and dressing room.  The bed can be configured as a king or twin room. Bedroom 2 – The bed in this room can be configured as a king or twin beds.  Bathrooms for this room are on the landing, so up a few stairs and there is also a separate toilet just out on the back veranda for convenience during outdoor activities. Bedroom 3 – Another very spacious bedroom, located on the first floor.  Complete with sumptuous king size bed and access to the front balcony via a private entrance, this bedroom enjoys a small adjacent lounge room, large rear deck and small kitchenette. The bathroom for this room is shared with one other bedroom and is just across the hallway. Bedroom 4 – A very pretty bedroom with a French décor, including 2 vintage wicker, single beds.  This room shares the hallway bathroom and also has access to the kit

neighborhood_overview: The Coffee Palace is located in the quiet town of Lyndoch which has all the necessary facilities including a general store, fine dining restaurant, hotel with dining room, cafe, bakery, butcher, hair dresser, cellar door, post office and library.  We are a very short stroll to the main street.
notes: We live about 10 minutes away, so can help out when needed. Please feel free to call if you need assistance with managing any aspect of your stay.  We may be available to help with transport for smaller parties or to assist with other travel arrangements.
transit: We are very lucky to have a bus stop almost out the front of our house, you can catch the bus either in to the Barossa townships of Tanunda, Nuriootpa or Angaston or back to Gawler.  From Gawler there is a train service to Adelaide.
access: It's all yours, 6 bedrooms, five living rooms, 3.5 bathrooms and cellar (also a bedroom) and 1400m2 of gardens.
interaction: Julie and Peter are passionate home renovators who love travelling, creating beautiful gardens and Julie loves to attempt a little art work and photography when time permits. We share our lives with our wonderful son Scott and adored cat Leonard. We have been very blessed to travel to some amazing places and we have lived all over Australia and can advise on great places not to be missed, both local and elsewhere.  Julie works in the local library and has worked in the Tanunda visitors centre, so please ask if you need assistance with booking advice or help with extended holiday information. We live close by, so assistance is always at hand should you need it, but we also value your privacy, so we are happy to have as much or little contact with our guests as you are comfortable with. Your stay and experience whilst in the Barossa is our top priority.  We run our accommodation on the basis of the our own travel experiences and treat our guests as friends.
house_rules: Latest check in is at 21:00 Room Only Please be aware that we are not a party house and although we want guests to enjoy the premises, we do have neighbours and therefore ask that rowdy behaviour and excessive alcohol consumption not be indulged. We reserve the right to request the immediate removal of any guest for bad behaviour.
host_about: Julie and Peter are passionate home renovators who love travelling, creating beautiful gardens and Julie loves to attempt a little art work and photography when time permits. We share our lives with our wonderful son Scott and adored cats, including Leonard, Polly and Blackie (the waif who comes for breakfast). We have been very blessed to travel to some amazing places, personal favourites being Venice, U.K, Ha Long Bay, Rhodes, Meteora, Kotor etc.....I could go on with a very long list. We are friendly people who are happy to be as involved or not with your Barossa and Australian travel experience. We have lived all over Australia and can advise on great places not to be missed, both local and elsewhere.

name: Barossa Valley, Pondicherri Guest Suite 1
summary: Set on 5 acres, Pondicherri is a small acreage landholding with a cluster of small buildings that exudes a village atmosphere.  Its extensive views and  rural amenity are enabled as it is surrounded by much larger farming land creating a quiet rustic oasis yet is close to everything in the Barossa Valley.  Some of the buildings are of historic interest and date back to 1845.
space: The Pondicherri Guest Suites 1 is a compact small self contained contemporary room.  It contains a comfortable double bed with an adjoining private ensuite bathroom/toilet.   Your own private entry ensures utmost privacy.    For your movie entertainment, a TV and IPad with (Hidden by Airbnb) Chromecast to access Netflix are included with NBN WIFI. Suite 1 has reverse cycle A/C,  fridge, microwave, toaster and kettle so your ambient comfort and needs are met.   Suite 1 has a small table with two wood stools and a desk area. There are two guest suites alongside the Barn (separate listings) and can be booked together and are perfect for travelling family, friends or associates. It is what is on the inside that counts!     We are slowly upgrading the grounds and historic buidings but at the rate provided,  you will be very comfortable and private.

Its extensive views and  rural amenity are enabled as it is surrounded by much larger farming land creating a quiet rustic oasis yet is close to everything in the Barossa Valley. There are two guest suites alongside the Barn (separate listings)
neighborhood_overview: We are only 5 minutes drive to the pretty historic village of Angaston that is well serviced with a varied selection of cafes,  restaurants, 2 pubs, a supermarket, butcher, hardware, medical centre, post office, retail and and speciality Barossa food businesses.    We are a 3 minute drive from the famed Barossa Valley Farmers Market that is open every Saturday morning.  There are many high quality wineries, restaurants, food establishments and historic buildings to explore across the region.    If food and wine are not your thing, there are numerous walking and cycling trails, some easy bushwalks including spotting kangaroos at Kaisersthul Conservation Park.    Or you could  go  ballooning or a helicopter ride for the birds eye view!     Just about everything except surfing!    But we are about  one hour's drive to the nearest South Australian coastline,  only one+half hour's drive into  city of Adelaide and a one hour drive to the Adelaide Hills area.     There is so much to do and ex
notes: The grounds are a work in progress.   We do apologise for now.    However,  your indoor space has everything you will need. Please ensure no packaging or products are disposed into the waste water system.  Please put anything in the paper bags provided in the bathrooms and place into the bins provided.   No smoking under any circumstances in the rooms or bathrooms.    If you smoke, please smoke outside. You may want to consider to bring your own light breakfast provisions.  There is a toaster, kettle, fridge and microwave in your room.   Sometimes it’s good to chill and not rush off to find something to eat.      That is - of course -  if the slow pace suits you :)    But there are many many many breakfast/brunch options across the Barossa Valley too!
transit: Our property is accessible by car only.
access: We are a property under development and there are no sealed pathways to your room and steps to negotiate.    The grounds are still a work in progress but the privacy and views will compensate.  If you are expecting perfection, then this is not the place to stay.
interaction: As much or as little as you please!  You are independent in the Pondicherri ‘village’ and we will always respect your privacy.
house_rules: All guests are  to dispose of any feminine hygiene products, baby wipes, cotton buds, makeup wipes, dental floss, pills, cigarette butts and any other packaging to be placed into the paper bags and put in the bins provided.   Please do not flush any products in the waste water  system.  It will block very quickly and we will know who is responsible!   Smoking is NOT permitted inside the accommodation rooms under any circumstances.  We can provide ashtrays for smokers outside.
host_about: I love to travel but not enough. I love to cook and share my table with family and friends.  I love the smell of a freshly picked lemon and fresh herbs.  I love my little animals and the flocks of different birds that play and swoon across Pondicherri.   I’m social and then sometimes,  I’m a bit reclusive.   I love sunrises more than sunsets but both are spectacular and I’m lucky enough to experience and appreciate often.   I’m grateful for living in a place that affords  peace and privacy.   And I enjoy meeting people!  The  AirBnB adventure is a wonderful way to engage with many different people from far and wide.  To gain a deeper appreciation of the spirit of place - and it’s unique culture - staying with those who live there becomes a rich and memorable experience.  Welcome to our village.

name: Country Retreat on the edge of Barossa Valley
summary: Heritage home at the edge of the Barossa Valley (wine region) in the township of Mt.Pleasant with rural land behind which has sheep,cattle and an Alpaca in our paddock. We have an oval close by, walking distance to chemist,local pubs,bakeries and coffee shop. We have the best farmers market every Saturday Morning at the oval complex. Some of our land adjoining Mount Pleasant oval complex can be available for people with horses involved in equestrian events.
space: Our place is quiet and has a beautiful outlook onto the property.
description: Heritage home at the edge of the Barossa Valley (wine region) in the township of Mt.Pleasant with rural land behind which has sheep,cattle and an Alpaca in our paddock. We have an oval close by, walking distance to chemist,local pubs,bakeries and coffee shop. We have the best farmers market every Saturday Morning at the oval complex. Some of our land adjoining Mount Pleasant oval complex can be available for people with horses involved in equestrian events. Our place is quiet and has a beautiful outlook onto the property. There is an extra TV room with a game console...another space for the children to chill out, or parents retreat Guest can email through airbnb Mount pleasant is a quiet little town with about 950 people, about an hour from Adelaide, 40mins to The quaint little german township called Hahndorf, 30mins to the historic river town of Mannum, home of the first paddle steamers, we have lots of wineries within a 45min radius of us and a lovely Farmers market every Saturday Mo
neighborhood_overview: Mount pleasant is a quiet little town with about 950 people, about an hour from Adelaide, 40mins to The quaint little german township called Hahndorf, 30mins to the historic river town of Mannum, home of the first paddle steamers, we have lots of wineries within a 45min radius of us and a lovely Farmers market every Saturday Morning where you can get the best cooked breakfast.
notes: The house has rainwater throughout, if you prefer mains water we will turn the meter on before your arrival.

name: The Chardonnay Room
summary: A warm welcome from the picturesque and historic Barossa! an international attraction for the wineries, restaurants, scenic surroundings and Germanic culture with plenty to do and see. The house is located near major arterial roads for easy access, but is in a quiet cul-de-sac with quiet neighbours – no city noise! Looking forward to making your stay comfortable. I have three separate rooms available. The Chardonnay Room, The Cabernet Room and The Pinot Room. Each can accommodate two guests.
space: You have a clean and tidy bedroom that has a comfortable modern queen bed, wardrobe, drawers, hanging space, bedside table and your own air-conditioning. You will have a key to lock your bedroom. It also includes a shared lounge, shared dining, and shared kitchen area. The bathroom is for guest use only and has a large vanity space, separate shower recess and separate toilet. The bathroom may be shared with other guests if other rooms are booked. The hairdryer/iron/toiletries in the bathroom and shower area are available for use while you are staying in the home.  You are also welcome to sit outside in the undercover area.
description: A warm welcome from the picturesque and historic Barossa! an international attraction for the wineries, restaurants, scenic surroundings and Germanic culture with plenty to do and see. The house is located near major arterial roads for easy access, but is in a quiet cul-de-sac with quiet neighbours – no city noise! Looking forward to making your stay comfortable. I have three separate rooms available. The Chardonnay Room, The Cabernet Room and The Pinot Room. Each can accommodate two guests. You have a clean and tidy bedroom that has a comfortable modern queen bed, wardrobe, drawers, hanging space, bedside table and your own air-conditioning. You will have a key to lock your bedroom. It also includes a shared lounge, shared dining, and shared kitchen area. The bathroom is for guest use only and has a large vanity space, separate shower recess and separate toilet. The bathroom may be shared with other guests if other rooms are booked. The hairdryer/iron/toiletries in the bathroom and sh
neighborhood_overview: The immediate neighbourhood consists of settled home owners. Most houses have high fencing in their backyards for privacy. It is a very quiet area and has respectful neighbours. A quaint country town, with no city noise means that your stay will be relaxing and restful. Nuriootpa is surrounded by vineyards and farms. At any time of the year there is a lot of green vegetation. Being part of the Barossa Valley means there are a number of small towns all with their own charm and interests. Nuriootpa is known as the business end of the Barossa and has a new shopping mall. We have Foodland and Foodworks available for all your grocery needs as well as Mitre 10, clothing, sports and homeware shops, also Aldi and Cheap as Chips. A number of cafes are located throughout the Barossa towns. We have two 24 hour food options with Hungry Jacks or the Big Grill located at Caltex on the highway. Every town has a local pub which will serve great meals. The Vine Inn is a popular spot being open from 7 a
notes: WIFI details are listed in your welcome letter.  Tourist brochures are available. Small library of books are available if you wish to read.  Winter can get very cold with some frosty mornings. Extra blankets are available. Similarly summer can be hot but dry. There is a ceiling fan in your room. Your room has split system air conditioning for heating and cooling to your liking.  A quaint country town, with no city noise means that your stay will be relaxing and restful. Nuriootpa is surrounded by vineyards and farms. At any time of the year there is a lot of green vegetation.  Being part of the Barossa Valley means there are a number of small towns all with their own charm and interests.  Nuriootpa is known as the business end of the Barossa and the main shopping mall was recently constructed and includes more services. We have Foodland, Aldi and Foodworks available for all your grocery needs as well as Mitre 10, clothing, sports and homeware shops. A number of cafes are located throug
transit: Getting around the Barossa is best done by private car. There is a local taxi service if you are heading out for a big night. A bus service runs intermittently to Gawler where it meets the train line to Adelaide city. There are bike tracks in the Barossa. There is a dedicated bike track from Nuriootpa to Angaston.
access: Access to:  •	key for your room is available by lockbox – check in when it suits you •	parking available on the front gravel area  •	WIFI / Netflix / TV / DVDs in the shared lounge space •	Light breakfast available – fruit and cereal (gluten free option available) •	tea / coffee / hot chocolate / water are available in the kitchen along with access to the kettle, microwave, sandwich press and toaster. I would be grateful if food is consumed in the dining area and not the bedroom. Please tidy after yourself by washing dishes or stacking cups etc. next to the kitchen sink.
interaction: I live in the front part of the house and work full time, so I may not be home very often or may not be available to greet you on arrival. Otherwise, key access is by a lock box so your arrival time is flexible. Your access code will be emailed to you.   I am happy to help answer questions and will do my best to ensure you have a comfortable stay. Either way I am happy to interact as much or little as you choose. I do have 2 indoor cats that will be kept in the front area while I am not home. Again, you can choose if you would like to interact with them when I am home, otherwise I will keep them away from the shared area.
house_rules: - Leave the area tidy please - Respect for Neighbours - no loud noise  - No visitors - Eating or drinking in the dining area only please - Conserve energy - turn off lights / air conditioner when not needed and when leaving the house - Smoking outside only, not near open windows or doors - thanks - I advise you that I have 2 cats, they are not allowed in guest rooms
host_about: I love my job as a teacher in a local primary school. I have stayed at a few places using Airbnb and was impressed enough to consider hosting others.  After hosting wonderful guests from around the globe, I am now planning my own overseas adventure next year. Would love insight and tips from my guests! I have been local for 7 years but have a long family history in the area. I am a Christian and am involved with a local church and love helping others.

name: Boongarrie Luxury Tent
summary: Boongarrie Luxury Tent offers privacy and luxury on a beautiful parcel of land  located in the Barossa Valley. Wake to views of majestic red gums and in the cooler months enjoy a campfire and savour the Barossa Red left for your enjoyment.  Little touches of luxury and generous breakfast supplies make this the perfect place for couples to explore the valley. Why not treat yourself and try something different.
space: The tent has a luxurious interior with a gorgeous ensuite bathroom.  A large queen size bed,  kitchenette, with fridge, microwave, toaster, kettle and plunger coffee facilities,  and for your comfort there is a reverse cycle air conditioner, TV and blue tooth speaker.   The bathroom has a rain shower and a claw foot bath, toilet and vanity. Ironing facilities and a hairdryer provided. Outside there is an outdoor kitchen with a BBQ and a side burner, sink, all utensils and pans cooking facilities and a red gum bar and stools.
description: Boongarrie Luxury Tent offers privacy and luxury on a beautiful parcel of land  located in the Barossa Valley. Wake to views of majestic red gums and in the cooler months enjoy a campfire and savour the Barossa Red left for your enjoyment.  Little touches of luxury and generous breakfast supplies make this the perfect place for couples to explore the valley. Why not treat yourself and try something different. The tent has a luxurious interior with a gorgeous ensuite bathroom.  A large queen size bed,  kitchenette, with fridge, microwave, toaster, kettle and plunger coffee facilities,  and for your comfort there is a reverse cycle air conditioner, TV and blue tooth speaker.   The bathroom has a rain shower and a claw foot bath, toilet and vanity. Ironing facilities and a hairdryer provided. Outside there is an outdoor kitchen with a BBQ and a side burner, sink, all utensils and pans cooking facilities and a red gum bar and stools. Guests have a large paddock setting with access to creek
neighborhood_overview: Flaxman Valley is a quiet regional area with some small wineries and farms.
notes: We have a wonderful small boutique winery "Poonawatta" within walking distance. You can organise a private tasting,  enjoy your visit  and meander home across paddocks. Up the road further is Flaxman Wines where you can organise to attend a long table lunch that is held on the first Saturday of each month. They are open in cellar door from Thursday -Sunday.
transit: Private vehicle is necessary.
access: Guests have a large paddock setting with access to creek areas, a private courtyard, fire pit (seasonal)  and plenty of outdoor places to relax. Guests are welcome to have  a walk through the property and along the creek. Clients have their own entrance and car park. Outside lighting and their own outdoor kitchen with all you need for an extended stay.
interaction: Guests will be able to contact us via text messages to request any extra supplies or with any concerns or issues. We aim to provide a private luxurious and unique  accommodation where guests can initiate contact if they wish.
house_rules: - No campfires in fireban season
host_about:
My partner Garrry and I have lived in the beautiful Barossa for over 20 years. We enjoy all the fine foods and wines that are at our doorstep and love meeting new people. We enjoy travelling both overseas and in Australia, and love getting away from it all under the stars and living it up in luxury.
We love fishing and retreating when possible, to one of our beach houses on the Yorke Peninsula. 
We understand from our own travelling that guests may want total privacy and independence or wish to have some assistance and interaction.

space: Bedroom one has Queen bed.  Bedroom two has the choice of two single beds or this can be a King bed. Ideal for couples or singles. Please specify this when booking if needing beds in second bedroom need to be singles.

name: Azalea CedarRose Barossa Valley B&B free breakfast
summary: Azalea Cedar-Rose has been uniquely refurbished while maintaining its period charm and is perfectly situated to explore Australia's premier wine region, the Barossa Valley.  Boasting 4 spacious and stunning queen size bedrooms,  accommodating up to 10.  Two bathrooms, spa bath, bathrobes, comfy couches, a log fire, free Netflix & WiFi The villa is alluring, beds made, fire set, afternoon tea, free Continental Breakfast and beautiful vineyard views  Complimentary port and chocolates.
space: The moment you step inside you will love the attention to detail and the unique styling with its fine furnishings, Baltic floors, French doors, high ceilings, and lead light windows. On arrival, help yourself to pod coffee, selection of teas, milk, biscuits which is complimentary. Enjoy chocolate truffles and help yourself to the carafe of local Port wine. Enjoy the free continental breakfast of country bread, butter, milk, juice, cereal and a selection of local jams to prepare at your own leisure. You can Purchase the full Breakfast package at only $15 pp per night of eggs,  smoked bacon, tomatoes, mushrooms, baked beans, preserved fruit, pancake mix, maple syrup,  and bottle of local wine. (please let us know if you would like the breakfast package and we can adjust the Airbnb rates)   All Linen, Towels and bathrobes supplied. Enjoy the space as even with 10 guests you are not on top of each other.  There are two separate bathrooms with under floor heating, one with a toilet, vanity

neighborhood_overview: Easy stroll to bakeries, cafes, restaurants, pubs, super-market, fashion shops, cellar doors and art Galleries. Hot air-ballooning  Helicopter Scenic flights Lord Lyndoch Restaurant  Lavender farm Excellent Tourist office in Tanunda
notes: If you would like more than your continental breakfast provisions you can Purchase our Sumptuous Breakfast package at only $15 pp per from our generous provisions of eggs, double smoked bacon, tomatoes, baked beans, preserved fruit, pancake mix, maple syrup, jams, breakfast juice, coffee and teas and bottle of wine. (We can adjust your rates for breakfast on Airbnb if you would like to go ahead with full breakfast provisions)  Cottages supply complimentary coffee pods, teas, milk, Port wine & chocolates along with continental breakfast provisions. All Linen, Towels and bathrobes supplied. Next door is Jasmine's Cottage also on Airbnb and accommodates 4 comfortably in two queen size bedrooms plus two extra on the pull out couch if you need it. Next door to Jasmine's is Pioneer Park with some interesting plaques explaining the history of the Barossa Valley.
transit: Walking distance to all the local village has to offer.  A car is needed to travel the full extent of the Barossa or book a tour.  A bus service to Tanunda, Nuriootpa & Angaston or back to Gawler. From Gawler there is a train service to Adelaide. Barossa Taxi's are a good idea as well, especially if your a group. Only charge per hour not per person. Fantastic bike riding tracks.
access: The whole house and property is exclusively yours, even if just two people book. Car parks are available both sides of the property. You are sent a key lock code and you let your self in. If you prefer to meet and greet someone at the door we can arrange that as well. Send your preferred dates and I will answer asap.
interaction: We are just a phone call away as we live in Adelaide, our housekeeper is on call and only lives down the road.  Nothing is too small a matter to ensure your complete satisfaction. So please contact us immediately if we have not exceeded your expectations. We can recommend  wineries and restaurants for you to visit. As this property is not hosted a key lock is situated on the front porch and the code will be sent to you before arrival. Please note, you can book straight away or make an enquiry. If your group is larger than 10, why not book Jasmine's Cottage which we own located next door and can take 4 extra quests.
house_rules: We appreciate most will respect our beautiful properties but the occasional abuse requires that we state the following Terms & Conditions.  1: The person booking for themselves or on behalf of other people is responsible for the property, and for making all guests and visitors aware of house rules and these Terms and Conditions. Payment of the rental property constitutes the guests acceptance of these Terms & Conditions. 2: Functions whereby extra people are invited onto the property is not allowed without prior approval.  3: The number of guests staying at the property must not exceed the number stated on the booking confirmation.  4: Check in time is after 3pm and check out time is 11am. If the property is not vacated by the agreed time then extra charges may be incurred. 5: Early check in and late check out may be available in agreement with the owner.  6: Our properties are no-smoking properties. Please do not discard butts ANYWHERE at the property including lawns and gardens. Ther
host_about: Hi, I am happily married to my sweetheart who I met when I was 12. Married at 19, have 4 lovely kids who married 4 lovely partners and we now have 14 adorable grandies!!  We have run a florist shop for 15 years whilst renovating two properties for Bed and Breakfast in the Barossa Valley. Now we have retired from floristry and we are enjoying the beautiful serenity of the Barossa Valley more and more. We love to travel and have been fortunate to visit many countries overseas, which helps when it comes to seeing what our guests in our accommodation need for comfort and an unique experience. Book with us and we will share some fabulous intimate wineries.

neighborhood_overview: A quiet neighbourhood and very safe. You can walk to the Pub or Lord Lyndoch at night without any worry at all.
notes: In all directions from our cottage it is beautiful scenery. Take a drive to Williamstown, go past beautiful vineyards, call in to the Barossa chicks and take a ride in a helicoptor for only $40. Go in the other directions and head to Tanunda and Angaston and see all the attractions that is on offer. So many wineries on the way to explore. Dont forget a visit to Maggie Beers for lunch and to purchase some of her delicious condiments. A drive to Sepeltsfield winery is amazing and in the other direction, we enjoy visiting Yalumba winery. Just around the corner from our cottages is Hemera Cellar doors, a lovely log fire in winter and a free tour on offer. Chateau Barossa just up the hill has a great gift shop, and an amazing unique antique tour. A must is the Angaston Markets on a Saturday morning! Have your breaky there, sample all the local produce, so yum.
transit: A car is preferable to visit all the wineries or you could take tours. There is a bus that leaves Lyndoch and goes to Tanunda or Gawler. Adelaide is only one hour away.
access: This unique home is exclusively yours and private. Entrance by a key code which will be sent to you once your booking has been confirmed.
interaction: We are here to help you have the best possible holiday. We can offer ideas of places to visit and where to dine. We are just a phone call away and our housekeeper lives in the same street, so if you need anything or want to to know anything, we are available 24/7

name: The Reserve Barossa Valley
summary: The Reserve sits on six acres and accommodates up to 10 people in five bedrooms. It has an open plan fully equipped kitchen for food lovers, three bathrooms, several living and dining areas.  There are magnificent views and a huge outdoor area with a wood fired pizza oven.  The Reserve Barossa Valley is an amazing place to .... escape, relax and indulge all the Barossa has to offer
space: If you were to pick a dream location in the Barossa The Reserve would be it. Located right smack bang in the middle of all the famous wineries and only minutes along Seppeltsfield Road to some of Australia’s best wineries including; Whistler, Heritage, Two Hands, Torbreck, Tscharke, Barossa Valley Estate, Seppeltsfield, Hentley Farm, Gnadenfrei and Greenock Creek. And just a few more minutes to Penfolds, Jacob’s Creek, Yalumba and Elderton. Appellation (the Barossa’s finest dining) less than a minute away. You can even escape through our back gate, wander through the Shiraz vines over to Maggie Beers Farm Shop for lunch by the lake.

neighborhood_overview: Where are the best Barossa Cellar Doors? Well, many of them can be found along Seppeltsfield Road! These include Hentley Farm, 2015 James Halliday Wine Companion Cellar Door of the Year. Hentley Farm, Greenock Creek Wines,Tscharke’s Place, Izway, Rolf Binder, Heritage, Two Hands and Torbreck are just a few of the wineries along the nine kilometres of Seppeltsfield Road where premium Barossa wines, including many famous Barossa Shiraz wines (the variety the Barossa is most famous for) can be tasted. Whistler Wines is a fabulous spot to combine wine tasting with a platter in the gardens under a gum tree, then visit their rescued pet kangaroos! Many of the wines produced in the Marananga/Seppeltsfield/Greenock sub-region of the Barossa are world class.  We have small, single vineyard producers without cellar doors as well as iconic establishments including the historic Seppeltsfield Estate Winery founded in 1851 and Winner of the 2016 Qantas National Tourism Award for Best Tourism Winery,
notes: Having access to the best local produce in SA, you can pick up your goodies from the Barossa Farmers Market each Saturday to cook up a storm in either the large kitchen or wood fired oven. However, should you wish to relax after a long day of wine tasting or walk the trails, we are able to point you in the right direction - Rachel from Destination Dining/ Owen Andrews Catering or Ellie Beer are just a few local business which specialise in customising your dining experience. Be it a family gathering, touring wine group or mates escape we can provide a long table lunch to 8 course degustation dinner.
transit: If you were to pick a dream location in the Barossa The Reserve would be it. Located right smack bang in the middle of all the famous wineries and only minutes along Seppeltsfield Road to some of Australia’s best wineries including; Whistler, Heritage, Two Hands, Torbreck, Tscharke, Barossa Valley Estate, Seppeltsfield, Hentley Farm, Gnadenfrei and Greenock Creek. And just a few more minutes to Penfolds, Jacob’s Creek, Yalumba and Elderton. Appellation (the Barossa’s finest dining) less than a minute away. You can even escape through our back gate, wander through the Shiraz vines over to Maggie Beers Farm Shop for lunch by the lake
access: Enviable in the extreme, this exclusive, self-catered residence comprises three King-size suites, one Queen-size suite, a self-contained studio appropriate for pilots, guides, guests or carers and three fully refurbished bathrooms. Immerse yourself and star-gaze from the six-person spa under the vines or host an old world “Tuscan style” get-together around the wood-fired pizza oven & BBQ. Drag yourself away from the fireplace in the open plan lounge and retire to stunning views of premium vines that compliment every bedroom. There are two dining areas, wine room/library, huge fully-equipped kitchen, separate laundry & boot room entry and all the “mod cons”. •Pizza Oven •Baking Oven •BBQ •6-person Spa We provide all bed linen, towels & spa towels
interaction: To make the most of your Barossa Experience, email thereser (Website hidden by Airbnb) we are more than happy to make your stay memorable. We highly recommend visiting Barossa Visitor Information Centre 66-68 Murray St, Tanunda SA 5352
house_rules: - For Events or Weddings, please contact (EMAIL HIDDEN) directly. - *conditions apply for Weddings or Events - Accommodation for the entire property is for up to 10 guests, 2 further guests can be accommodated for with 2 x hotel roll-away beds @ an additional charge of $100 per person, per night. Rollaway beds will be based in the Studio bedroom 5. 12 guests are the maximum number we provide accommodation for. We are happy to allow up to 16 guests in total (12 overnight & 4 visitors) to dine at The Reserve as we are able to seat this amount inside if it is raining. Further than this number is considered a function, please contact Simone Tanner for event and marque details. Nightly rate: $1350 incl. GST. Deposit of 50% is required at the time of booking as a pre-condition of the booking being placed. Balance due 60 days prior to arrival.  - Refundable Bond: Will be required 3-days prior to arrival - Bedroom 3 & 5 Can be made into x2 Single Beds or King/Queen Beds - The Reserve Booking F
host_about:
There’s something very special about the Barossa. You can feel it in the landscape, in the people, the food and the wine. It’s a beautiful region, with villages, vineyards and farms dotting a patchwork vista. Barossans are famous for their generous hospitality, their love of a shared table and their passion for local food and wine. Festivals, celebrations, markets and music thrive here. Barossa is life’s great pleasures, in one unique place. 

We welcome you to Barossa. The place we love. The place we call home.
