name: Barossa Valley, Pondicherri Guest Suite 2
summary: Set on 5 acres, Pondicherri is a small acreage landholding with a cluster of small buildings exuding a village atmosphere.  Its borrowed rural amenity and views are enabled as it is surrounded by much larger farming land creating a quiet rustic oasis yet is close to everything in the Barossa Valley.  Some of the buildings are of historic interest and date back to 1845.
space: The Pondicherri Guest Suite 2 is a small compact contemporary room containing a king single  bed with an adjoining private ensuite bathroom.  It’s perfect for the solo traveller. Ideal for travelling companions too!   A second person can be accommodated on a foldout ottoman bed.   Quality natural bed linens  and towels are provided.   For your movie entertainment, a TV with (Hidden by Airbnb) Chromecast with access Netflix is included alongside the NBN WIFI to chill at the end of your day. Suite 2 has reverse cycle A/C,  fridge, microwave, toaster and kettle so your ambient comfort and needs are met.    Suite 2 can be booked with Suite 1.   Both Guest Suites can be booked together and are perfect for travelling family, friends or associates. It’s what is on the inside that counts!     We are slowly upgrading the grounds and historic buidings but at the rate provided,  you will be very comfortable and private.
description: Set on 5 acres, Pondicherri is a small acreage landholding with a cluster of small buildings exuding a village atmosphere.  Its borrowed rural amenity and views are enabled as it is surrounded by much larger farming land creating a quiet rustic oasis yet is close to everything in the Barossa Valley.  Some of the buildings are of historic interest and date back to (Phone number hidden by Airbnb)  The Pondicherri Guest Suite 2 is a small compact contemporary room containing a king single  bed with an adjoining private ensuite bathroom.  It’s perfect for the solo traveller. Ideal for travelling companions too!   A second person can be accommodated on a foldout ottoman bed.   Quality natural bed linens  and towels are provided.   For your movie entertainment, a TV with (Hidden by Airbnb) Chromecast with access Netflix is included alongside the NBN WIFI to chill at the end of your day. Suite 2 has reverse cycle A/C,  fridge, microwave, toaster and kettle so your ambient comfort and needs ar
neighborhood_overview: We are only 5 minutes drive to the pretty historic village of Angaston that is well serviced with a varied selection of cafes,  restaurants, 2 pubs, a supermarket, butcher, hardware, medical centre, post office and retail that houses speciality Barossa food businesses.    We are a 3 minute drive from the famed Barossa Valley Farmers Market that is open every Saturday morning from 7.30am.   We can tell you the back roads to get there too!   Just ask! There are many high quality wineries, restaurants, food establishments and historic buildings to explore across the region.    If food and wine are not your thing, there are numerous walking and cycling trails, some easy bushwalks including spotting kangaroos at Kaisersthul Conservation Park.    Or you could  go  ballooning or a helicopter ride for the birds eye view!     Just about everything except surfing!     Only one hour's drive to the nearest South Australian coastline,  one+half hour's drive into city of Adelaide and a one hour driv
notes: The grounds are a work in progress.   We do apologise for now.    However,  your indoor space has everything you will need. Please ensure no packaging or products are disposed into the waste water system.  Please put anything in the paper bags provided in the bathrooms and place into the bins provided.   No smoking under any circumstances in the rooms or bathrooms.    If you smoke, please smoke outside. You may want to consider to bring your own light breakfast provisions.  There is a toaster, kettle, fridge and microwave in your room.   Sometimes it’s good to chill and not rush off to find something to eat.      That is - of course -  if the slow pace suits you :)    But there are many many many breakfast/brunch options across the Barossa Valley too!
transit: You will need a car to access our property.  There is no public transport within a reasonable walking distance.  We are a hilly 3km away from the township of Angaston.
access: There is an undercover fully equipped BBQ area for guest use.
interaction: As much or as little as  you please!  You are independent in our Pondicherri ‘village’ and we will always respect  privacy.
house_rules: All guests are  to dispose of any feminine hygiene products, baby wipes, cotton buds, makeup wipes, dental floss, pills, cigarette butts and any other packaging to be placed into the paper bags and put in the bins provided.   Please do not flush any products in the waste water  system.  It will block very quickly and we will know who is responsible!   Smoking is NOT permitted inside the accommodation rooms under any circumstances.  We can provide ashtrays for smokers outside.
host_about: I love to travel but not enough. I love to cook and share my table with family and friends.  I love the smell of a freshly picked lemon and fresh herbs.  I love my little animals and the flocks of different birds that play and swoon across Pondicherri.   I’m social and then sometimes,  I’m a bit reclusive.   I love sunrises more than sunsets but both are spectacular and I’m lucky enough to experience and appreciate often.   I’m grateful for living in a place that affords  peace and privacy.   And I enjoy meeting people!  The  AirBnB adventure is a wonderful way to engage with many different people from far and wide.  To gain a deeper appreciation of the spirit of place - and it’s unique culture - staying with those who live there becomes a rich and memorable experience.  Welcome to our village.

name: The Pinot Room
summary: A warm welcome from the picturesque and historic Barossa! an international attraction for the wineries, restaurants, scenic surroundings and Germanic culture with plenty to do and see. The house is located near major arterial roads for easy access, but is in a quiet cul-de-sac with quiet neighbours – no city noise! Looking forward to making your stay comfortable. I have three separate rooms available. The Chardonnay Room, The Cabernet Room and The Pinot Room. Each can accommodate two guests.
space: You have a clean and tidy bedroom with a comfortable double bed, hanging space and drawers, recliner and bedside table. There is a brand new air-conditioner in your room for your comfort. You will have a key to lock your bedroom. The space also includes a shared lounge, shared dining, and shared kitchen area. The bathroom is for guests only and has a large vanity space, separate large shower recess and separate toilet. I have 3 rooms for seperate rooms for guests. If the other rooms are not booked, you will have exclusive use of the bathroom space. There is a hairdryer and an iron available for use while you are in the home.  You are also welcome to sit outside in the undercover area.
description: A warm welcome from the picturesque and historic Barossa! an international attraction for the wineries, restaurants, scenic surroundings and Germanic culture with plenty to do and see. The house is located near major arterial roads for easy access, but is in a quiet cul-de-sac with quiet neighbours – no city noise! Looking forward to making your stay comfortable. I have three separate rooms available. The Chardonnay Room, The Cabernet Room and The Pinot Room. Each can accommodate two guests. You have a clean and tidy bedroom with a comfortable double bed, hanging space and drawers, recliner and bedside table. There is a brand new air-conditioner in your room for your comfort. You will have a key to lock your bedroom. The space also includes a shared lounge, shared dining, and shared kitchen area. The bathroom is for guests only and has a large vanity space, separate large shower recess and separate toilet. I have 3 rooms for seperate rooms for guests. If the other rooms are not booked,
neighborhood_overview: The immediate neighbourhood consists of settled home owners. Most houses have high fencing in their backyards for privacy. It is a very quiet area and has respectful neighbours. A quaint country town, with no city noise means that your stay will be relaxing and restful. Nuriootpa is surrounded by vineyards and farms. At any time of the year there is a lot of green vegetation. Being part of the Barossa Valley means there are a number of small towns all with their own charm and interests. Nuriootpa is known as the business end of the Barossa and has a new shopping mall. We have Foodland and Foodworks available for all your grocery needs as well as Mitre 10, clothing, sports and homeware shops, also Aldi and Cheap as Chips. A number of cafes are located throughout the Barossa towns. We have two 24 hour food options with Hungry Jacks or the Big Grill located at Caltex on the highway. Every town has a local pub which will serve great meals. The Vine Inn is a popular spot being open from 7 a
notes: WIFI details are listed in your welcome letter, no restrictions with usage as I have plenty of GBs! Tourist brochures are available. Winter can get very cold with some frosty mornings. Extra blankets are available. Similarly summer can be hot but dry. Your room has a split system air conditioner. I do have 2 indoor cats that live in my part of the house, you will only see them when I am home, but I am happy to keep them away form guests if you don't like cats.
transit: Getting around the Barossa is best done by private car. There is a local taxi service if you are heading out for a big night. A bus service runs intermittently to Gawler where it meets the train line to Adelaide city. There are bike tracks in the Barossa, with a bike shop in Nuriootpa renting bicycles. There is a dedicated bike track from Nuriootpa to Angaston.
access: Access to:  •	key for your room is available by lockbox – check in when it suits you  •	parking available on the front gravel area  •	WIFI / Netflix / TV / DVDs in the shared lounge space  •	Light breakfast available – fruit and cereal (gluten free option available)  •	tea / coffee / hot chocolate / water are available in the kitchen along with access to the kettle, microwave, sandwich press and toaster. I would be grateful if food is consumed in the dining area and not the bedroom. Please tidy after yourself by washing your dishes, or stacking items neatly next to the kitchen sink.
interaction: I live in the front part of the house and work full time, so I may not be home very often or may not be available to greet you on arrival. Otherwise, key access is by a lock box so your arrival time is flexible. Your access code will be emailed to you. I am happy to help answer questions and will do my best to ensure you have a comfortable stay. Either way I am happy to interact as much or little as you choose. I do have 2 indoor cats that will be kept in the front area while I am not home. Again, you can choose if you would like to interact with them when I am home, otherwise I will keep them away from the shared area.
house_rules: - Leave the area tidy please - Respect for Neighbours - no loud noise  - No visitors - Eating or drinking in the dining area only please - Conserve energy - turn off lights / air conditioner when not needed and when leaving the house - Smoking outside only, not near open windows or doors - thanks - I advise you that I have 2 cats, they are not allowed in guest rooms
host_about: I love my job as a teacher in a local primary school. I have stayed at a few places using Airbnb and was impressed enough to consider hosting others.  After hosting wonderful guests from around the globe, I am now planning my own overseas adventure next year. Would love insight and tips from my guests! I have been local for 7 years but have a long family history in the area. I am a Christian and am involved with a local church and love helping others.

name: Bright, Spacious Barossa Getaway
summary: Here is a bright and sunny family home in the heart of the Barossa Valley ready for you to come and enjoy. Very modern and clean, this property is perfect for the whole family or couples wishing to explore. Nuriootpa, or Nuri as the locals call it, is nestled in between Tanunda, Angaston and Greenock, and is the perfect place for your spring escape. With easy access from the highway, this home is close to all the best wineries with Wolf Blass, Penfolds and more just a short drive away.
description: Here is a bright and sunny family home in the heart of the Barossa Valley ready for you to come and enjoy. Very modern and clean, this property is perfect for the whole family or couples wishing to explore. Nuriootpa, or Nuri as the locals call it, is nestled in between Tanunda, Angaston and Greenock, and is the perfect place for your spring escape. With easy access from the highway, this home is close to all the best wineries with Wolf Blass, Penfolds and more just a short drive away. Guests have private access to three beautiful bedrooms all with Queen beds, as well as a spacious living, kitchen and dining area with an outdoor entertainment area perfect for the coming warmer months. I will be available 24/7 if you should need anything and will provide all the information you need to make your stay amazing. Well as I'm sure you already know the Barossa Valley is popular for its beautiful wines. With hundreds of wineries around the area you won't be short on places to go. It also offer
neighborhood_overview: Well as I'm sure you already know the Barossa Valley is popular for its beautiful wines. With hundreds of wineries around the area you won't be short on places to go. It also offers some of the most amazing restaurants that have been celebrated world wide. Lots of cosy cafes and antique stores to while away your time.
notes: Two night minimum stay required over Fridays and Saturdays
transit: Driving is the best way to get around as public transport is almost non existent. You can organise drivers for the day or wine tours so you can sit back and enjoy. Recommend you book taxis in advance as they can sometimes be on multiple jobs over the weekend.
access: Guests have private access to three beautiful bedrooms all with Queen beds, as well as a spacious living, kitchen and dining area with an outdoor entertainment area perfect for the coming warmer months.

name: Pine Cone Ridge
summary: COMING SOON! Whether you are looking for a base from which to explore the Barossa, or a place in which to bunker down and take a break from a fast-paced life, Pine Cone Ridge is for you. The house is nestled into a ridge top amongst rolling hills and vineyards and large windows in the open plan living area allow you to enjoy the spectacular views whether you are inside or outside.
space: The 16 acre property provides a natural habitat for kangaroos and native birds and early risers can enjoy watching hot air balloons drift across the valley. Fiery summer sunsets & sunrises; autumnal colours; misty winter mornings crisp with frost; and the blossom of spring - the outlook is constantly changing. The house is self contained with a fully functional kitchen, big comfy couches and a wide selection of games, books, jigsaws & DVDs for your entertainment. Curl up by the wood fire in winter with your favourite port or enjoy a chilled white and some local cheese in the golden light of a balmy summer evening.

neighborhood_overview: Pine Cone Ridge is walking distance (2km) from the main street of Angaston.  Angaston is arguably the prettiest of the towns in the Barossa. Set amongst rolling hills it offers a well-preserved heritage streetscape lined by large leafy trees. It also sits on the border of the Barossa & Eden Valleys making a perfect base from which to explore both wine regions. It is home to the Barossa Cheese Company, Yalumba, Vitners restaurant, Taste Eden Valley, and the not-to-be-missed Barossa Farmers Market amongst many other attractions.
access: As a guest you will have full access to the house and house block.
house_rules: - No camping - No outdoor fires during the fireban season (November-May) - Motor vehicles / motor bikes are only to be driven on the gravelled areas - May - October outdoor fires are allowed but are to be contained within the firebox provided

name: Pembury Cottage ~ Angaston,  Barossa Valley
summary: PEMBURY *** Newly Renovated 2017 *** SELF CONTAINED ACCOMMODATION CENTRALLY LOCATED IN THE HEART OF ANGASTON Pembury is a charming, stylish, fully renovated three-bedroom house centrally located for you to explore the Barossa wine region. Situated at the quiet end of the main street of Angaston, this classic late 1800s cottage features modern and comfortable décor as well as a fully fenced, level backyard.
space: Pembury is a luxury self-contained property, beautifully renovated, classic late 1800s cottage, with a modern and comfortable décor and secure backyard suitable for pets. Located in historic Angaston Pembury Cottage comfortably accommodates up to 6 guests with 3 king sized bedrooms and a spacious shower/wet room and 2 toilets. House trained pets are welcome.    Provisions are supplied for a cooked breakfast, made from the best local produce, on the first morning of your stay. Settle into the comfortable lounge with a wood burning combustion stove, or head out to the large covered pergola, complete with gas BBQ, or relax in the covered eating area under the verandah.  All rooms have reverse cycle split system air-conditioners for year-round comfort. Take an easy stroll down the street to the many cafes and restaurants, no cabs required! Great pizzas, coffee, Italian Cooking School at Casa Carboni, the Barossa Valley Cheese Company, Thai restaurant  - lots of options to keep you fed and

Settle into the comfortable lounge with a wood burning combustion stove, or head out to the large covered per
neighborhood_overview: Angaston known as the Jewel of the Barossa offers a great diversity of restaurants, cafe's, a cooking school and Taste Eden Valley, a tasting room featuring wines exclusively from Eden Valley. Easy access to the other towns of the Barossa is within a 8 minute drive which opens up this great wine and food region. Don't forget the Farmers Market every Saturday, do some shopping, have some breakfast and cook up a great dinner in the modern kitchen, Or, let us get the chef to do that for you!
notes: Kate and Jonathan have lived locally for many years. They are well known characters. Should any need arise they can assist with suggested itineraries. Otherwise you will have the house to yourselves and will not be disturbed Please do give us a call if you do require anything.  We can organise great local chefs to provide an' in house' degustation dinner (no need to go out after a day of wine tasting) or provisions for a picnic. Prior notice is required.
transit: There is a taxi service but no Uber available in the area. As a special offer to our guests we can arrange a private wine tour for the day guided by Jonathan from Barossa Taste Sensations and your host at Pembury Cottage. Drawing on over 10 year experience  the tour focuses on the boutique wineries that highlight the diversity of this great wine region.
access: Access – We have a key safe at the rear of the property, so access is easy. We can be contacted on (PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN) or via email (EMAIL HIDDEN) Shops, just a short walk away include a butcher, great bacon, baker, pharmacy, ATM's and supermarket that's open until 8.00 all within a 5 min walk.  Our accommodation offers fully equipped modern kitchen facilities with inside and outside dining areas comfortably seating 6 people.
house_rules: Please note that if you book for 2 people you are booked into one bedroom. If you wish to use a 2nd  or 3rd bedroom there is a fee as it then requires cleaning and fresh linen . If any extra beds have been used we will bill you for the extra room.

name: Beauchamp House B&B
summary: Beauchamp House is set on a 168 Acre farm with Splendid gardens and views of the hills around you. We welcome you to stay and enjoy the quite and peaceful nature of Beauchamp House and discover all the Barossa Valley has to offer. Our 1870 built home is open for you to use and we dont book seperate people in that you dont know so if it's just the 2 people or a group of 6 the place is entirely yours. Sit back and relax or go for a walk and check out the animlas we have around the farm.
space: Beauchamp has 3 Bedrooms 2 with queens and one with a king bed and 2 rooms come with Ensuite and the other has a bathroom not far from it. Beauchamp house is a little luxuary with the old charms of a hills home. Guests on arrival will receive a bottle of wine and a cheese platter and all breakfast provisions while staying with us. Coffee machine and easy to you wood fired pizza oven add to the many amazing things that come with Beachamp house.

neighborhood_overview: Rolling Hills, beautiful paddocks with cows and horses fill your views. Mount Pleasant is only a short 5min drive away and there is wineries every direction you can go. Saturday morning farmers markets are on in Mount Pleasant or an evening meal at one of the hotels.
access: Guests have access to everything in the house and if needing WIFI just ask and we can hook you up. We have a veggie garden you can roam through and help yourself and a wood fired pizza oven to enjoy a cooked pizza and sit back and relax with a glass of wine.
interaction: Guests can have all the privacy they need or if wanting to ask questions or find out more about the place Denny and James are more then happy to have a chat or enjoy an evening drink or BBQ.

summary: 3-bedroom, Queenslander style home, with bullnose verandah and deck. Large rear kitchen/living area with exposed rafters, leading out onto a large pergola deck area. The house is suitable for families and groups.

The town is full of history, being the first mining town in Australia and the wealthiest at the time. This is evident in the architecture of the buildings around the town. Kapunda contains 4 pubs all serving meals, with pokie machines. Live bands are of
neighborhood_overview: Kapunda, located 18 minutes west of Nuriootpa and the Barossa Valley. The town is full of history, being the first mining town in Australia and the wealthiest at the time. This is evident in the architecture of the buildings around the town. Also known as one of the most haunted towns in Australia, so why not take a ghost tour. No need to worry, the house is situated 500mm along the main street, away from the haunted part of the town. Kapunda contains 4 pubs all serving meals, with pokie machines. Live bands are often playing on a Friday or Saturday night at one of them. If a wine tour is what you are after, we recommend a few local transportation companies, depending on your needs. Amenities in Kapunda include, supermarket, 24 hour petrol stations and Hospital (100m from house) Things to do in Kapunda Ghost Tour Sir Sydney Kidman residence – Kapunda high school Map the Miner statue Kapunda mine trail
notes: Linen Linen is not included in cost. Linen including sheets and towels can be provided at an additional cost of $10 per person. Please advise if you require linen upon booking. Basic Supplies Limited basic supplies such as toilet paper, tissues etc are supplied at the property. Guests are expected to supply there own including toilet paper, toiletries, ie body wash etc. Contact Please try and contact me through the Airbnb app or website; this is to ensure there is a record of any correspondence. My contact number is (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) ; I prefer this is only used for emergencies. Dogs If you will be bringing your pet, please advise at time of booking. Please ensure dogs are kept outside, with the exception of assistance dogs. Pets on furniture, on carpets and in bedrooms is strictly prohibited. I am highly allergic to pet hair and also want to ensure the house is kept clean and hygienic for the health and comfort of future guests. If there is evidence of pets inside, a cle
house_rules: Food & Drink in Bedrooms Please keep food and drinks in bedrooms to a minimum, to ensure minimum risk of spillages. Any damage from spillages will incur additional costs. Neighbours Please be respectful of my neighbours and keep the noise down after 11pm, even on weekends. Pets Please advise at time of booking if your pets will be staying. Please ensure pets are kept outside, with the exception of assistance dogs. Pets on furniture, on carpets and in bedrooms is strictly prohibited. I am highly allergic to pet hair and also want to ensure the house is kept clean and hygienic for the health and comfort of future guests. If there is evidence of pets inside, a cleaning fee will be charged. Please ensure you clean up the yard after your pet. No Smoking Indoors Smoking not permitted inside; Smoking on the deck allowed, providing doors & windows are closed, so no smoke is blown in the house.

name: Goat Square Cottages - Flaxman Cottage
summary: Goat Square Cottages comprises three adjoining heritage stone cottages right in the historic heart of Tanunda in the Barossa.  Your cottage has two bedrooms - a King and a Queen. Each cottage has log fire, air conditioning, under floor heating, 2 person spa bath with shower over, kitchenette where provisions are left for you to cook breakfasts and a welcome bottle of Barossa wine. Free wi-fi is provided for websurfing and email download Escape to Goat Square
space: Your cottage was built in the 1850's and is on the Register of the National Estate.  Just because the cottage is one of the oldest occupied dwellings in the Barossa, it is not filled with antiques and Grandma's lace work. You will experience low height doors, heritage fittings matched with modern facilities. Goat Square Cottages have been providing cottage accommodation to guests for well over 20 years - you can be assured that your BnB experience will be top rate.
description: Goat Square Cottages comprises three adjoining heritage stone cottages right in the historic heart of Tanunda in the Barossa.  Your cottage has two bedrooms - a King and a Queen. Each cottage has log fire, air conditioning, under floor heating, 2 person spa bath with shower over, kitchenette where provisions are left for you to cook breakfasts and a welcome bottle of Barossa wine. Free wi-fi is provided for websurfing and email download Escape to Goat Square Your cottage was built in the 1850's and is on the Register of the National Estate.  Just because the cottage is one of the oldest occupied dwellings in the Barossa, it is not filled with antiques and Grandma's lace work. Goat Square Cottages have been providing cottage accommodation to guests for well over 20 years - you can be assured that your BnB experience will be top rate. There is a separate laundry building with a washer and drier - plus
neighborhood_overview: Your cottage is right in the heritage heart of Tanunda - fronting on to Goat Square where the Ziegenmarkt (Goat Market) was held every Thursday. Its walking distance to the main street with the outstanding fermentAsian Restaurant and 1918 Bar and Grill.
notes: You can TRUST US - we started doing traditional hosted BnB in 1995 and opened our first self contained cottage in 1996. They were so successful we commenced the first Barossa Bed & Breakfast Booking Service in 1997. This property is part of a small collective called cottages4u - properties where we manage all the bookings and ensure guests have the best Barossa experience  Free wi-fi is provided for websurfing and email download. The access code is provided when booking confirmed
transit: The public bus operates from the main street (250 metres away) Onsite off street parking is provided for guests We suggest one of the local tour operators to take you around the Barossa - save drink driving and you get to learn a bit about wine food and history. Our favourite tour operator is Jonathon from Barossa Taste Sensations There are two local taxi companies
access: There is a separate laundry building with a washer and drier - plus an outside clothes line There are numerous fruit trees and guests are welcome to pick fruits in season
interaction: Your host lives nearby and will usually meet you on arrival (or soon after). She is only a phone call away
house_rules: - If you arrive home late or leave early, please consider guests in other cottages. Talk quietly and don't bang doors!
host_about:
Kim (together with his wife Malinda) founded the first cooperative of BnB cottage operators in the Barossa Valley back in 1997. While there are about 60 operators working with them through The Booking Service, a select few form the cottages4u collective. These are properties where the owners take a "back seat" role and Kim and Malinda, together with very capable local managers, present some of the best value Barossa and Burra accommodation.
Kim and Malinda have over 25 years experience in the BnB industry. They have lived 25 years and more in the Barossa and have strong connections in Burra (Malinda's Great Great Great Grandfather arrived there in the 1850's and Kim was Chair of the National Trust Branch for 3 years)
Now our two sons have grown up, had a good education and achieved great jobs, we love to travel ourselves and spend a lot of time in Asia - Viet Nam is our favourite!

name: Brown Bear Woods Holiday Home
summary: Nestled away in a quiet, leafy cul de sac of Lyndoch, this gorgeous home emphasizes natural elegance, showcasing a dynamic mixture of tailored finishes and quality fixtures. Grandeur in living space, the floor plan is well designed for large families. Impressive proportions continue with the additional games room which sets the precedence for stylish entertaining. Winter chills are comforted by combustion heating and the summer afternoons cooled by ducted air conditioning.
space: The formal living quarters feature vaulted ceilings giving an additional sense of space, together with chandelier lighting and elegant window furnishings. The Master suite is generous in size featuring a large walk-in robe and ensuite with spa bath and double vanity. Bedroom 2 and 4 are also generous in size, featuring built in wardrobes. Bedroom 3 has 2 single beds, with additional pull out beds stored underneath. Large family bathroom with separate toilet and vanity. Well appointed laundry with washing machine. The open plan living comes alive with the combination of meals and family room complimented by the large kitchen. Fully appointed with copious amounts of cupboard and bench space, stainless steel appliances, dishwasher and a walk-in-pantry. All the features a distinguished home-chef needs are right here! The rumpus room is an exciting space for guests of all ages, with a table tennis table and traditional wet corner bar. The large backyard features 2 main spaces. A large concr

neighborhood_overview: A quiet family friendly environment minutes away from world-class wineries, restaurants, bakeries and local shops. Leisure activities, local crafts and markets within a short walk or drive. Close proximity to Tanunda, Nuriootpa,  Angaston and Gawler.
notes: All guests will receive a complimentary  Brown Bear Woods gift featuring local treats. Please notify us in advance of your booking if your furry friends are also wanting to stay at Brown Bear Woods.
transit: Local bus station within 10 minute walk. Wineries within walking distance.
access: All areas of the home are offered for guests, currently with the exception of the double garage space.
house_rules: - Please notify if pets are staying
host_about:
My name is Sharon and I live in The Barossa South Australia. We decided to make our home a BnB when we had it for sale and then I was made redundant. When one door closes another one opens and I have always wanted to have a BnB, so I thought now was a good idea! 
The Barossa is a beautiful part of the world to live and we like exploring what it has to offer and discovering new places. 
When we go away we like to feel like we are being spoilt. That's why I am passionate about doing whatever I can to make your stay enjoyable. It's your time off and you want to feel rested and leave with good memories. My aim is to make you feel at home.
Hope you can come and stay sometime! :-)

name: Hutton Vale Farm - Hutch Hilton
summary: Experience the rhythms of farm life in the Hutton Vale Farm Hutch Hilton! Ideal for up to 4 couples or families looking for an authentic Australian experience within the rolling hills of the Barossa.
space: Think a camping holiday without having to take anything! A good make over of our staff quarters provides 4 seperate bedrooms each with a small ensuite, electric blanket, air conditioning and heating. An outdoor kitchen with adjoining (semi enclosed)  lounge area, open fire, books to read and games to play. Perfect for friends and couples bonding weekends. Fly in by private/charter aircraft landing on the farm's grass airstrip.
description: Experience the rhythms of farm life in the Hutton Vale Farm Hutch Hilton! Ideal for up to 4 couples or families looking for an authentic Australian experience within the rolling hills of the Barossa. Think a camping holiday without having to take anything! A good make over of our staff quarters provides 4 seperate bedrooms each with a small ensuite, electric blanket, air conditioning and heating. An outdoor kitchen with adjoining (semi enclosed)  lounge area, open fire, books to read and games to play. Perfect for friends and couples bonding weekends. Fly in by private/charter aircraft landing on the farm's grass airstrip. Enhance your stay by cooking yourself a paddock to plate meal. We produce a range of seasonally available produce including: our premium wine, ethically grown lamb and free range eggs, chutneys/preserves. Pre order is essential (7 days before check in) Also a great experience is to visit the Barossa Farmers market (10 minute drive) to collect a range of local produce
neighborhood_overview: Angaston township is 10 minutes away by car with specialty shops as well as all the services that might be required. The wider Barossa has more than 150 winery/cellar doors, 7 award winning restaurants, cafes, bakeries, art galleries, heritage sites, scenic bike track, parks and 2 golf courses.
notes: Hutton Vale Farm has been in our family for 174 years, we welcome sharing an understanding of this land and the wider Barossa with you.
transit: Car is best, push bikes/scooters can be hired in Angaston, cellar door hop on/hop off bus available in the within the Barossa. Loan car available for fly in pilots (prior notice req'd)
access: Enhance your stay by cooking yourself a paddock to plate meal. We produce a range of seasonally available produce including: our premium wine, ethically grown lamb and free range eggs, chutneys/preserves. Pre order is essential (7 days before check in) Also a great experience is to visit the Barossa Farmers market (10 minute drive) to collect a range of local produce. Every Saturday 7:30am til 11am, but get in early! Hutton Vale Farm Produce currently available: Eggs $5 per doz Lamb Leg Roast (bone in) $14.50/kg (approx. 2-3kg) Lamb Leg Easy Carve $16.99/kg (approx. 2 - 2.5kg) Butterfly Leg $16.50/kg (approx. 2 kg) Lamb Racks $29.00/kg  Slow Roast Shoulder $11.99/kg (approx 2.5 - 4kg) Chutneys $10 each Website, contact details for food orders:  (Website hidden by Airbnb)
interaction: We will greet you on arrival to familiarise you with the accommodation and the farm.
house_rules: - Events/Dinner parties are ok for the guests staying on farm only (no additional persons without prior agreement)

name: Discovery Holiday Parks
summary: Luxury Executive accommodation nestled in the heart of the Barossa Valley. These ultra modern three bedroom villas have all the comforts of home plus more. Ideal for couples or families sleeping up to 6 guests.
space: There are very few wine lovers who have not sampled a drop from the Barossa Valley. Australia's best-known wine region and South Australia's most visited tourist destination is also the home of Discovery Parks - Barossa Valley. Our caravan park is just a few minutes from the centre of Tanunda, a great place to begin your tour. Explore the vine-covered plains and hills that surround charming townships and Lutheran churches, with their distinctive square spires dotting the rural landscape. Or, enjoy our new splashtacular waterpark! 3 slides, gigantic tipping bucket and more splash zones than we can count = fun for the whole family. With so many wineries, historic buildings, museums, scenic tours, bush walks, art galleries, amazing dining experiences and fantastic park facilities, you won’t want to waste a moment.

Our caravan park is just a few minutes from the centre of Tanunda, a great place to begin your tour. With so many wineries, historic buildings, museums, scenic tours, bush walks, art galleries, amazing dining experiences and fantastic park facilities,
neighborhood_overview: As noted by Barossa on line; There’s something very special about the Barossa. You can feel it in the landscape, in the people, the food and the wine. It’s a beautiful region, with villages, vineyards and farms dotting a patchwork vista. Barossans are famous for their generous hospitality, their love of a shared table and their passion for local food and wine. Festivals, celebrations, markets and music thrive here. Barossa is life’s great pleasures, in one unique place.
transit: Located just over an hours drive from Adelaide Airport, the option to self drive or book a tour is yours.
access: Guest will have access to use an activity room, bouncing pillow, playground, resort style pool and water park located in the Discovery Parks Barossa Valley.

name: Beds on Bridge Street
summary: Lovely, renovated cottage boasting open plan living area which is flooded with natural light. 3 spacious bedrooms - 2 with queen sized beds and 1 with single bed.  Modern & clean bathroom. The cottage is within walking distance to Tanunda’s main street and cafes/restaurants. Well equipped with quality linen and furniture.  Continental breakfast provided. High chair and cot available by request. Beautiful gardens in a central Barossa location. Complementary guest wifi.
space: Art work on display from a talented local Artist.

Modern & clean bathroom. The cottage is within walking distance to Tanunda’s main street and cafes/restaurants. Well equipped with quality linen and furniture.  Continental breakfast provided. High chair and cot available by request. Beautiful gardens in a central Barossa location. Complementary guest wifi. Art work on display from a talented local Artist. Our B&B has a BBQ and outdoor sink as well as a wooden outdoor dining table with bench seats. Enjoy the lush lawns in the front and rear of the property. The backyard is fully fenced. I’m available during your stay if needed. I can be contacted via email, phone and text.

name: Fernweh Guesthouse Bethany Room w/buffet breakfast
summary: An amazing location right in Tanunda. Walk to FermentAsian and 1918 restaurants (300m). A hosted guesthouse with exceptional full breakfast. A solid brass queen sized bed and an ensuite with underfloor heating, air-conditioner and table and chairs. Shared Formal Lounge and Dining Rooms with a wood fire heater, mahogany furniture, television and free wifi and parking. Electric bikes and our day tour available. Wine and nibbles on arrival. A professionally operated Guesthouse.
space: Breakfast is included which comprises an outstanding cooked breakfast from our menu, self serve cereals, fruits, bakery and dairy options and a great range of prepared tea and coffee.  Enjoy the convenience of the shared kitchenette,which includes a fridge, microwave, washing machine, iron and ironing board.   The formal garden and BBQ facitilities are available. We also have two other rooms available for guests - Langmeil Room (amazing king size bed with double spa) and Tanunda Room (elegant and romantic) It is possible to book all three Fernweh Guesthouse rooms. Contact us for discounted rates.

transit: You don't need to worry about transport. You can walk, hire a bike or book a day tour with us. We also can arrange a pickup and drop off in Adelaide / Adelaide Airport.
access: Apart from your bedroom and ensuite with underfloor heating (fully secure and lockable), you have access to the kitchenette, formal lounge room and dining room (full breakfast included) and the formal garden and BBQ areas.

house_rules: BREAKFAST Breakfast is an important part of your stay with us. Please fill in your Breakfast Menu and leave it on the Reception Desk near the telephone by 7.00pm or on arrival if later.   On arrival you will have a cheese platter in the fridge for you to collect at your convenience. Check on your labelled shelf.  For your safety and comfort and for the safety and comfort of others: SMOKING IS NOT PERMITTED IN ANY ROOM OR ON THE GROUNDS. A smoking fee of $500 will be charged for cleaning curtains, floor coverings and bedding. Any damage caused by cigarettes will be charged for replacement or repair. The air conditioner only takes a few minutes to warm / cool a room. Fire

Our registered private day tours and electric bike hire allows guests to have some excellent experiences with us.

name: Martinsell Manor
summary: Private accommodation, self-contained in the downstairs section of this grand Manor. The main entrance provides  access leading into your spacious lounge and dining area. Martinsell Manor, a historical, stately, stone building is set on 77 acres in beautiful surroundings within the picturesque Barossa region.  The impressive guest suites have recently been renovated and include high ceilings, quality Georgian and Chippendale furniture, and Persian carpets on polished floorboards.
space: A magnificent piece of South Australian history, this turn of the century home has played host to some prominent Australian and international aristocrats, politicians and business people. The grand rooms and opulent architecture give glimpses of a bygone era. Adelaide's Ashburton Design has seamlessly blended the old world charm with his colours and furnishings, to make a beautiful and elegant environment. The private accommodation is rented as a whole area. A getaway for yourself, your partner, friends or family. ***VERY IMPORTANT*** Even though it is listed as an "entire place" please know that the entire downstairs of the manor is for the guests use, while the upstairs of the manor is private. For more details you're welcome to contact the host at anytime.
description: Private accommodation, self-contained in the downstairs section of this grand Manor. The main entrance provides  access leading into your spacious lounge and dining area. Martinsell Manor, a historical, stately, stone building is set on 77 acres in beautiful surroundings within the picturesque Barossa region.  The impressive guest suites have recently been renovated and include high ceilings, quality Georgian and Chippendale furniture, and Persian carpets on polished floorboards. A magnificent piece of South Australian history, this turn of the century home has played host to some prominent Australian and international aristocrats, politicians and business people. The grand rooms and opulent architecture give glimpses of a bygone era. Adelaide's Ashburton Design has seamlessly blended the old world charm with his colours and furnishings, to make a beautiful and elegant environment. The private accommodation is rented as a whole area. A getaway for yourself, your partner, friends or fam
notes: Martinsell is approximately one hour drive from Adelaide, and 8km from Williamstown, off the Springton Road. There is a general store, hotel and bakery in Williamstown - your last port of call for any provisions. The nearest large supermarket is about 20 minutes' drive. There is a small kitchenette with a ceramic hotplate, microwave, kettle, toaster and fridge for the provided breakfast and the preparation of light meals.  Shower in our soft  rainwater provided to the Manor, whilst  the outside water is supplied from our spring. ***VERY IMPORTANT*** Even though it is listed as an "entire place" please know that the entire downstairs of the manor is for the guests use, while the upstairs of the manor is private. For more details you're welcome to contact the host at anytime.
transit: Transport in the area is limited to private taxis or your own vehicle. A professional helicopter service is available direct from the property. Discover famous Barossa restaurants and wineries or enjoy a gorgeous scenic flight.
access: Guests have access to the rose gardens, sweeping lawns and nature walks among majestic old English trees and ancient Australian red gums as well as a 25 metre swimming pool. The property is set on farmland and grapevines surrounded by rolling hills and walking trails.
house_rules: - No shoes in the house (slippers provided)
host_about: We are a  retired couple who really enjoy living in the countryside, renovating historical buildings, gardening and hobby farming. Having hosted bed and breakfasts for many years, we enjoy meeting guests from all over the world and providing information on the Barossa area and beyond.

name: Linfield Cottage
summary: Linfield Cottage is a beautifully restored 1900 Federation Home on the edge of the Barossa and the Adelaide Hills. Fully equipped and situated on our stunning 19 hectares of vineyard from which we produce our own wines, it's the perfect base to explore the hundreds of wineries within both regions, or the plethora of scenic walking tracks. When you've finished sightseeing, relax on the property and enjoy the stunning views, soak in the spa and sip on our hand-crafted, single vineyard wines.
description: Linfield Cottage is a beautifully restored 1900 Federation Home on the edge of the Barossa and the Adelaide Hills. Fully equipped and situated on our stunning 19 hectares of vineyard from which we produce our own wines, it's the perfect base to explore the hundreds of wineries within both regions, or the plethora of scenic walking tracks. When you've finished sightseeing, relax on the property and enjoy the stunning views, soak in the spa and sip on our hand-crafted, single vineyard wines. You'll have access to the entire cottage, terrace, and the garden parking area. Guests are more than welcome to visit our Cellar Door, located next door. The cottage is situated on the family property, 19 hectares of Linfield Road Wines Vineyard. We're just half a kilometre up the road should you need anything. Linfield is in a regional area without public transport. A car is essential. We can highly recommend a tour for you to enjoy a day of wine tasting without driving. The cottage is situated next
neighborhood_overview: The cottage is situated on the family property, 19 hectares of Linfield Road Wines Vineyard. We're just half a kilometre up the road should you need anything.
notes: The cottage is situated next to our Cellar Door, which is open Thursday - Sunday. With a separate entrance and plenty of seclusion, you are sure to have a private getaway. The property is a working vineyard, not fenced and with several dams and waterways.
transit: Linfield is in a regional area without public transport. A car is essential. We can highly recommend a tour for you to enjoy a day of wine tasting without driving.
access: You'll have access to the entire cottage, terrace, and the garden parking area. Guests are more than welcome to visit our Cellar Door, located next door.
house_rules: - Smoking allowed outside in designated areas only. - Children welcome, however property is a working vineyard and is not fenced.
host_about:
We live and work on our beautiful vineyard property. We love cooking and enjoying a bottle of our wine overlooking the property. 
Travelling is always on the list of things to do when we have downtime. 
Reading is a great passion in our family and our choices wide and varied.

name: WHISTLER VINEYARD RETREAT
summary: Set on 80acres in the heart of the Barossa Valley this private, self-contained guest wing is surrounded by vineyard and gardens. Our retreat gets you back to nature... with vineyard and scrub walks, (accompanied by at least one of our Border Collies), friendly geese, an inquisitive free-roaming peacock, hens, rescued & wild kangaroos, the occasional Koala and a myriad of birdlife. Take in the views from the verandas, sit by the campfire (during the cooler months) or relax in the hammock.
space: Our home was designed by us and built in 2002 on a hill overlooking our vineyards. A purpose-built, private two bedroom guest wing with separate entrance, offers fully self-contained accommodation for up to 4 guests. The second bedroom can be configured as a king bed or two singles. Features include a full kitchen with bar fridge and a large open space living area with floor to ceiling windows to capture the views. The living area and both bedrooms have large windows and glass doors opening out on to the verandahs. The bathroom has a separate shower and deep bath with wonderful vineyard views. There is under-floor heating throughout for the colder months, reverse cycle air-conditioning, free WiFi and a Weber BBQ.

The living area and both bedrooms have large windows and glass doors opening out on to t
neighborhood_overview: Our Retreat is on the most scenic road in the Barossa with 15 wineries to discover, including the historic Seppeltsfield Winery. We have world-class restaurants within a 5 minute drive - Appellation, Fino and Hentley Farm. Our neighbours are the famous Maggie Beer Farmshop and Eatery. The work of top SA artists can be seen at the JamFactory gallery and artisan workshops. Other coffee shops, galleries and excellent shopping can be found at the 3 main towns, all within 5km from our home. The first stage of the new Seppeltsfield Road  shared path trail runs through our property. The Barossa also has other bike trails.
notes: As we have free-range hens, we will provide fresh eggs daily if needed. On your arrival the kitchen will be well-stocked with necessary condiments including home-made jam, sauce, biscuits and savouries, as well as tea, coffee and milk. We have a choice of excellent nearby supermarkets and our weekly Barossa Farmers' Market where you can buy supplies. And of course there will be a complimentary bottle of Whistler Wine! Guests will also be able to purchase our family wines from the Cellar Door with a special discount of 20% while enjoying a free wine tasting experience.
transit: Many attractions are within walking or bike-riding distance while there are two taxi companies operating within the Barossa as well as many reputable tour companies.
access: Guests have use of their own outside verandahs and garden furniture including a hammock, their own fire-pit and are welcome to walk around the property. We also have two bikes for guests to use. We have a book exchange and board games.
interaction: As we live in the other wing of the house we will be here to greet guests on arrival, and help with any advice or touring suggestions, while respecting your privacy.
house_rules: - Check-out time is 10am.
host_about: I'm a born and bred, proud Barossan. Married to Martin for 44 years we have 3 adult children and 5 grandchildren. 30 years of teaching has kept me young at heart. I love meeting people while working at our cellar door and I'm very involved in the local community. I'm known as 'the Green Queen', somewhat obsessed with  recycling and caring for the environment. I'm an animal and nature-lover, loving life on our beautiful property and happy to share it with others.

name: Queen's Cottage Barossa Valley
summary: Queen’s Cottage is a luxurious and lovingly restored, fully equipped 1800’s French Country Themed Stone Cottage, located in the heart of Williamstown in the Barossa Valley, South Australia. It is available for your complete and private reservation, sleeping up to 6 people (1 King Bedroom and 2 Queen Bedrooms) with no other guests or hosts onsite.
space: Be pampered with fine linens, generous gourmet Barossa Valley and Adelaide Hills breakfast provisions, homemade afternoon tea, a welcome local wine and cheese platter and some extra special treats while you relax and unwind in front of the log fire on those fresh Barossa nights or keep cool in the air conditioning after a warm day out. We are a short walk to local Cellar Doors, Bakery, Café, Country Pubs and General Store. Mt Crawford Forest and Warren Reservoir are only a couple of minutes drive from Queen’s Cottage. You can hike, mountain bike, see wildlife, picnic and fish. This is the perfect place to explore all the Barossa Valley has to offer and we are also only 15kms to the Adelaide Hills Region.

transit: It is best to hire a car if flying into Adelaide.  There are a lot of other options, I am happy to help organise tours and give information.

name: KINGSFORD HOMESTEAD - Luxury Accommodation
summary: Kingsford Homestead is a luxury accommodation property set on 225 acres of land in the Barossa Valley, exuding style and elegance, yet maintaining its rural charm. Once the home to a wealthy nineteenth-century pastoralist and later the film set for Australia's McLeod's Daughters - Kingsford Homestead offers the perfect retreat for you to indulge, discover, relax...and get lost in time. Ideal for weddings, family reunions, group getaways, birthdays, special occasions and corporate retreats.
space: The Homestead itself boasts 5 upstairs bedrooms (The Mincalta, John Angas, Stephen King, Kerry Packer & Frederick Scarfe suites) & 1 downstairs bedroom (The Ahrens suite) with disabled access. 2 rollaway beds can be set up  in the larger suites for additional guests. Each bedroom has it's own ensuite with luxurious amenities.  Downstairs in the homestead are the Fotheringham Library with books, magazines & board games for your enjoyment, the ambient Dining Room, the Lounge fully stocked with a selection of premium beverages, a downstairs toilet & commercial kitchen. Beyond downstairs is the historical Cellar & Executive Wine Cellar with a selection of back vintage and museum wines available for purchase. Just nestled next to the historic Homestead sits our 7th suite, The Stonemasons Cottage. A quaint hideaway with its own private courtyard area, lounge room and spacious ensuite complete with a spa and double shower.  Set on the Easterly side of the Homestead is the opulent solar-heated

Once the home to a wealthy nineteenth-century pastoralist and later the film set for Australia's McLeod's Daughters - Kingsford Homestead offers the perfect retreat for you to indulge, discover, relax...and get lost in time. Downstairs in the homestead are the Fotheringham Library with books, magazines & board games for your enjoyment, the ambient Dining Room, the Lounge fully stocked with a select
neighborhood_overview: Kingsford Homestead is a 225 acre property set on the edge of the Barossa Valley. Only a 15 minute drive into the heart of the Barossa Valley, it still feels as though you are a million miles away. One of Kingsford's main appeals is the complete serenity and privacy it offers. Hidden away, but easy to find.  If you do feel like getting out and about, the Barossa Valley is a world renowned food and wine region offering a plethora of experiences and activites from wine tasting & cooking classes to bicycle trails, artisans producers, hot air ballooning, helicopter rides, segway through the vines, and more.   There’s something very special about the Barossa. You can feel it in the landscape, in the people, the food and the wine. It’s a beautiful region, with villages, vineyards and farms dotting a patchwork vista. notes: Our base accommodation rate includes exclusive use of the property and luxury accommodation for up to 14 guests. Two rollaway beds and one sofa bed are available  for up to an additional 3 guests at an extra cost of $150 per person per night. Children of any age are most welcome on the property. You may bring your own cots or bedding for the children, or alternatively we can arrange for bedding for them at an additional cost. Daily housekeeping is also included.  Our base rate includes a country continental breakfast in the mornings including Nespresso coffee, tea, orange juice, toast with an assortment of spreads, cereals, fresh fruit, yoghurt and pastries. Any dietary requirements are catered for so long as you advise your host of them prior to arrival.  Alternatively, Kingsford Homestead offer an "all-inclusive package" option. For an additional $200 per adult per night, you will receive: a fully cooked breakfast in addition to continental; a 3 course dinner & canapés; all in house
transit: Kingsford Homestead is just under an hour drive North from Adelaide Airport. The best way to get around is to car your own vehicle from the airport so that you have the freedom of exploring the region at your leisure. Alternatively we would be happy to arrange transfers on your behalf. There is also helicopter access on the property, for those that prefer complete privacy.
access: Guests have complete access to the Homestead & 225 acre property!
interaction: At Kingsford Homestead, you are fully hosted throughout your stay. Our Property Managers, Cassie & Kyran Gardner, live in a separate house on site and are here to host you & assist with anything you need such as in house massage treatments, catering, tours of the property, a ride in the all-terrain vehicles, offsite wine tours, experiences, reservations, and more.  At Kingsford Homestead, our home is your home.
house_rules: - The only guests permitted access to the property are accommodation guests. Permission for any additional guests on site for a dining experience or event must be approved by the Property Managers in advance.  - Pets on site  are subject to the approval of the Property Managers.  - All buildings at Kingsford Homestead are strictly non-smoking. Outside areas are allocated for smoking.  - Any dietary requirements or medical conditions to be advised at least 7 days prior to arrival to ensure we can accommodate your needs.  - Any damage, breakages or additional cleaning required will be on-charged to the responsible person.

name: TANUNDA HOUSE - Luxury Accommodation
summary: Tanunda House sits on one acre of stunning grounds in the heart of the iconic Barossa Valley.  An exclusive and private executive retreat offering supreme comfort for up to 10 guests. Luxury facilities include the ultimate outdoor entertaining area complete with a Teppanyaki grill, flat screen TV, fireplace and sound system, solar-heated swimming pool, tennis court & cinema room. Originally built in 1910 and stylishly renovated with modern comforts, Tanunda House is truly idyllic in every way.
description: Tanunda House sits on one acre of stunning grounds in the heart of the iconic Barossa Valley.  An exclusive and private executive retreat offering supreme comfort for up to 10 guests. Luxury facilities include the ultimate outdoor entertaining area complete with a Teppanyaki grill, flat screen TV, fireplace and sound system, solar-heated swimming pool, tennis court & cinema room. Originally built in 1910 and stylishly renovated with modern comforts, Tanunda House is truly idyllic in every way. We will "meet and greet" you on site to welcome you to the property, give you a tour/induction and show you the relevant appliance and equipment  instructions and procedures. Then we leave you to enjoy your stay! That said, we are only over a phone call away. Tanunda House is situated one street back from the main street of Tanunda, the heart of the Barossa. A variety of cafes, restaurants, shopping and history, are only steps away.  The Barossa Valley is a world renowned food and wine region off
neighborhood_overview: Tanunda House is situated one street back from the main street of Tanunda, the heart of the Barossa. A variety of cafes, restaurants, shopping and history, are only steps away.  The Barossa Valley is a world renowned food and wine region offering a plethora of experiences and activites from wine tasting & cooking classes to bicycle trails, artisans producers, hot air ballooning, helicopter rides, segway through the vines, and more. There’s something very special about the Barossa. You can feel it in the landscape, in the people, the food and the wine. It’s a beautiful region, with villages, vineyards and farms dotting a patchwork vista. Barossans are famous for their generous hospitality, their love of a shared table and their passion for local food and wine. Festivals, celebrations, markets and music thrive here. Barossa is life’s great pleasures, in one unique place.
transit: The best methods of transport in the Barossa Valley are to self-drive, arrange for a taxi or transfer vehicles for your stay (which we can assist you with) or cycle! The Barossa Bike Hub is a 6 minute walk from Tanunda House and an excellent way to enjoy the valley and its beautiful scenery.
interaction: We will "meet and greet" you on site to welcome you to the property, give you a tour/induction and show you the relevant appliance and equipment  instructions and procedures. Then we leave you to enjoy your stay! That said, we are only over a phone call away.
house_rules: - Pets on the property is subject to the approval  of the Property Managers.  - Additional guests on the property is subject to the approval of the Property Managers. - All 5 beds will be made as king beds for your arrival, unless requested otherwise. 3 king beds can be split into twin singles. Please provide at least 7 days notice for a change of bed configurations. Insufficient notice may result in additional housekeeping fees.  - As Tanunda House is located in a residential area we ask that you be mindful of our neighbours and keep excessive noise to a minimum.  - No guest parking on Maria Street. Please park in the cobblestone driveway, or alternatively there is a rear car park with access off Albert Street. - We encourage our guests to practice responsible consumption of alcohol.  - Tanunda House is self-contained accommodation; however, we supply continental breakfast provisions upon check in for your convenience including Nespresso coffee, tea, bread, spreads for toast, cereals,

name: Kulkawirra Vineyard Studio
summary: Kulkawirra Vineyard Studio is nestled in the delightful village of Krondorf. Strolling distance to wineries, vineyards and views. Our self contained studio is simply appointed and offers one queen size bedroom, private bathroom, private entrance and kitchenette.  We encourage you to take in local markets for your favourite produce, as only limited pantry items are supplied.  Upstairs enjoy vineyard views from the open plan, lounge/dining room. Enjoy glorious sunsets with outdoor seating.
space: Join your hosts, Marty & Bruce & whippets Tom & Jerry for a glass of wine.  We'd be delighted to suggest an itinerary for your stay in the Barossa.

name: 701 Seppeltsfield Road
summary: A century old stone cottage in the heart of Seppeltsfield. Modern interior, private and self contained for up to two couples with luxurious, spacious bedrooms and bathrooms. Close proximity to the western Barossa's wine, food and arts; plus the awarded restaurants of Appellation, Hentley Farm and Fino. Situated ~10 minutes drive from the main Barossa towns of Tanunda and Nuriootpa and 5 minutes from Greenock. ~60 minutes drive from Adelaide Airport
space: A place to enjoy year round. One and a half acres - a house garden with vegetables and herbs. Frog ponds and shady sitting spots for relaxing and contemplating.  An orchard with heritage fruits and free range chickens laying your eggs.  All produced organically.  In cooler weather revel in the sauna followed by a bracing outdoor shower!  A environmentally friendly home with Green power, LED lighting, solar power and filtered rainwater.   Guests often comment their regret at not booking a longer stay to relish all the delights of 701. Fantastically effective Norwegian wood combustion heaters ducted through bedrooms in winter.

transit: Public transport available in the nearby towns of Nuriootpa and Tanunda.  Bicycles for hire a five minute walk away at Seppeltsfield Wines.

interaction: When staying at 701 for two or more nights a complimentary collect and return for one dinner outing in the Barossa Valley by host.

name: The Entertainer in the hub of Barossa!

Hop on, hop off bus stop within 1 minute walk that can take you to the Barossa’s popular wineries. Barossa's finest restuarants located within a short walk.

name: Archery Road Estate - vineyards with great views
summary: Tucked away in a vineyard setting with amazing views of the Barossa Ranges, your wine estate is in a perfect setting. With four bedrooms and two lounge areas plus two bathrooms and a well equipped kitchen you have it all. The spacious decking overlooks expansive gardens - this is great wine country lodging. Wander the trails to the River. There's even a Tennis Court so bring your racquets! Depending on the season, you may find Matt working in the vineyards or paddocks adjoining the house.
description: Tucked away in a vineyard setting with amazing views of the Barossa Ranges, your wine estate is in a perfect setting. Wander the trails to the River. There's even a Tennis Court so bring your racquets! Depending on the season, you may find Matt working in the vineyards or paddocks adjoining the house. Archery Road Estate is a working vineyard farm. There are sheds - please don't go into them. There are vineyards - again please stay out of them.  Matt may be using farm equipment - stay well clear Matt and Lisa live nearby. They don't normally get to spend a lot of time with guests. If you see Matt working in the vines or paddocks, give him a wave! If he has time he will come for a chat. But remember that he is working and there are often tight time frames to get jobs done You are in one of the most
neighborhood_overview: You are in one of the most picturesque spots in the Barossa. Make the most of the walking trails down to the North Para River
notes: Archery Road Estate is part of the Cottages4u group. Cottages4u is a group of long standing BnB cottage operators who have a proven track record in the local industry.  Established in 1997, the group understand what our guests are looking for and provide the best value for money, with an emphasis on Cleanliness, Quality and Facilities.  You can trust these establishments to provide the best local experience.
transit: We suggest that you take a chauffeured tour of the Barossa. Barossa Taste Sensations run by Jonathan is fantastic. Give him a call.
access: Archery Road Estate is a working vineyard farm. There are sheds - please don't go into them. There are vineyards - again please stay out of them.  Matt may be using farm equipment - stay well clear
interaction: Matt and Lisa live nearby. They don't normally get to spend a lot of time with guests. If you see Matt working in the vines or paddocks, give him a wave! If he has time he will come for a chat. But remember that he is working and there are often tight time frames to get jobs done
host_about:
Kim (together with his wife Malinda) founded the first cooperative of BnB cottage operators in the Barossa Valley back in 1997. While there are about 60 operators working with them through The Booking Service, a select few form the cottages4u collective. These are properties where the owners take a "back seat" role and Kim and Malinda, together with very capable local managers, present some of the best value Barossa and Burra accommodation.
Kim and Malinda have over 25 years experience in the BnB industry. They have lived 25 years and more in the Barossa and have strong connections in Burra (Malinda's Great Great Great Grandfather arrived there in the 1850's and Kim was Chair of the National Trust Branch for 3 years)
Now our two sons have grown up, had a good education and achieved great jobs, we love to travel ourselves and spend a lot of time in Asia - Viet Nam is our favourite!

name: Little Florence
summary: Enjoy the peace and quiet of our home, set on a natural 3 acre property at the edge of town. Switch off, listen to the birds, watch the beautiful sunsets and breathe in the fresh air. With the Barossa just being 15 minutes away and the city of Adelaide about an hour, this retreat gives you the best of both. Note: Council just recently changed our number to 32 Klemm Road and we have added a sign saying 32 on the driveway with the "LOT 2" sign. Screenshot of the map location has been added.
description: Enjoy the peace and quiet of our home, set on a natural 3 acre property at the edge of town. Switch off, listen to the birds, watch the beautiful sunsets and breathe in the fresh air. With the Barossa just being 15 minutes away and the city of Adelaide about an hour, this retreat gives you the best of both. Note: Council just recently changed our number to 32 Klemm Road and we have added a sign saying 32 on the driveway with the "LOT 2" sign. Screenshot of the map location has been added. Guests have their own room and their own dedicated toilet and bathroom (not ensuite). You are welcome to share public spaces such as the living room and the kitchen. Me and my partner Torsten are around and can assist you with guest-related queries whenever you need us. We also have a cat named Florence who is very shy but friendly and playful. Kapunda is a small country town with some sights and shops to visit. Located at the edge of the Barossa Valley in South Australia, a well known wine region, it
neighborhood_overview: Kapunda is a small country town with some sights and shops to visit. Located at the edge of the Barossa Valley in South Australia, a well known wine region, it's just a short and picturesque drive to the townships of Greenock, Nuriootpa, Tanunda and Angaston, the hubs of the region with lots of things to do and see. There are many beautifully located historical wineries that are well worth to get explored. Kapunda has got a very good connection to Adelaide and the Adelaide Hills in the south which takes you about an hour to reach and it's a short and  beautiful one hour drive to the Clare Valley in the north west, another stunning wine region in this region.
notes: We offer breakfast which includes our homemade sourdough bread and fresh eggs of our free range chickens for $15, and dinner for $20. Reservations required.
transit: You would need a car to get to and from the property and around the beautiful Barossa region.
access: Guests have their own room and their own dedicated toilet and bathroom (not ensuite). You are welcome to share public spaces such as the living room and the kitchen.
interaction: Me and my partner Torsten are around and can assist you with guest-related queries whenever you need us. We also have a cat named Florence who is very shy but friendly and playful.
house_rules: - Smoking outside only, no shoes inside the house
host_about: Hi! I'm Neil. After years in the vibrant but sometimes toxic city of Sydney, we have decided to move out to Barossa area of South Australia for some much-needed R&R. We ended up in this massive 3-acre property and thought it would be nice to share our peace and quiet to those in need via AirBnB.

name: Barossa Valley Escape
summary: Self contained cottage located on private grounds in Lyndoch, the start of the Barossa Valley. The cottage is private and yours to enjoy exclusively. It features 2 bedrooms, 1 with a queen bed, the other a single. A modern bathroom and spacious open plan lounge/dine open to a deck where you can relax and enjoy the surrounds. The cottage can comfortably host up to 3 guests and is ideally suited to a couple or a small group or family. Only a short drive to numerous wineries and local attractions.
space: A private cottage situated among peaceful surrounds with all essential amenities situated in close proximity to world famous wineries, towns and attractions of the Barossa Valley.  Clean and comfortable with reverse cycle air conditioning, essential kitchen amenities, modern bathroom and an enjoyable deck area to relax.
description: Self contained cottage located on private grounds in Lyndoch, the start of the Barossa Valley. The cottage is private and yours to enjoy exclusively. It features 2 bedrooms, 1 with a queen bed, the other a single. A modern bathroom and spacious open plan lounge/dine open to a deck where you can relax and enjoy the surrounds. The cottage can comfortably host up to 3 guests and is ideally suited to a couple or a small group or family. Only a short drive to numerous wineries and local attractions. Entire Cottage The cottage is self contained and provides guests with their own privacy. Lyndoch is located at the start of the Barossa Valley and features numerous wineries and
neighborhood_overview: Lyndoch is located at the start of the Barossa Valley and features numerous wineries and local attractions. Lyndoch township features a few small shops including Hotel, Bakery, Cafe and Restaurant. The nearby towns of Tanunda, Nuriootpa and Angaston are only a short drive away featuring stunning scenery of the Barossa along the way. World famous wineries such as Penfolds, Rockfords and Grant Burge are approx 10 minute drive from Lyndoch. The Barossa Bike trail also comes through Lyndoch and the Whispering Wall is also nearby. Guests are welcome to request a suggested list of places/wineries to visit at the time of booking.
transit: Most of the Barossa Valley is best explored by car as it is quite vast (and you need room to put all the boxes of wine you bought!). Lyndoch is located at the start of the Barossa Valley and is itself home to some great wineries.  Tanunda is approx 15 min drive and you will pass many well known vineyards along the way. The roads are easily driven and well sign posted. Gawler is an outer suburb of Adelaide and is only a 15 minute drive from Lyndoch. For those on longer stays and wishing to take a trip to the City, the metro train service operates from Gawler to the City of Adelaide on a regular basis. You can drive from Lyndoch to Gawler in around 15 minutes and park your car at the station. A taxi service also operates in the Barossa Valley.
access: Entire Cottage
interaction: The cottage is self contained and provides guests with their own privacy.
host_about: Hi everyone.  I am passionate about food and wine and promoting the Barossa region and look forward to having you stay as a guest. As an extensive traveller myself, I understand the importance of what's required when it comes to accommodation and the little things that can make a difference.  I hope you will enjoy the region and wineries as much as I do and look forward to hosting you as a guest soon.

name: Barossa's Pine Vale Cottage
summary: Nestled between forest & vineyards Barossa's Pine Vale cottage is the ultimate destination for your next retreat, getaway.   We offer our guests unique opportunities to get up close and personal with the local wildlife or participate in  a myriad of activities  on its doorstep.  You can visit the wineries, take beautiful walks through the nearby forests or just have a relaxing time sipping on a wine and looking over the picture-perfect scenery that is right on your door step.
space: **Price includes a breakfast hamper with enough provisions for a full English breakfast the first morning of your stay and a selection of cereals for the remainder*** Barossa’s Pine Vale Cottage in the Barossa Valley offers its guests unique opportunities with a myriad of activities on its doorstep you can visit the wineries, take beautiful walks through the nearby forests or just have a relaxing time sipping on a wine and looking over the picture-perfect scenery that is right on your door step.   Just a short 2-minute drive or leisurely 8-minute walk from the cottage takes you to the main street of Williamstown which offers 2 hotels, Winery outlets, bakery, a general store and much more,  Or you can take a short scenic drive and find yourself in the heart of the Barossa wine district.   Our Wineries are diverse and world famous with their friendly welcoming staff who offer visitors the opportunity to sample and purchase from their selection of excellent Wines. name: Ambrosia Holiday Home 5 bedrooms 2 1/2 bathrooms
summary: Stunning 1920s bungalow located in Tanunda with beautiful gardens, 5 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms and swimming pool. Few doors from main street, short & relaxing walk to shops, cafes & restaurants that this beautiful town has on offer. The large rooms, high ceilings & the beautiful leadlight glass in the windows and doors.  The new kitchen provides a practical work area, with ample bench space for preparation of a feast, along with intimate window seating to sit and chat over a coffee or glass of wine.
space: Wonderful diversity of this property with main setup of bedding being 4 kings and 2 singles, but all beds can be changed to offer single bedding at an additional charge. Offers 2 bathrooms and 1 additional separate toilet, 1 bathroom has a claw bath, and the 2nd bathroom has a shower over a bath. Upon entering the home be prepared to have your breath taken away. Drawing you in to the home with the warmth of the polished floor boards, the original patterned panels to the walls and the feature timber entrance panel befitting of a quality home of this era.  There are many special features here, from the nickel taps, to the custom made Butlers sink shipped in from England, to the cabinetry with wire mesh frontage to tie in the old with new. The modern stainless steel appliances including the 900mm freestanding oven and the dishwasher make entertaining easy. Outdoor living is a delight here with shady nooks throughout the pretty gardens, small lawned areas, and plenty of hiding spots for th
