name: Tranquility Retreat bnb Barossa Valley
summary: Set on a rural property just minutes drive to the 80 cellar doors and everything the Barossa Valley has to offer while less than an hour from Adelaide, Hahndorf, the Murray River and Clare. Tranquility Retreat is ECO friendly and was built as a destination in itself, with comfortable beds, attention to detail, areas for relaxation, sweeping views and WIFI. There are many restaurants in the area, however with a BBQ and fully equipped kitchen and larder you may prefer to cook for yourself.
space: Two storey self-contained house, purpose built in 2011 as a bed and breakfast with provisions for cooked breakfast and welcome bottle of Barossa wine. Solely on rainwater with recycled water for the garden. All products are supplied for cleaning, washing and other uses and are ECO compliant.
description: Set on a rural property just minutes drive to the 80 cellar doors and everything the Barossa Valley has to offer while less than an hour from Adelaide, Hahndorf, the Murray River and Clare. Tranquility Retreat is ECO friendly and was built as a destination in itself, with comfortable beds, attention to detail, areas for relaxation, sweeping views and WIFI. There are many restaurants in the area, however with a BBQ and fully equipped kitchen and larder you may prefer to cook for yourself. Two storey self-contained house, purpose built in 2011 as a bed and breakfast with provisions for cooked breakfast and welcome bottle of Barossa wine. Solely on rainwater with recycled water for the garden. All products are supplied for cleaning, washing and other uses and are ECO compliant. Tranquility Retreat is available for one group of between two to six and depending on how many guests booked the corresponding number of bedrooms will be unlocked. If booking is for two we assume they are a couple
neighborhood_overview: Set in McLeod's Daughters country with trees, birds, kangaroos, sheep and rolling farmland it is only a few minutes drive to the Gungellan Pub in Freeling which has a supermarket, butcher, takeaway, 2 pubs and a library. Close to the towns of Gawler, Kapunda (the home of Sir Sidney Kidman), Greenock and Seppeltsfield.
notes: Sign at driveway entrance will direct you to your accommodation. Multiple areas to relax with two lounges, upstairs deck and outside areas. All bedrooms have ceiling fans and blockout curtains. Bedroom 1 is on the ground floor the other two bedrooms upstairs.
transit: Motor vehicle as nearest town is 3 kms. Taxi's are available if needed.
access: Tranquility Retreat is available for one group of between two to six and depending on how many guests booked the corresponding number of bedrooms will be unlocked. If booking is for two we assume they are a couple and therefore requiring one bedroom. Keycard for entry to house.
interaction: Email will be sent with directions and we will welcome you on arrival to give you the keycard.
host_about: We enjoy living on the land with our trees, the birds and kangaroos and the fact that we are part of the beautiful Barossa Valley. Travel is something we love to do, seeing many beautiful places (Machu Picchu being my favorite) and meeting interesting people. Cruising has also taken us to various parts of the world including The Baltic, Mediterranean, Suez, Japan, Alaska, East Coast USA and Caribbean among those we have done. However there is no place like Australia and home and family.

name: Villa Maria Barossa Luxury Guesthouse
summary: Built in 1910, Villa Maria is an elegantly proportioned villa that has been tastefully refurbished with all modern conveniences. The villa offers three comfortable, luxurious rooms, each with ensuite. A fourth couple can be accommodated. Located in one of the truly historical precincts of Tanunda, the house is only metres from historic Goat Square, and a short stroll to the main street.
space: Built in 1910, Villa Maria is an elegantly proportioned villa that has been tastefully refurbished with all modern conveniences. Located in one of the truly historical precincts of Tanunda, the house is only metres from historic Goat Square, and a short stroll to the main street. Villa Maria is owned an operated by one of the Barossa’s favourite chefs, Tuoi Do, who together with husband Grant Dickson own and run fermentAsian restaurant.

name: The Tudor House
summary: One of Tanunda’s most admired homes, The Tudor House is centrally located in the heart of the township. Stylishly updated throughout, it retains many of the features of the era with sweeping veranda, high ornate ceilings, intricate leadlight windows, polished timber floors and joinery.  Ideal for a luxury couple's getaway, a group holiday for up to four couples or a family stay.  Private rear yard with pool. Walking distance to town centre, bakery, restaurants and sporting oval.
space: This is a hallmark location in a leafy street that is one of Tanunda's most sought after residential addresses. The Tudor House is designed for gracious living, but it also has many comforts that make it a welcoming family home. We hope you will enjoy your stay and will want to return again and again to our restful haven in the Barossa.
description: One of Tanunda’s most admired homes, The Tudor House is centrally located in the heart of the township. Stylishly updated throughout, it retains many of the features of the era with sweeping veranda, high ornate ceilings, intricate leadlight windows, polished timber floors and joinery.  Ideal for a luxury couple's getaway, a group holiday for up to four couples or a family stay.  Private rear yard with pool. Walking distance to town centre, bakery, restaurants and sporting oval. This is a hallmark location in a leafy street that is one of Tanunda's most sought after residential addresses. The Tudor House is designed for gracious living, but it also has many comforts that make it a welcoming family home. We hope you will enjoy your stay and will want to return again and again to our restful haven in the Barossa. The house is fully equipped with linen, bathroom amenities, kitchen crockery, cutley and appliances. The swimming pool and outdoor area is fabulous to use in summer, and in wint
neighborhood_overview: A wide, leafy street surrounded by other quality homes and great neighbours.
notes: Note that our 4th bedroom can be configured as 2 x Single beds or 1 x King bed. We do not supply breakfast provisions as we love the variety of cafes in town and encourage you to explore locally. We do provide a few cooking basics , tea, coffee, milk and treats. So many cafes and restaurants are in walking distance; this location is ideal.
transit: Walk, car or taxi.
access: The house is fully equipped with linen, bathroom amenities, kitchen crockery, cutley and appliances. The swimming pool and outdoor area is fabulous to use in summer, and in winter we supply wood to fuel the combustion fire.
interaction: Guest have sole use of the house. Managers are close by and accessible to assist if needed.
house_rules: We accept a maximum of 8 adults for this property.  Portacot and high chair available at no extra cost.
host_about: We feel very lucky to live and work in the Barossa and hope you will enjoy exploring our region during your stay! We like the rural feel where we live, with vineyards just over our back fence, but we are minutes to the centre of the township. We enjoy our wine and food and the opportunity to relax, so we understand that our guests might just like to be left to do their own thing and enjoy some time out. We like to take short impromptu getaways. Hubby loves his footy and horse-racing hence Foxtel in the cottage for people who may not want to miss a game while away. I enjoy gardening as being surrounded by a natural setting is important to me. If you want recommendations of where to dine out and what to do, we are happy to point you in directions that we have experienced and recommend! Careers in hospitality brought us to the Barossa in 1997... we're still here!

name: Deluxe Log Cabin
summary: Situated in the heart of Barossa Valley, Seppelts View Cabins is a country property offering 2 New Deluxe self contained Log cabins with views of the most historic palm line avenue in Seppeltsfield. Take time to relax and enjoy the tranquillity. The 8 acre property is home to another 6 self contained duplex refurbished cabins, nestled amongst beautiful gum trees and pine forest. Take a short walk to Seppeltsfield Winery where you will find cellar door,Fino restaurant, jam factory,knife maker.
space: Outside offers a toasty fire pit for guests to gather for a wine and toast marshmallows. Or Cook a stew with your favourite wine over the fire. (Seasonal only)

name: Barossa Dreams great location for up to 15
summary: Grand Victorian bluestone built in late 1890's as home and surgery of Dr Franz Juttner. Barossa Dreams offers 5 bedrooms, 3 bathrooms, kitchen, separate dining room, & lounge area. Complimentary Wi-Fi and onsite swimming pool. Your accommodation is walking distance to restaurants, shops and some wineries. Accommodating up to 15 people, amongst beautiful gardens. Perfect for that special occasion for couples or small groups. Why not book our wine touring services
space: Barossa Dreams has great flexibility offering 4 queen beds, 3 single beds and 2 double sofa beds as standard setup. 3 of the queen beds able to split into single beds (at additional cost) 3 bathrooms, separate dining room, lounge area and use of the swimming pool. Great location to walk out to dinner. The whole house can also offer another suite if available which can provide another bedroom (queen bed can split into 2 singles) and another bedroom and 2nd kitchen (chefs kitchen) and dining table.  Our wine touring business can specifically tailor a wonderful day out for your group, airport transfers and restaurant transfers.

summary: Welcome  Our B&B is located in The Beautiful Barossa & available for you to come and enjoy.  Our aim is to provide you with all  that you need with comforts of home for any length of stay.  The deck area is a beautiful place to relax with your morning coffee there is a under cover Bbq area where you can sit and enjoy a perfect wine that I’m sure you will find right here in the Barossa. shops, parks & cafes all within walking distance
space: Our home is great for all types form couples, girls weekend, anniversaries, or just that time out looking to relax and explore with the family

host_about:
Hi Friends

My name is Crystal i was born in Broken Hill Rural NSW before moving to Gawler in 2001. I have a huge passion for hospitality, having owned and managed several cafes in and around Gawler this has provided me with extensive experience on what people expect from a hospitality experience I strive to deliver that experience with excellence, quality and affordability. I absolutely love being a Air B&B host and meeting new people. 
We have three B&B’s one of which is at our home one in Lyndoch and the other also in Gawler. 

I have a belief in energy and how that is spread from one person to another this has lead me down a path of holistic health and well-being I run meditation classes, restorative and yin yoga classes, I am a reiki practitioner, forensic healer, Psych- k facilitator, massage therapist, NLP and Timeline Therapist, and a Hypnotherapist.

I look forward to meeting you some time 

Much gratitude Crystal

summary: Barossa Valley wine region

Ideal getaway for family holidays, romantic weekends with convenient location close to many Barossa attractions, wineries, gourmet dining etc. Log wood fire with generous wood supply provided in cosy lounge. TV, DVD and music for entertainment. Sleeps up to 6 guests - 3 bedrooms - two with queen beds and one with 2 single beds. Continental breakfast included in tariff with coffee and tea provisions. Local full breakfast produce provided on application (at cost of $15 per guest per day - required to order 7 days in advance of stay) . Complimentary wine and gourmet snacks, chocolates and port provided. Modern equipped kitchen, separate indoor dining room seating 6. Extra mattresses available, on request.  Porta-cot and high chair can be provided on request also. neighborhood_overview: The house is located in Tanunda, 200m walk from the Main Street. Tanunda is the tourist heart of the Barossa, boasting excellent cafes, restaurants, boutique shops, wineries and much more.
notes: Complimentary wine and local produce platter will be provided on arrival for stays of 2 nights or more. Continental breakfast provisions provided for first morning. Also included: Linen and towels Complimentary Wifi  TV/Netflix  Laundry facilities
transit: Tanunda is situated approx 70 minutes by car from the city of Adelaide. There is regional public transport services available, however, please note these are not as regular as in the city. Car hire is available from the airport and there is also a shuttle bus service that can be booked to do pick up from the airport. Bus services run twice daily to the city and there is a taxi service available in the Barossa also. The Barossa Tourism Centre, located in the Main Street, can help arrange tours around the Barossa.  The house has parking available for up to 4 cars plus street parking out front.
access: Host will meet you at the house with keys for your stay.  We can be contacted via email or phone between 7am and 8pm. Guests will have full access to the house, and outdoor area during their stay. Rooms not in use will be locked.
interaction: We live nearby so are able to accommodate your needs, as required. We can have minimal contact after arrival or are free to help with anything during your stay.

name: Barossa Valley,  The Barn
summary: Set on 5 acres, Pondicherri is a small acreage landholding with a cluster of small buildings and exudes a rustic village atmosphere.   Its borrowed rural amenity and views are enabled as it is surrounded by much larger farming land, creating a quiet private oasis yet you are close to everything within the  Barossa Valley.  Some of the buildings are of historic interest and date back to 1845.
space: The Barn is a single room building constructed with thick stone walls and exposed internal timber beams.  The building is aged well over 100 years.   We are not sure of its original use.   The Barn originally had the tiny window on the south side and one door many a year ago!   For those that do book,  look out for the circular patterns on the walls near the bed!   If only the walls could talk!!!    Today, the Barn  is furnished with a very comfortable super sized (mega) king bed - or can be separated into two king single beds - complete with natural fibre quality bed linens.    It has a smart TV with Netflix to watch your favourite movies while you cozy up in bed and/or access the NBN WIFI network for all your modern communication needs.   Or, should you need to work (and we hope you don’t),  you can set yourself up on the drop leaf table or maybe, just stay in bed!  A lounge, cane chair, wardrobe, ironing board/iron  and kitchenette (with toaster, fridge, microwave, kettle) ensures y
description: Set on 5 acres, Pondicherri is a small acreage landholding with a cluster of small buildings and exudes a rustic village atmosphere.   Its borrowed rural amenity and views are enabled as it is surrounded by much larger farming land, creating a quiet private oasis yet you are close to everything within the  Barossa Valley.  Some of the buildings are of historic interest and date back to 1845. The Barn is a single room building constructed with thick stone walls and exposed internal timber beams.  The building is aged well over 100 years.   We are not sure of its original use.   The Barn originally had the tiny window on the south side and one door many a year ago!   For those that do book,  look out for the circular patterns on the walls near the bed!   If only the walls could talk!!!    Today, the Barn  is furnished with a very comfortable super sized (mega) king bed - or can be separated into two king single beds - complete with natural fibre quality bed linens.    It has a smart TV w
neighborhood_overview: We are only 5 minutes drive to the pretty historic village of Angaston that is well serviced with a varied selection of cafes,  numerous restaurants ranging from great takeaways/dine in options to fine dining, 2 pubs, a florist, a supermarket, butcher, hardware, medical centre, post office, speciality Barossa food businesses and some retail therapy. We are 5 minutes drive from the famed Barossa Valley Farmers Market that is open every Saturday morning - that’s if you go the back way!   Just ask and we can tell you how!  There are many high quality wineries, restaurants, food establishments and historic buildings to explore across the region.    If food and wine are not your thing, there are numerous walking and cycling trails, some easy bushwalks including spotting kangaroos at Kaisersthul Conservation Park.    Or you could  go  ballooning or a helicopter ride for the birds eye view!     Just about everything except surfing!     We are only one hour's drive to the nearest South Austral
transit: Our property is accessible by car only.
access: The grounds are a work in progress.   We do apologise for now.    However,  your indoor space has everything you will need.     Always feel free to approach us should you require anything else.    Inside your room, a welcome folder has been provided for you to read at your leisure.  It contains our contact details,  information about us and the property and lots of information about the Barossa Valley for dining options, winery information and tourism opportunities.   We are more than happy to provide our personal tips too!  Just Ask! For your movie viewing,  a smart TV has been installed with access to NETFLIX.   Enjoy! Please ensure no packaging or products are disposed into the waste water system.  Please put anything in the paper bags provided in the bathrooms and place into the bins provided.  Extra paper bags can be found with the information stand.   If you need extra - Just Ask!!   No smoking under any circumstances in the rooms or bathrooms.    If you smoke, please smoke outsi
interaction: As much or as little as you please!  You are independent in our Pondicherri ‘village’ and we will always respect your privacy.
house_rules: Smoking is allowed only outside!  Please do not smoke under any circumstances in the Barn or the Wash House /toilet or bathroom.   Ashtrays are provided outside.
host_about: I love to travel but not enough. I love to cook and share my table with family and friends.  I love the smell of a freshly picked lemon and fresh herbs.  I love my little animals and the flocks of different birds that play and swoon across Pondicherri.   I’m social and then sometimes,  I’m a bit reclusive.   I love sunrises more than sunsets but both are spectacular and I’m lucky enough to experience and appreciate often.   I’m grateful for living in a place that affords  peace and privacy.   And I enjoy meeting people!  The  AirBnB adventure is a wonderful way to engage with many different people from far and wide.  To gain a deeper appreciation of the spirit of place - and it’s unique culture - staying with those who live there becomes a rich and memorable experience.  Welcome to our village.

name: 29 Jane
summary: 29 Jane is a lovingly renovated 1920s bungalow, in the heart of the Barossa. A short stroll from the main street of Tanunda and a few minutes by car to some of the best restaurants and wineries in the Barossa. The house offers 3 comfortable king bedrooms, modern fully equipped kitchen, a lovely yard and swimming pool. 29 Jane is owned an operated by one of the Barossa’s favourite chefs, Tuoi Do, who together with husband Grant Dickson own and run fermentAsian restaurant.

name: Goat Square Cottages - historic Menge Cottage
summary: Goat Square Cottages comprises three adjoining heritage stone cottages right in the historic heart of Tanunda in the Barossa. Your cottage is Menge Cottage. It has one bedrooms with a King and a separate lounge room. Each cottage has log fire, air conditioning, under floor heating, 2 person spa bath with shower over, kitchenette where provisions are left for you to cook breakfasts and a welcome bottle of Barossa wine. Free wi-fi is provided for websurfing and email download Escape to Goat Square
space: Your cottage was built in the 1850's and is on the Register of the National Estate.  Just because the cottage is one of the oldest occupied dwellings in the Barossa, it is not filled with antiques and Grandma's lace work. You will experience low height doors, heritage fittings matched with modern facilities. Goat Square Cottages have been providing cottage accommodation to guests for well over 20 years - you can be assured that your BnB experience will be top rate.

neighborhood_overview: Your cottage is right in the heritage heart of Tanunda - fronting on to Goat Square where the Ziegenmarkt (Goat Market) was held every Thursday. Its walking distance to the main street with the outstanding fermentAsian Restaurant and 1918 Bar and Grill.
notes: You can TRUST US - we started doing traditional hosted BnB in 1995 and opened our first self contained cottage in 1996. They were so successful we commenced the first Barossa Bed & Breakfast Booking Service in 1997. This property is part of a small collective called cottages4u - properties where we manage all the bookings and ensure guests have the best Barossa experience  Free wi-fi is provided for websurfing and email download. The access code is provided when booking confirmed
transit: The public bus operates from the main street (250 metres away) Onsite off street parking is provided for guests We suggest one of the local tour operators to take you around the Barossa - save drink driving and you get to learn a bit about wine food and history. Our favourite tour operator is Jonathon from Barossa Taste Sensations There are two local taxi companies
access: There is a separate laundry building with a washer and drier - plus an outside clothes line There are numerous fruit trees and guests are welcome to pick fruits in season
interaction: Your host lives nearby and will usually meet you on arrival (or soon after). She is only a phone call away
host_about:
Kim (together with his wife Malinda) founded the first cooperative of BnB cottage operators in the Barossa Valley back in 1997. While there are about 60 operators working with them through The Booking Service, a select few form the cottages4u collective. These are properties where the owners take a "back seat" role and Kim and Malinda, together with very capable local managers, present some of the best value Barossa and Burra accommodation.
Kim and Malinda have over 25 years experience in the BnB industry. They have lived 25 years and more in the Barossa and have strong connections in Burra (Malinda's Great Great Great Grandfather arrived there in the 1850's and Kim was Chair of the National Trust Branch for 3 years)
Now our two sons have grown up, had a good education and achieved great jobs, we love to travel ourselves and spend a lot of time in Asia - Viet Nam is our favourite!

name: Woodland Cottage
summary: Set between the Barossa and the Adelaide Hills wine districts with many wonderful wineries within easy reach, this European style log cottage on 20 tranquil acres allows you to see abundant wildlife and native plants - kangaroos, birds, ground orchids. 1km walking track on property, through natural bush settings. Other walking tracks in adjacent Mt Crawford Forest. Nearby towns of Birdwood and Mt Pleasant offer hotel meals, coffee shops and bakeries. Perfect place for a real Aussie experience.
space: Kangaroos and a wide variety of native birds (rosellas, cockatoos, wrens, robins, honey eaters etc) surround the cottage and come close to feed.
description: Set between the Barossa and the Adelaide Hills wine districts with many wonderful wineries within easy reach, this European style log cottage on 20 tranquil acres allows you to see abundant wildlife and native plants - kangaroos, birds, ground orchids. 1km walking track on property, through natural bush settings. Other walking tracks in adjacent Mt Crawford Forest. Nearby towns of Birdwood and Mt Pleasant offer hotel meals, coffee shops and bakeries. Perfect place for a real Aussie experience. Kangaroos and a wide variety of native birds (rosellas, cockatoos, wrens, robins, honey eaters etc) surround the cottage and come close to feed. The cottage is independent of the main house and provides a private space in which to relax. Guests are free to use the walking track on the property and can access the extensive Mt Crawford Forest via the Mawson and Heysen Trails. Birdwood houses the National Motor Museum, worth a visit for motoring enthusiasts. As well as wonderful wineries and restaur
neighborhood_overview: Birdwood houses the National Motor Museum, worth a visit for motoring enthusiasts. As well as wonderful wineries and restaurants throughout the region, there are other hidden gems such as the Applewood gin distillery in nearby Gumeracha and a fabulous local market on Saturdays at Mt Pleasant.
notes: We have a number of large dogs (Irish Wolfhounds) - but these are kept in their own space. Guests should not interact with the dogs without our presence.
transit: There is very little in the way of public transport available in this area.
access: The cottage is independent of the main house and provides a private space in which to relax. Guests are free to use the walking track on the property and can access the extensive Mt Crawford Forest via the Mawson and Heysen Trails.
host_about: Love living on our peaceful 20 acres of Australian bushland between the Barossa  and the Adelaide Hills wine regions. Happily married. Love dogs, bushwalks, Australian native orchids, willdlife, good wine. Love travelling, especially to Europe. My wife and I will try our best to give you a tranquil, comfortable Australian country experience.

name: Angaston Suite with Great Barossa Valley Views
summary: Contemporary decor with an elegant rural feel . This seven acre property, provides you with a beautifully appointed  completely self contained apartment with private entrance and no shared areas. The spacious bedroom has its own airconditioner,  ensuite bathroom with separate shower, a queen size bed and ample wardrobe and drawer space. There are two extra single beds available making it perfect if you are travelling with young children. Well behaved dogs are always welcome at Angaston House.
space: The open plan living/meals/kitchen has a slow combustion fire and ducted air conditioning with overhead fans provided in all areas if preferred. We can provide a range of dine in options - call Jane to discuss.  Also, enquire about bike hire, picnic hamper and our fabulous wine tasting experiences.

The spacious bedroom has its own airconditioner,  ensuite bathroom with separate shower, a queen size bed and ample wardrobe and drawer space. You can feel it in the landscape, in the
neighborhood_overview: There’s something very special about the Barossa. You can feel it in the landscape, in the people, the food and the wine. It’s a beautiful region, with villages, vineyards and farms dotting a patchwork vista. Barossans are famous for their generous hospitality, their love of a shared table and their passion for local food and wine. Festivals, celebrations, markets and music thrive here. Barossa is life’s great pleasures, in one unique place.  Every Saturday morning from 7.30am to 11.30am, you can taste and take home the best the Barossa has seasonally on offer. Over 50 stallholders provide a cornucopia of the freshest vegetables, meats, breads and cheeses. Delicious oils, preserves, and local specialities give you everything you need for your stay. The growers at the Barossa Farmers Market often pick their lettuce and tomatoes and other produce just the night before market, sometimes even that very morning. Many of them grow organically. This market, one of Australia's best is five min
notes: There is plenty of space, free WiFi (with excellent NBN connectivity), a Smart TV and tea & coffee making facilities. There is a full oven, a microwave and dishwasher.  Guests rooms are not automatically serviced daily.  Please advise if you require fresh towels or rubbish removal during your stay.  Guests staying more than seven days will have a complete change of linen and restocking of amenities on Day Seven unless you advise us otherwise.
transit: Angaston is a charming, bustling village of 2,000 people which today still proudly displays a unique, English-influenced character. It was named after one of South Australia’s founders, George Fife Angas, who sponsored many of the region’s early German Settlers. Home to the oldest public building in the Barossa and replete with beautiful examples of classic 19th century architecture, Angaston rewards a slower pace and an enquiring eye. Angaston is also a rambling food lover’s paradise, with some of the Barossa’s finest produce on display. The Barossa Farmers’ Market is an absolute must-see experience while a gentle stroll down Angaston’s elegant main street will reward you with vibrant cafés, homemade preserves and lunch options a’plenty. The southern end of Angaston is home to casa carboni, the Barossa’ very own Italian epicenter, where Chef Matteo offers cooking classes and a traditional enoteca, right next door to the Barossa Valley Cheese Company where you can taste a selection of
access: Guests can sit under shady veranda's or wander the gardens, cook a barbecue or use the well equipped kitchen. .
house_rules: - No noise after 10pm Small to medium sized well behaved dogs are welcome.
host_about:
Ian & Jane run two properties with Air BnB. One property in St Georges close to Adelaide and one in Angaston in the Barossa Valley.

Ian is a tour operator, an English teacher and an Air BnB owner/operator.

He went back to university and qualified as an adult ESL (English as a Second Language) teacher in 2012. He specialises in teaching to the IELTS English testing system for migration and university admittance.

We run tours into China, Myanmar (Burma), Tanzania and shortly to Cambodia. 

Ian is a member of Adelaide Toastmasters (public speaking) and Rotary International. We are both members of Adelaide Friendship Force ( an international travel club)

Ian plays tennis regularly and his passion lies in the discovery of different world cultures and experiencing those differences.

Jane, has owned and operated B & B's in South Australia since 2002 and has a strong tourism background. She previously Chaired the Bed and Breakfast & Farmstay Association in Australia, was Chair of Adelaide Hills Tourism, was a member of the South Australia Tourism Board and the South Australian Tourism Industry Council. She currently volunteers at the Barossa Visitor Information Centre to keep up to date with what is happening in her local region.

name: The Dairyman Barossa .. The Chaff House
summary: Exclusive self-contained Farm Accommodation set in the foothills of the Barossa Ranges. A fusion of heritage, functional architecture & edgy style, located between Lyndoch & Williamstown in the beautiful Barossa Valley. Take in the stunning views from every direction – vineyards, rolling hills & farm life. Enjoy an abundance of traditional  breakfast provisions straight from the farm.  (Hidden by Airbnb) for more information...thedairymanbarossa
space: The saying is true: the grass is greener on the other side, especially as you cross the paddock and unlatch the galvanised farm gate at The Dairyman’s Cottage entrance. This is Barossa country chic at its finest with a clean style that is as comfortable as it is design savvy.  This reinvented getaway dates back to the 1840s. Stretch out in the Chaff House, a workshop where grain was once crushed, or hole up in the Dairyman’s Cottage for a stay that shares a similarly unique past, operating more recently to milk cows. Both pads now make up a relaxed and unpretentious Barossa getaway and can be booked in conjunction with one another or as separate retreats.  Guests can quite literally wake up and smell the bacon, thanks to a healthy spread of breakfast provisions and other fresh produce that come directly from paddock to plate. And although your Barossa itinerary is likely to be teeming with sojourns to cellar doors and eateries, it's hard to overlook the peace that lazing in the shade o

interaction: Guests are greeted on arrival and invited to join us for the afternoon jobs of feeding the pigs and milking cows
host_about:
The saying is true: the grass is greener on the other side, especially as you cross the paddock and unlatch the galvanised farm gate at The Dairyman’s Cottage entrance. This is Barossa country chic at its finest with a clean style that is as comfortable as it is design savvy. 

This reinvented getaway dates back to the 1840s. Stretch out in the Chaff House, a workshop where grain was once crushed, or hole up in the Dairyman’s Cottage for a stay that shares a similarly unique past, operating more recently to milk cows. Both pads now make up a relaxed and unpretentious Barossa getaway and can be booked in conjunction with one another or as separate retreats. 

Guests can quite literally wake up and smell the bacon, thanks to a healthy spread of breakfast provisions and other fresh produce that come directly from paddock to plate. And although your Barossa itinerary is likely to be teeming with sojourns to cellar doors and eateries, it's hard to overlook the peace that lazing in the shade of the South Australian sun brings. Take in the rich pastures and surrounding panoramas of the grape-dotted Barossa Valley Ranges, by spending the evenings on the paved terrace with your feet up, sipping a glass of something smooth from neighbouring vineyards. 

It's instinctual to wander the working dairy facility, so why not introduce yourself to the residents on an afternoon farm walk and feed the heritage breed free-range pigs. And if there are any items you can no longer live without when back home, The Dairyman has an online shop to keep you stocked up on breakfast packs and more.

space: The saying is true: the grass is greener on the other side, especially as you cross the paddock and unlatch the galvanised farm gate at The Dairyman’s Cottage entrance. This is Barossa country chic at its finest with a clean style that is as comfortable as it is design savvy.  This reinvented getaway dates back to the 1840s. Stretch out in the Chaff House, a workshop where grain was once crushed, or hole up in the Dairyman’s Cottage for a stay that shares a similarly unique past, operating more recently to milk cows. Both pads now make up a relaxed and unpretentious Barossa getaway and can be booked in conjunction with one another or as separate retreats. host_about:
The saying is true: the grass is greener on the other side, especially as you cross the paddock and unlatch the galvanised farm gate at The Dairyman’s Cottage entrance. This is Barossa country chic at its finest with a clean style that is as comfortable as it is design savvy. 

This reinvented getaway dates back to the 1840s. Stretch out in the Chaff House, a workshop where grain was once crushed, or hole up in the Dairyman’s Cottage for a stay that shares a similarly unique past, operating more recently to milk cows. Both pads now make up a relaxed and unpretentious Barossa getaway and can be booked in conjunction with one another or as separate retreats. 

Guests can quite literally wake up and smell the bacon, thanks to a healthy spread of breakfast provisions and other fresh produce that come directly from paddock to plate. And although your Barossa itinerary is likely to be teeming with sojourns to cellar doors and eateries, it's hard to overlook the peace that lazing in the shade of the South Australian sun brings. Take in the rich pastures and surrounding panoramas of the grape-dotted Barossa Valley Ranges, by spending the evenings on the paved terrace with your feet up, sipping a glass of something smooth from neighbouring vineyards. 

It's instinctual to wander the working dairy facility, so why not introduce yourself to the residents on an afternoon farm walk and feed the heritage breed free-range pigs. And if there are any items you can no longer live without when back home, The Dairyman has an online shop to keep you stocked up on breakfast packs and more.

neighborhood_overview: There’s something very special about the Barossa. You can feel it in the landscape, in the people, the food and the wine. It’s a beautiful region, with villages, vineyards and farms dotting a patchwork vista. Barossans are famous for their generous hospitality, their love of a shared table and their passion for local food and wine. Festivals, celebrations, markets and music thrive here. Barossa is life’s great pleasures, in one unique place.  Every Saturday morning from 7.30am to 11.30am, you can taste and take home the best the Barossa has seasonally on offer. at The Farmers Market in Angaston. Over 50 stallholders provide a cornucopia of the freshest vegetables, meats, breads and cheeses. Delicious oils, preserves, and local specialities give you everything you need for your stay. The growers at the Barossa Farmers Market often pick their lettuce and tomatoes and other produce just the night before market, sometimes even that very morning. Many of them grow organically. This market,
notes: Upstairs rooms are not suitable for those who find it difficult to lift luggage upstairs. There is free WiFi (with excellent NBN connectivity), a separate lounge upstairs with  tea & coffee making facilities. Australian light breakfast provisions are provided in the dining room from 7am - 10 am.    Also, enquire about bike hire, picnic hamper and our fabulous wine tasting experiences. Guests rooms are not automatically serviced daily.  Please advise if you require fresh towels or rubbish removal during your stay.  Guests staying more than five days will have a complete change of linen and restocking of amenities on Day Five unless you advise us otherwise.
transit: Angaston is a charming, bustling village of 2,000 people which today still proudly displays a unique, English-influenced character. It was named after one of South Australia’s founders, George Fife Angas, who sponsored many of the region’s early German Settlers. Home to the oldest public building in the Barossa and replete with beautiful examples of classic 19th century architecture, Angaston rewards a slower pace and an enquiring eye. Angaston is also a rambling food lover’s paradise, with some of the Barossa’s finest produce on display. The Barossa Farmers’ Market is an absolute must-see experience while a gentle stroll down Angaston’s elegant main street will reward you with vibrant cafés, homemade preserves and lunch options a’plenty. The southern end of Angaston is home to casa carboni, the Barossa’ very own Italian epicenter, where Chef Matteo offers cooking classes and a traditional enoteca, right next door to the Barossa Valley Cheese Company where you can taste a selection of
access: Guests can access all public areas on the property ie gardens, two living areas and a dining room.

host_about:
Ian & Jane run two properties with Air BnB. One property in St Georges close to Adelaide and one in Angaston in the Barossa Valley.

Ian is a tour operator, an English teacher and an Air BnB owner/operator.

He went back to university and qualified as an adult ESL (English as a Second Language) teacher in 2012. He specialises in teaching to the IELTS English testing system for migration and university admittance.

We run tours into China, Myanmar (Burma), Tanzania and shortly to Cambodia. 

Ian is a member of Adelaide Toastmasters (public speaking) and Rotary International. We are both members of Adelaide Friendship Force ( an international travel club)

Ian plays tennis regularly and his passion lies in the discovery of different world cultures and experiencing those differences.

Jane, has owned and operated B & B's in South Australia since 2002 and has a strong tourism background. She previously Chaired the Bed and Breakfast & Farmstay Association in Australia, was Chair of Adelaide Hills Tourism, was a member of the South Australia Tourism Board and the South Australian Tourism Industry Council. She currently volunteers at the Barossa Visitor Information Centre to keep up to date with what is happening in her local region.

name: BarossaJourneys Townhouse: central & unique
summary: BarossaJourneys Townhouse is perfectly located for the exploration and enjoyment of Tanunda & the Barossa. Uniquely designed, this private & stylish townhouse, is in a quiet street in the heart of Tanunda, hardly  5 mins walk from cafes, restaurants, & other attractions. A secluded courtyard leads into a stunning mid-century, modern lounge/dining space. For cultivated, discerning couples seeking a serene & comfortable haven from which to explore Tanunda's cultural, culinary & wine attractions.
space: The flow-through townhouse design with its high-steepled ceiling, architectural-supporting angle beams, & decorative brickwalls, makes for relaxed and v comfortable living. The modern galley kitchen  fitted with all conveniences complements, overlooks and serves the lounge and dining area. Partly projecting over the ground-floor lounge/dining is a very spacious, north-facing sunlit mezzanine floor which contains the master (Queen) bedroom and smaller lounge/reading space. This is accessed by a feature spiral staircase (complete with a safety gate with soft-light movement on/off and non-slip steps and safety handle). Downstairs, past the bathroom/shower enter the TV/entertainment room which includes free INTERNET with Stan and Netflix streaming. (Although the sofa is also convertible as a comfortable posturepaedic, double bed, that allows total occupancy of 4, the townhouse is preferably occupied by just one couple). A separate study/dressing room provides built-in robes. French doors o

This is accessed by a fe
neighborhood_overview: BarossaJourneys Townhouse is located in central Tanunda, literally the heart of the Barossa. The neighbourhood has a very real and welcoming community. You will love the sincere friendliness of its locals! Stroll around the backstreets and enjoy the neat gardens, nineteenth-century villas, as well as heritage features such as the Lutheran churches and diversity of winery buildings, and even the medieval-style marketplace (Die Ziegenmarkt). Sit on a table on the pavement outside one of the cafes, or venture a little further to sample wines and culinary delights!
notes: BarossaJourneys Townhouse is especially comfortable and aimed at the single visitor or one couple. However, if necessary it is also versatile and can also accomodate three adults, or a couple and older child, or even two couples. For two couples, the sofa/bed will be made up available for your stay, as will be, of course, the main Queen bed on the mezzanine.
transit: Just stroll, everything you need is 3-15 minutes walk from BarossaJourneys Townhouse. Cars may be parked in the carport of the Townhouse, or on the street. Hardly 10 to 15/20 minutes drive takes you to most of the renown wineries and other sights of the Barossa Valley!  Help is always at hand with the Barossa Visitor's Centre in the main street for suggestions and directions about Tanunda and the Barossa and beyond! The Townhouse has its own secure private space for one car. More cars may be parked for free in the street. There is a taxi service in Tanunda. There are brochures for things to do, cafes, restaurants and winery locations, etc., provided in the study of the Townhouse for guests use.
access: All of BarossaJourneys Townhouse is available to my guests!  All appliance and conveniences are there for guests' comfort:  Split system heating/cooling, modern new refrigerator, large toaster, microwave, and all basic condiments: margarine, sugar, coffee, variety of teas, jams, etc, are for guests' use. When not out exploring, relax with your favourite TV series, documentaries, news etc via the free internet and streaming services. A DVD player &extensive DvD library, as well as a blue-tooth CD playing/radio, are also available. Enjoy relaxing/reading in the front or rear courtyard, or in one of the downstairs or upstairs  lounges. On warm days/evenings, enjoy  lunch or a meal in the front or rear private sunlit patios/courtyards.
interaction: BarossaJourneys Townhouse is for my guests' own private comfortable space to relax and enjoy as a home away from home, located centrally from which to explore and enjoy an exciting cultural region!  I am available to talk to my guests if they wish or need any advice or help.
host_about: Hi I'm a Cypriot-born Aussie, lived in Australia most of my life. I am a writer and cultural historian. For 8 years, I was the Executive Director of a  Multicultural Arts Centre in Adelaide. I purchased Ithaka Getaway Cottage over 10 years ago as I love the drive down to this spot at the tip of the beautiful Fleurieu Peninsula, where the Adelaide Hills meet the sea, and where the best views of Kangaroo Island are to be experienced. I also like to share and manage my other weekender, BarossaJourneys Townhouse,  located north of Adelaide in the famous Barossa Valley. I have a special attachment to this place as i have researched and written about this place for over 20 years. One of my books, 'Barossa Journeys: into a valley of tradition', has been just reprinted in its third edition. My long experience of this wonderful place led me to want to share the uniqueness & 'hidden' treasures of the Barossa with others. I wrote "Barossa Journeys" to tell the story of how this unique wine and cultural region came to be: not only its history of viticulture &  wines,  but also the story of the coming of the Lutherans & their foodways, customs, architecture and their folk tales; as well as their celebrations of harvest, music, gourmet and other festivals, and much, more! After many years of research and writing about this unique cultural region, I purchased a  townhouse of innovative design, located just 2 minutes walk from Tanunda's vibrant main street. My interests include philosophy, classical music (especially opera), reading, bushwalking,  yoga, and painting. I'm easygoing &  respect people's privacy and right to enjoyment. My life motto? Follow the Tao... And as Virginia Wolf said: 'something interesting happens every day...' Cheers Noris

Provisions are left for you to make tea and coffee. There are numerous breakfast cafes within a five minute walk.  Reverse cycle air-conditioning keeps the cottage cool in Summer and warm in Winter.  The outside area includes BBQ facilities, tables and chairs and sun soaked lawns. The garden opens on to the adjacent community parklands if you feel like kicking a ball or flying a kite!  Undercover lock up garaging is provided for one car. An additional vehicle can be parked in the driveway.

interaction: Your hosts do not live on site but are just a phone call away
host_about:
Kim (together with his wife Malinda) founded the first cooperative of BnB cottage operators in the Barossa Valley back in 1997. While there are about 60 operators working with them through The Booking Service, a select few form the cottages4u collective. These are properties where the owners take a "back seat" role and Kim and Malinda, together with very capable local managers, present some of the best value Barossa and Burra accommodation.
Kim and Malinda have over 25 years experience in the BnB industry. They have lived 25 years and more in the Barossa and have strong connections in Burra (Malinda's Great Great Great Grandfather arrived there in the 1850's and Kim was Chair of the National Trust Branch for 3 years)
Now our two sons have grown up, had a good education and achieved great jobs, we love to travel ourselves and spend a lot of time in Asia - Viet Nam is our favourite!

We enjoy Mountain Bike Riding (one much better than the other!) and our holidays are usually based around a MTB event and are a mix between camping and air bnb'ing.

name: 1910 Murray
summary: '1910 Murray' is situated in the main street of Tanunda, in the centre of the Barossa Valley. There is a 10 minute stroll to interesting shopping, many cafes, and award winning restaurants. Many wineries are nearby. '1910' Murray' is a blue stone fronted cottage, built in 1910. The interior has been totally renovated and modernised. The fun of the Vintage Festival Parade, and Tour Down Under, can be enjoyed from the cottage.   Be welcomed with a grazing platter, and a bottle of Barossa wine.
space: Enjoy luxury Belgian linen on all beds, and Aveda products in the bathrooms. Original paintings by Jacob Logos. Open fireplace in winter. Wide verandah with a hammock, and outdoor eating space in summer. Lawned area, gum trees, and bird life. Two modern bathrooms, one with a deep, freestanding bath.

Be welcomed with a grazing platter, and a bottle of Barossa wine. Enjoy luxury Belgian linen on all beds, and Aveda products in the bathrooms. Original paintings by Jacob Logos. Free access of the property. Barossa Tourism has a wealth of information to enhance your stay, including a calendar of events.  (Website hidden by Airbnb)

name: Copper House Kapunda Bagot Room
summary: Copper House, was built in 1880 and since renovated with elegance and an eye for comfortable accommodation. The verandas wrapping around the front of the house are adorned in ornate lattice and provide a shady terrace to take in views of the garden. This graceful home has three bedrooms with private spa baths, ensuites and two of the bedrooms have private lounge areas. A shared kitchen contains all the modern conveniences. The dining room has a beautiful chandelier and polished floor boards and the RC split system run throughout the home.  The Bagot Room has a Queen sized bed and ensuite with spa bath and faces the front rightside of the house.  The spectacular grounds surround this house with roses, boxed hedges and pathways to meander through and spots to sit and take it all in. A feature is the three tiered water fountain which proudly claims its place in the beauty around it. This stunning accommodation is the perfect, romantic escape, relaxing getaway or handy base for sightseeing

name: Charming Country Cottage, Barossa Valley
summary: Situated in a  little town of Lyndoch in the Barossa Valley, your country cottage offers picturesque view of the Barossa Ranges surrounded by vines. Ideal for couples in need of a relaxing time to chill and relax in a country escape. The interior decoration consist of French antique with a touch of modernism. A perfect place to wake up to sunrise from your front veranda with a cup of espresso and enjoy the sunset from the gazebo with a glass of shiraz!
space: A whole country house to enjoy and relax. Surrounded by beautiful vineyard and surrounding Barossa ranges. You have your own spa and shower, fully equipped  kitchen, lounge room and front verandah to enjoy the views. Close to wineries and award winning restaurants.

summary: Enjoy our home away from home. 3 minutes walk to restaurants, wine bars, coffee shops, pubs, clubhouse, boutique shops, supermarket and visitor centre on offer in the beautiful town of Tanunda. 3 bedroom fully contained home perfect for families, friends or a romantic getaway. Fully equipped kitchen with coffee machine, dishwasher, full fridge, microwave and some breakfast provisions included.
space: 3 bedrooms home serviced by 2 full bathrooms, 2 queen beds and a double bed. Fully equipped kitchen including dishwasher, coffee machine and microwave. Ducted reverse cycle air conditioning. Outdoor decking, single secured carport.

name: Fig tree Cottage
summary: Fig tree cottage is a  georgious 1840'S Stone cottage , set in the prettiest township in the Barossa. 2 bedroom, 1 bathroom for up to four people. - Lovingly restored 1840s stone cottage in the township of Angaston. - 2 queen bedrooms - Self-contained, provisions for cooked or continental breakfast provided - Open fireplace and beautiful cottage garden. - Close to wineries, galleries, antique shops
space: Fig Tree is a charming, stylish, fully renovated two-bedroom cottage centrally located for you to explore the Barossa wine region. Situated at the quiet end of the main street of Angaston, this classic late 1840s cottage features modern and comfortable décor as well as a fully fenced, level backyard.
description: Fig tree cottage is a  georgious 1840'S Stone cottage , set in the prettiest township in the Barossa. 2 bedroom, 1 bathroom for up to four people. - Lovingly restored 1840s stone cottage in the township of Angaston. - 2 queen bedrooms - Self-contained, provisions for cooked or continental breakfast provided - Open fireplace and beautiful cottage garden. - Close to wineries, galleries, antique shops Fig Tree is a charming, stylish, fully renovated two-bedroom cottage centrally located for you to explore the Barossa wine region. Situated at the quiet end of the main street of Angaston, this classic late 1840s cottage features modern and comfortable décor as well as a fully fenced, level backyard. Access – We have a key safe at the rear of the property, so access is easy. We can be contacted on (PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN) or via email (EMAIL HIDDEN) Shops, just a short walk away include a butcher, great bacon, baker, pharmacy, ATM's and supermarket that's open until 8.00 all within a 5 min walk
neighborhood_overview: Angaston known as the Jewel of the Barossa offers a great diversity of restaurants, cafe's, a cooking school and Taste Eden Valley, a tasting room featuring wines exclusively from Eden Valley. Easy access to the other towns of the Barossa is within a 8 minute drive which opens up this great wine and food region. Don't forget the Farmers Market every Saturday, do some shopping, have some breakfast and cook up a great dinner in the modern kitchen, Or, let us get the chef to do that for you!
notes: Kate and Jonathan have lived locally for many years. They are well known characters. Should any need arise they can assist with suggested itineraries. Otherwise you will have the house to yourselves and will not be disturbed Please do give us a call if you do require anything.
transit: There is a taxi service but no Uber available in the area. As a special offer to our guests we can arrange a private wine tour for the day guided by Jonathan from Barossa Taste Sensations and your host at Fig Tree Cottage. Drawing on over 10 year experience  the tour focuses on the boutique wineries that highlight the diversity of this great wine region.
access: Access – We have a key safe at the rear of the property, so access is easy. We can be contacted on (PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN) or via email (EMAIL HIDDEN) Shops, just a short walk away include a butcher, great bacon, baker, pharmacy, ATM's and supermarket that's open until 8.00 all within a 5 min walk.  Our accommodation offers fully equipped  kitchen facilities with inside and outside dining areas .

name: Hikers Heaven Spacious Country Bohemian Vibe
summary: Welcome to our beautiful and historic township of Freeling! Our home radiates the historic charm of The Barossa region, with a relaxed Bohemian twist. Within easy driving distance of the world renowned Barossa and Clare Valley wine regions, you are perfectly located to fill your days with more wine than your taste buds can cope with. You will be central to many great Hiking experiences, some of which include The Lavender and Riesling Trails and magnificent Flinders Ranges are just up the road :)
space: The "Happiness" Room A magnificent example of the craftsmanship of the early Australian Pioneers. This gorgeous old stone cottage is decorated with a bohemian twist, making it a comfortable and eclectic space with many quirky and unique features.  Set up with a comfortable queen pallet bed with beautiful thick mattress, plus a king single vintage iron bed. The lounge room is air-conditioned and has a combustion stove, the bedroom has a ceiling fan. Tea and Coffee are supplied. There is plenty of room to spread out and relax after your fun-filled days. A place you will always want to come back to. Multiple rooms available Please check out my other listings; The "Love" Room https://www.airbnb.com/29915383 The "Peace" Room https://www.airbnb.com/29916072

neighborhood_overview: Freeling is a lovely town, located just 45 minutes north of Adelaide.  It is know for it's agriculture and because of the beautiful countryside, was featured in the smash hit Australian Television series "McLeod's Daughters". The township is fairly quiet with a few local shops and a couple of friendly pubs. Wandering the streets is a must :)
notes: Services at Freeling The Wholesome Living Store: Wednesday to Monday 9am – 5pm Supermarket: Monday - Saturday 7am - 6pm & Sundays 8pm - 5pm The Gungellan Pub: Monday - Sunday 11am - 12am The Freeling Hotel: Monday - Sunday 11am - closing times vary The Freeling Community Pharmacy: Monday - Friday 9am - 6pm (Website hidden by Airbnb) Saturday 9am - 12.30pm
transit: Walking around in town is  by far the best option. There is no public transport available, but only a 15 minute drive to the train station that can take you directly to Adelaide city in 45 minutes.
access: Lounge room, kitchen, bathroom, laundry and outside areas are shared by guests. In line with my environmentally conscious philosophies, my Wholesome Living Store is located next door to the AirBnB. So, all shampoos, soaps and detergents used in the home are ethically produced and environmentally safe. Feel free to join me in The Wholesome Living Store for a cuppa or just come have a wonder and say Hi!
house_rules: Please be respectful of the shared spaces.  Cleaning the kitchen and common areas as you use them would be appreciated by everyone.
host_about:
A well traveled, carefree gypsy who has plunged into the business world with my eyes wide shut. The Universe is generally good to me, having met some amazing people throughout our wide and wonder filled world. Now, it's time for the many other amazing people out there, to come to me.
A thoroughly Aussie girl with my family roots in Scotland. In my youth, I lived and traveled all over the UK and then jumped the channel to Europe, visiting many wonderful countries and making many lifetime friends. A highlight of my travels was an unplanned walk of The Pyrenees mountains, something I hold dear to my heart to this day.
I have seen a lot of this vast and boundless country and am more than happy to help with your trip planning, and can offer plenty of advice of what the see and do in not only our local area, but well beyond. 
I had a dream of offering goods, services and educational classes in a store that was in line with my own philosophies. Being passionate about the environment and the planet, it was important to provide ethical products. 
Early this year I secured an old building in Freeling, putting my dream into action. The Wholesome Living Store and AirBnB has arrived.

name: JOHANN'S COTTAGE
summary: "JOHANN'S COTTAGE" located in the world renowned Barossa Valley wine region. Steeped in history this Germanic Cottage dates back to the 1860's and offers boutique self-contained accommodation. Perfectly positioned in the main street of Tanunda only a short walk to restaurants, shops, wine bars, hotels and more.  Central to the entire Barossa wine district. Perfect getaway for the romantic couple. Private front and rear access with plenty of off street parking.
space: Welcome to Johann's Cottage, an 1860s german cottage located at Tanunda in the heart of the beautiful Barossa Valley, an historic town with a rich german heritage.   The cottage has been completely restored and refurbished with quality furnishings. Two large bedrooms,  a queen size bed in each bedroom with quality linen provided sleeps up to four people. The bedrooms offer high ceilings and generous storage space.   A surprisingly spacious cottage, with a comfortable lounge room with open fireplace, quiet sitting room and study with desk (Website hidden by Airbnb) The modern kitchen is equipped with stainless appliances, water filter and a Caffitaly espresso capsule machine. The bathroom hosts original deep bath tub with shower over bath. Separate toilet and laundry area with european front loader washing machine. Reverse cycle heating and cooling gives you all year round comfort. The courtyard area is perfect for relaxing on the deck with a  glass of your favourite wine. Ample onsite
description: "JOHANN'S COTTAGE" located in the world renowned Barossa Valley wine region. Steeped in history this Germanic Cottage dates back to the 1860's and offers boutique self-contained accommodation. Perfectly positioned in the main street of Tanunda only a short walk to restaurants, shops, wine bars, hotels and more.  Central to the entire Barossa wine district. Perfect getaway for the romantic couple. Private front and rear access with plenty of off street parking. name: Marananga Cottages - Molly's Courtyard Suite
summary: Marananga  Cottages offer stylish accommodation in 3 self contained self catering suites in a quiet location in the tiny village of Marananga.  These are places for those who appreciate the best. The apartments are spacious, comfortable  well equipped. Each has it's own lounge area, ensuite bathroom, kitchen area. Nothing has been overlooked in offering you a perfect place to stay in the Barossa. Molly's Courtyard Suite looks out to landscaped courtyards.

host_about:
Kim (together with his wife Malinda) founded the first cooperative of BnB cottage operators in the Barossa Valley back in 1997. While there are about 60 operators working with them through The Booking Service, a select few form the cottages4u collective. These are properties where the owners take a "back seat" role and Kim and Malinda, together with very capable local managers, present some of the best value Barossa and Burra accommodation.
Kim and Malinda have over 25 years experience in the BnB industry. They have lived 25 years and more in the Barossa and have strong connections in Burra (Malinda's Great Great Great Grandfather arrived there in the 1850's and Kim was Chair of the National Trust Branch for 3 years)
Now our two sons have grown up, had a good education and achieved great jobs, we love to travel ourselves and spend a lot of time in Asia - Viet Nam is our favourite!

name: Copper House Whittaker Room
summary: Copper House, was built in 1880 and since renovated with elegance and an eye for comfortable accommodation. The verandas wrapping around the front of the house are adorned in ornate lattice and provide a shady terrace to take in views of the garden. This graceful home has three bedrooms with private spa baths, ensuites and two of the bedrooms have private lounge areas. A shared kitchen contains all the modern conveniences. The dining room has a beautiful chandelier and polished floor boards and the RC split system run throughout the home. We offer a self catering full breakfast. Whittaker Room is positioned at the rear of the house and has a private courtyard and outdoor bath and shower. This Queen bedroom has an ensuite with spa bath and a private lounge area. The spectacular grounds surround this house with roses, boxed hedges and pathways to meander through and spots to sit and take it all in. A feature is the three tiered water fountain which proudly claims its place in the beauty

name: Angastons Rusty Olive, Barossa Valley B&B
summary: The Rusty Olive is an intimate Lovers retreat nestled in the heart of Angaston, one of the most beautiful towns in the Barossa Valley wine region. Come and relax under the rustic pergola area and cook yourself a tasty gourmet breakfast with some local produce supplied, on the outback BBQ.
space: The Rusty Olive offers a functional kitchen with a dishwasher and coffee machine. Provisions are supplied for a  cooked breakfast, made form the best local produce, on the first morning of your stay. Absorb the ambient beauty of the bathroom where you can relax in a Cast Iron, claw foot bath or a spacious shower, alone or together. In the bedroom you will find an inviting king bed for a cosey night stay. Kick back and relax on the comfy lounge with a book or  watch a good movie on the smart TV with Netflix. Two toilets, one indoors and one rustic outhouse.

name: Whiterocks Barossa - classic bungalow
summary: This beautifully presented white sandstone and red brick Bungalow was built in 1935 and is located within walking distance of the main street of Tanunda.  The impressive main entrance is through a glass door and hallway of grand proportions as is to be expected in a home of this era. The front hallway has an ornate dome and stunning chandeliers giving you a glimpse of what is still to come....
space: The large bedrooms flow from the main hallway, two with ornate fireplaces and original features including a window box seat in the master king size bedroom. There is one new bathroom plus an additional toilet. White Rocks has been painted in neutral tones accentuating the dark wooden features of the windows, skirting boards and woodwork throughout the house.   The ornate features of the house continue into the lounge area which is a light filled room with a large box seat under the main window. With a large slow combustion heater for keeping you warm during the winter months and the original stained glass doors and ornate fireplace this room reminds you of the grandeur of the home.  The centrally located dining room comfortably seats six and has a fourth ornate fire place.  A wine room flows through from the dining room and into the large cellar.  The kitchen has been newly renovated and has clean modern lines with everything that the discerning chef is looking for including the 900 wi

name: Master Suite - Angaston House
summary: Opened early February 2019 and as a result we are offering a greatly reduced nightly rate which will only be available for a short time.   The Master Suite is located on the ground floor with views overlooking the garden and the Barossa Valley. It has a very spacious newly refurbished bedroom with a walk in dressing room and en-suite bathroom, separate shower and spa bath.  There is a myriad of deluxe touches that make this accommodation perfect for a special occasion.
space: Relax in the cozy 'snug' area complete with Smart TV and slow combustion fire as part of your private accommodation  Loads of space - suitable for a family of four or less with a sofa bed available in the main bedroom. The property is peaceful and tranquil, situated on seven ares with magnificent views across the Barossa.

An outdoor BBQ area is the perfect place for watching the sun set over The Valley. There’s someth
neighborhood_overview: There’s something very special about the Barossa. You can feel it in the landscape, in the people, the food and the wine. It’s a beautiful region, with villages, vineyards and farms dotting a patchwork vista. Barossans are famous for their generous hospitality, their love of a shared table and their passion for local food and wine. Festivals, celebrations, markets and music thrive here. Barossa is life’s great pleasures, in one unique place.  Every Saturday morning from 7.30am to 11.30am, you can taste and take home the best the Barossa has seasonally on offer. Over 50 stallholders provide a cornucopia of the freshest vegetables, meats, breads and cheeses. Delicious oils, preserves, and local specialities give you everything you need for your stay. The growers at the Barossa Farmers Market often pick their lettuce and tomatoes and other produce just the night before market, sometimes even that very morning. Many of them grow organically. This market, one of Australia's best is five min
notes: The air conditioner control panel is located in the main hallway of the house, on the right hand side as you come down the stairs (next to the laundry).  Please do not alter the temperature. The unit works best between 23 & 25 degrees. PLEASE TURN THE AIR CONDITIONING OFF WHEN YOU LEAVE THE HOUSE. We operate on rain water so keeping showers short would be greatly appreciated. There is an enviro-cycle in use for our waste water which does not tolerate chemicals – please do not put anything into this septic system that is not human waste.  We are keen recyclers.  In your fridge you will find provisions for what we call a light Australian breakfast: bread for toasting, butter, spreads, cereals, milk, tea/coffee, orange juice.  Call or text us at anytime if you require anything. The Visitor Centre at 65 Murray St, Tanunda is a mine of information: call them on (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) if you need any info on the region.
transit: Angaston is a charming, bustling village of 2,000 people which today still proudly displays a unique, English-influenced character. It was named after one of South Australia’s founders, George Fife Angas, who sponsored many of the region’s early German Settlers. Home to the oldest public building in the Barossa and replete with beautiful examples of classic 19th century architecture, Angaston rewards a slower pace and an enquiring eye. Angaston is also a rambling food lover’s paradise, with some of the Barossa’s finest produce on display. The Barossa Farmers’ Market is an absolute must-see experience while a gentle stroll down Angaston’s elegant main street will reward you with vibrant cafés, homemade preserves and lunch options a’plenty. The southern end of Angaston is home to casa carboni, the Barossa’ very own Italian epicenter, where Chef Matteo offers cooking classes and a traditional enoteca, right next door to the Barossa Valley Cheese Company where you can taste a selection of
access: Kitchen facilities including dishwasher, coffee machine, oven and hotplates.  An outdoor BBQ area is the perfect place for watching the sun set over The Valley.
house_rules: - Quiet time after 10pm please
host_about:
Ian & Jane run two properties with Air BnB. One property in St Georges close to Adelaide and one in Angaston in the Barossa Valley.

Ian is a tour operator, an English teacher and an Air BnB owner/operator.

He went back to university and qualified as an adult ESL (English as a Second Language) teacher in 2012. He specialises in teaching to the IELTS English testing system for migration and university admittance.

We run tours into China, Myanmar (Burma), Tanzania and shortly to Cambodia. 

Ian is a member of Adelaide Toastmasters (public speaking) and Rotary International. We are both members of Adelaide Friendship Force ( an international travel club)

Ian plays tennis regularly and his passion lies in the discovery of different world cultures and experiencing those differences.

Jane, has owned and operated B & B's in South Australia since 2002 and has a strong tourism background. She previously Chaired the Bed and Breakfast & Farmstay Association in Australia, was Chair of Adelaide Hills Tourism, was a member of the South Australia Tourism Board and the South Australian Tourism Industry Council. She currently volunteers at the Barossa Visitor Information Centre to keep up to date with what is happening in her local region.

Walking distance to the township to enjoy coffee shops, bakeries, boutique / novelty shops, hotels & many wine bars. A quiet neighborhood to rest after your day out exploring the many vineyards/wineries the Barossa Valley has too offer.

name: The Villas - Barossa. Peace. Beauty. Simplicity.
summary: Located in the heart of iconic Seppeltsfield Road,  The Villas - Barossa provide the perfect home for exploring the nearby cellar doors, premium dining experiences and gin distillery and for walking or cycling in the stunning natural environment.    Comfy lounge, French linen sheets, soak tub - inside, The Villas provide a relaxed, intimate space. The beautiful natural landscape integrates seamlessly with the restful interiors of The Villas, offering a true bush retreat.
space: The Villas offer beautiful, environmentally sensitive accommodation in a striking bush setting. Reflecting the region's agricultural roots, The Villas harmonise unique architectural design with simplicity and warmth, creating a peaceful, secluded Barossa retreat.  Comfy lounge, French linen sheets, soak tub - inside, The Villas provide a relaxed, intimate space. The decision will be hard to make - explore all that the Barossa has to offer, or curl up with a book, take time to reflect and lose yourself for a while? Perhaps all of the above!! A fully equipped kitchen is stocked with abundant local produce for you to prepare your breakfast, and there are excellent breakfast options in nearby cafes. The Villas are bathed in light, from the first rays of sunrise streaming through the floor to ceiling glass to stunning sunsets retreating to the west. The beautiful natural landscape integrates seamlessly with the restful interiors of The Villas, offering a true bush retreat. Set along a ridge

The decision will be hard to make - explore all that the Barossa has to offer, or curl up with a book, take time to reflect and lose yourself for a while? Perh
neighborhood_overview: Marananga is a delight to explore, set amongst beautiful rolling hills and vineyards.  The village is home to numerous cellar doors, five within an easy walk of The Villas.  The award-winning Seppeltsfield Road Distillers are our near neighbours, and the renowned restaurant Appellation at The Louise is also within walking distance. A drive along Seppeltsfield Road's iconic avenue of palms will wind you through the vineyards of the western Barossa with its well-known wine brands and intriguing small batch wine producers.  Historic Seppeltsfield Estate is home to Seppeltsfield Winery, Vasse Virgin, Jam Factory Art & Design Studios and Fino restaurant.  Just around the corner you'll discover Hentley Farm Cellar Door & Restaurant.   If you're looking for some adventure, try ballooning or a Segway, helicopter or trike tour.  Or maybe a sunset cruise in a Mustang? Beyond Seppeltsfield Road, the Barossa is a wonderful playground.  More than 170 wineries, with 80+ cellar doors, amazing culinar
notes: The Villas - Barossa offer a secluded private retreat for couples, rather than a destination for families. Children and infants cannot be accommodated.
transit: The Villas are an easy one-hour drive from Adelaide.   Head north along the Northern Expressway, which becomes the Sturt Highway.  Take the Greenock / Seppeltsfield exit towards Seppeltsfield.  You are now on Seppeltsfield Road.  Continue along approximately 7 km to Marananga village, and look for the roadside number 468.
access: Complimentary wireless broadband internet.
house_rules: Check in is from 3pm, and check out is by 11am. Guests are requested to contact the property at least 24-hours before arrival (contact details are provided in your confirmation e-mail) to arrange check-in.

name: Light Pass House BnB - a nostalgic Barossa  home.
summary: Relax in this comfortable 1930's home decorated with antique furniture and old wares. Positioned in a tranquil garden setting in the historic village of Light Pass, 2km from Nuriootpa in the Barossa Valley. Sole occupancy, catering for up to 4 adults. The 2 bedrooms incorporate two queen sized beds and a bunk bed. Ducted reverse cycle airconditioning, with a slow combustion heater for extra cosy winter nights. Breakfast provisions included.
space: Self catering breakfast provisions include bacon and eggs, bread/margarine/spreads, cereals, juice, tea/coffeee/milk.
description: Relax in this comfortable 1930's home decorated with antique furniture and old wares. Positioned in a tranquil garden setting in the historic village of Light Pass, 2km from Nuriootpa in the Barossa Valley. Sole occupancy, catering for up to 4 adults. The 2 bedrooms incorporate two queen sized beds and a bunk bed. Ducted reverse cycle airconditioning, with a slow combustion heater for extra cosy winter nights. Breakfast provisions included. Self catering breakfast provisions include bacon and eggs, bread/margarine/spreads, cereals, juice, tea/coffeee/milk. Wireless internet is available. For your convenience there is a second toilet, - besides the toilet in the main bathroom. The second bedroom has a queen bed, but also bunks which are ideal for children - or young at heart adults. We can accommodate a maximum of 6 people, but 4 adults is probably a comfortable maximum.

name: Magpie House
summary: If you want to be close to Tanunda's finest restaurants and within walking distance to bars, shops and Cafes in the main street, you can't get a better location than this! The gates to Tanunda Oval - colloquially known as Magpie Park - are metres away. At Magpie House you will be close to everything and stay in comfort. Leafy garden setting,  fully equipped for short or long stays while you explore the Barossa region.
space: Central location means you can walk to Fermentasian Restaurant, 1918 Bar & Grill, the famous Apex Bakery, The Clubhouse licensed community club and Z Wines (for a wine tasting and platter).  Our favourite shops nearby include Living By Design ,Wohlers Homewares & Furniture ,  Alabaster Barossa,  Elemental and A Time for Seasons. Enjoy our outdoor area with BBQ facilities or head out for meals... it's your choice to relax!
description: If you want to be close to Tanunda's finest restaurants and within walking distance to bars, shops and Cafes in the main street, you can't get a better location than this!
